After downloading the last update I can no longer accurately log food, either by searching or scanning barcodes. The app will delete certain entries or change them to something else. I hope this will get resolved soon or I‚Äôll have to look into another app. The last update doesn‚Äôt seem like it‚Äôs impacted any other features badly, only the food logging.
Used to be a good app I like that I can track my steps, daily exercise, and food all in one place.

I‚Äôd be lost!!! I‚Äôve had a FitBit for a number of years. I upgraded to my Charge2 a couple of years ago!  And I‚Äôd be absolutely LOST without it!!  I track my daily steps, my sleep‚Äîwhich is super important to me since I have sleep apnea and use a CPAP every night!‚Äîand my heart rate!!  The best thing about my FitBit is that I get notified of all my text messages and especially phone calls coming in!!!!  Since everyone gets TONS of unwanted calls, I‚Äôm able to screen my calls without getting my phone out of my purse or running to get my phone just to find that it‚Äôs a call I don‚Äôt want to take!!!  My FitBit has helped simplify my life in many ways!!  I‚ÄôD BE LOST WITHOUT IT!!!!!!!üëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèºüëçüèº

Thoughts on my Fitbit I am a newbie to Fitbit and not a big health fanatic. My husband bought it for me for Christmas. I like the convenience of having all my activities tracked and that I can scan codes on the food for my food intake. One thing that bothers me about the food intake is; if you get busy and forget to put anything down to eat that day, you can‚Äôt put it in the next day. You lose that day once it hits 12:00 midnight. If you have put something down, you can go back to that day anytime you want, just not if you haven‚Äôt put anything down. This is why I gave it four stars.

1 more to the MANY reviews about synching Hating this app right now. It doesn‚Äôt synch. My Alta HR doesn‚Äôt even show up in Bluetooth devices. Completely incompatible with the new iOS 13 update. Really?!?  This is horrible. I just got it and what an awful experience this has been. You guys better fix this issue quick or you‚Äôre risking losing tons of people. Hurry up! There are plenty of cheaper trackers out there and their apps are working. It‚Äôs a shame for you.

Love the functions, but ugly app I love my fitbit (Alta HR) and all the functions the app has. Its convenient to be able to log all this health data in one place, and it makes it easier to make connections between changes. Its easy to use, and I‚Äôve never had difficulties with connecting my fitbit to the app.

Used to be a fan I've been a dedicated Fitbit user for almost five years now. In this time, I've seen a lot of app changes. The current version is far and away the worst. It tracks some Fitbit version of a sleep score weekly instead of the time spent sleeping. Not helpful or usable data. The app now functions primarily to sell you more things, constantly inundating you with cleverly disguised ads for their premium service using the same look as their health insights. Mechanically, the sync feature is always trying to pull old/less used Fitbits instead of the one with the current data. It's almost enough for me to consider switching to an Apple Watch. ::gasp:: Considering you can't sync with Apple Health and it doesn't connect to other third party apps, the Fitbit, especially it's application, feels like it's pushing users away.
Love the app This is a very good app love it.

Frustrated but then good again This app has been great up until a couple days ago when the time change on my fit bit. I synced it over and over again but the time was still wrong. Then the app kicked me out and made me sign back in. Which made me really mad. I eventually fixed it but it took a long time. In addition to this problem, the new update on the Fitbit stopped working in the middle of the process now my Fitbit won‚Äôt work. When I try to update it again it stays at the spot and doesn‚Äôt move no matter how long I wait.
Good, but could be better I like that I can log my water, sleep, food, and exercise in one fairly intuitive app, but it‚Äôs missing a few things it could definitely use.

Judy The Fitbit and App is one of the most outstanding products of technology on the market today. The Fitbit includes pertinent tools to guide and monitor daily health goals.  It is designed to act as a personal health coach. The feature that displays incoming texts or calls from  your smartphone is very valuable. This prevents you from missing important calls that you may not hear.  The daily calorie intake journal has an unlimited data base of foods for logging daily meals. I find the monitor for sleep especially helpful and very interesting. There are many other features that I haven‚Äôt mentioned. The Fitbit has become my daily companion. It calls me by name. Wish I had bought stock.
More than a Basic Health Monitor I love tracking my sleep with my Fitbit!  It‚Äôs made me become so much more aware.  I‚Äôve cut my caffeine intake and changed my bedtime.

Great, useful app I enjoy this app and have been using it for over a year. It works great for what you want and it is user friendly. I give this app 5 stars because it rarely fails to do what I need it to. The only issues I've ever had are some minor lagging issues with syncing and Bluetooth between the phone and the watch.

Issues GALORE I have had Fitbit for a few years now. Up until I received a Charge 3 for Christmas, I had no problems with the app or the Alta HR that I had. Since the changeover to the more expensive and versatile Charge 3, I have had many issues that have not been resolved.

Worthless, baseless sleep score I'm having a hard time understanding how Fitbit feature developers totally ignored the fact that over 1.5 million people in the US have pacemakers. People like me have a preset lower limit that prevents your heart rate from going below a certain number. So, there is little or no variation in my heart rate when I sleep and no way for the Fitbit to use heart rate differences to calculate a score. Unless Fitbit decides to make this feature optional - will look at other brands of smart watches.

Not as good as it once was I got a charge 3 in late April 2019 and have really enjoyed using the app and gps tracker for my walks.  It has definitely helped me achieve my goal of 5 days walking per week.  I also have really liked the heart rate monitor stats and sleep tracker.  Things changed in late July however when the app stopped logging my heart rate stats with all of my GPS walks.  After reviewing the help forums it is clear that this is not an isolated problem with my tracker or app.  I really hope they fix it soon and bring back the heart rate stats associated with my gps walks.  Before this happened I would have given the app between 4.5 and 5 stars.  Now it is just a 3.  When my tracker finally goes kaput I will likely look at other brands if this issue has not been fixed.

Remove Sleep Score I‚Äôve only had a Fitbit for a little over a month and was really enamored with the app. Of course it could use some tweaking like included decimals to the tenths in the averaging of miles (as many other fitness apps posses), but overall it presented useful information. The sleep tracking was a new tool to me and I really appreciated seeing how many hours I slept and the breakdown therein. That is, until recently when they updated their app to display an arbitrary sleep score.  I could understand it being somewhere in the back of the sleep section, but to be the foremost display when all I really want to see is hours slept is a bit obnoxious. I now have to dig for the information I want.

I love it! This is the only fitness tracker app I‚Äôve ever used. I got my charge 2 for Christmas (for myselfüòú) this year dec 2017.  I‚Äôve only experienced one glitch, and that was Monday night when it didn‚Äôt track my sleep.  But last night it worked soooo....????  It was the night of an app update so I was really worried, especially reading all the recent negative reviews of the new update.  Other than one glitch, all the features have been really helpful.  Even the new period tracker is pretty useful.  I used to track it myself on my iCal (painful counting tiny squares on my iPhone), so if this proves accurate it‚Äôs one more thing I don‚Äôt have to do manually on my iPhone iCal.  üëçüëç

alarm issue I love using the Fitbit app in compatibility with my Fitbit watch. My only complaint is that the app will only allow eight alarms to be created at once and after that, I cannot even access my alarms to check which ones are on or off. (e.g. I guess I had seven alarms created because, today I wanted to take a nap so I set an alarm for the time when I wanted to wake up- therefore creating an eighth alarm- and now when I click ‚Äúadd alarm‚Äù (which is always what I click to access my alarms) it won‚Äôt give me access and simply displays a message along the lines of ‚Äúyou can only create 8 alarms, please delete one before creating another‚Äù which I would happily do, if only I had access to my alarms in the first place.)

Fitness Star Before Fitbit, I would work out with no specific goal in mind and didn‚Äôt pay attention to my heart rate.  4 years later and 35 lbs lighter, I have a daily, weekly and monthly goal!  Fitbit takes care of the details while I work on getting myself in the best shape of my life.  I‚Äôve not only whipped myself into shape but also met some amazing people that I compete in weekly challenges with that I now call friends.  I would‚Äôve never guessed that a device like this would‚Äôve had such an impact on my life but it has and I‚Äôll continue using Fitbit and bragging about it for the rest of my days!  Thank you Fitbit, you really did change MY life!
Great but not happy with app at the moment! I have had my Fitbit charge 3 since October 2018. So far I love it. Gets me motivated. The app was great until this last month.

Great! But please fix this. I‚Äôve used the Fitbit as an aid to lose 30 pounds after my first pregnancy, and now I‚Äôm at it again after my second! Whoo hoo! However, I find it very frustrating when I try to adjust the start date of my weight goal. Instead of letting me adjust it to the appropriate date (that is, when I started losing weight, which was before I set the goal on Fitbit), it resets it to the current day - today, erasing my previous progress and calling today‚Äôs weight my starting weight. That‚Äôs discouraging. Please make the date actually adjustable (as it appears to be). And please let us know if/when you change it so I‚Äôll know it‚Äôs ok to touch that again without risking losing my progress.

Not good for cyclists Frustrated by the bicycling options with this app. I have the Blaze and it frequently loses connection with my phone and GPS and doesn‚Äôt track my heart rate well. For example Incan arrive at work after a sweaty 40 minute ride and I show zero active minutes whereas when I take a short walk with my dog, never breaking a sweat and never getting out of breath I log a solid 10-15 active minutes. Clearly something isn‚Äôt tracking correctly there.

New FITBIT Information Page Design Unfortunately, I believe this will be like the launch of the ‚ÄúNew COKE‚Äù several years ago.  Coca Cola wanted to get people jazzed about their brand again and nobody except the Coke management wanted it.  I, like many others loved the previous layout and functionality.  I am sure some very hard working software engineers put in long hours to develop this program.  However it is a program people obviously do not want based on the FITBIT App forum.  It appears to be running about 90% dislike.
Great watch  / can‚Äôt reply simple texts Just synced my watch with my iPhone 10.

Updates are always lousy I intentionally did NOT update on iPad since I despise the new update.  Somehow Fitbit forced the update onto the iPad. I am confused how this can happen when I do not have auto-updates.  With each update Fitbit becomes less and less the company I first purchased from.  The community boards are full of user complaints and the common company response is too bad for you all.  When it comes time for this family of users to acquire new fitness devices- Fitbit will not be on our list.  This current update makes the dashboard look like a child‚Äôs app- tiny print, ridiculous graphics and they did away with the celebrations for achieving daily goals.  Which is why the majority of their users purchased the devices in the first place.  This is not at all the first time they have taken away encouragement and achievement celebrations.  Just not user attentive AT ALL

Love this app but it stopped working! :( I want to give this 5 stars but at the moment I cant even use it! I‚Äôve been using my fitbit alta nonstop for the past 3-4 months, I love this thing! But today for some reason I cannot get the app to work. I have an iphone 7, and I‚Äôm not quite sure what to do. First the app would couldn't sync to my fitbit, then the app would crash when I tried to open it. I deleted the app and reinstalled it and now it will open but keeps giving me a notice that says ‚Äútile migration failed‚Äù. I don't know why this is happening, my phone is up to date and I have internet access. My alta is in perfect condition. Please help! This thing has helped me lose 8 so far and I would love to continue... :(

Fair to Middlin‚Äô As Fitbit is the only tracking device I‚Äôve tried and have been using for the last 3.5 years and my second device is nearly ready to be buried with my first I feel I can give an honest opinion. The devices only charge efficiently for a little over a year then they decline rapidly at which point they also seem to stop connecting to the app efficiently.   I guess this is how they force us to upgrade. The phone app goes through cycles where it logs me out every couple of days and forces me to sign back it. Although not detrimental definitely irritating and unnecessary as I have my phone locked and no personal info connected to my Fitbit account.

Security risk The Fitbit app on the iPad is attractive and informative.  It does not work alone but requires being paired with a computer.  But that does not work unless the computer has a USB dongle.  And, most seriously, all of this will not work if you intend to keep your personal privacy and security protected or selective.  In all, just under 80 ‚Äúentities‚Äù gained access to my computer through the Fitbit Connect app.  Since I would not allow anyone to invade my life so irresponsibly, I stripped a second computer, and set it up to see why my security software was preventing the Fitbit from working.  Voila!  My CPU suddenly was 80% engaged at 7GB working to try to feed all these companies information from my computer.  I had not done a secure erase, but no matter as my life is very dull.  It is the principle of allowing a ‚Äúhealth and fitness‚Äù company to ‚Äúgive away‚Äù my data that offends me to the core.  I reject this kind of exploitation.

Fresh Start I bought a Surge back in 2016, but only used the device/iOS app for a year before putting it away for well over a year. Now I‚Äôm getting back into the swing of things and have been using Fitbit again for the last month. My problem is I want a ‚ÄúFresh Start‚Äù with my logs, trophies and any other data that‚Äôs been stored BEFORE a particular date WITHOUT losing the data AFTER that particular date. I have made great stride this past month and want to keep those logs as a motivator to keep pushing forward. I don‚Äôt want to have to delete and restart my entire account over again. I would likely switch to Apple Watch or some other device if that were the case. I‚Äôd rather stick with Fitbit if I‚Äôm able to save my recent data while purging the old data.

Quality deterioratingüò¢ Gifted an Alta loved it! Upgraded to charge 3 worked great for 6 months one of the app updates killed it ! Still tracks but screen is black. Called customer service got free exchange exactly 1 month later exchange just died battery wont charge.. downgraded to inspire hd ; waterproof hr..a lot cheaper now this 3.15 update is all whacked activity time is wrong. Has me doing aerobics in my sleep won‚Äôt track heart rate during activities..Stop messing with a good thing and go back to the version from 2 yrs ago! I never had any of these issues until all these recent updates. Wondering if this is all about trying to get customers to go premium? For the amount of money spent on these devices just give us what we paid for and leave the app alone already!

The food tracker could be simplified... I too love my Fitbit and wear it 24 hours a day.  My issue is that the food tracker is needlessly difficult.  Each list: recent, favorites, and custom need an edit button.  I‚Äôve turned to online articles, but they don‚Äôt match my app.  The ability to watch for a 500 calorie deficit with an accurate calorie burn make this devise great.  Just help me fix my errors with an edit!

New Design The new design/update is pretty atrocious and a huge downgrade from the previous version. It makes me not even want to open the app and keep track of everything even though I‚Äôve been doing so well.

New Updated App is Horrible Fitbit is forcing all existing users to the ‚Äúnew‚Äù app it is horrible.  The main screen went from a clear, concise and visually appealing look to an ugly non-user friendly piece of junk.  The data fields all smaller and you have to scroll and click through links to get to info that used to be all on the main screen!  The app is constantly having glitches with all sorts of data affected.  Challenges used to be fun, but now users can‚Äôt preview the challenge and it‚Äôs so irritating having the challenge front and center on my home screen.

Pretty great, could be better Overall I love my Fitbit Ionic. I love the sleep tracking and heart rate monitoring, as well as all the cool fitness features. I‚Äôll absolutely be buying a smartwatch in the future.

Mostly Good Generally, I like this, even the new format once you‚Äôve rearranged the page to make more sense. But I still have notifications from last October through mid-December, nothing newer, and no way to clear them. (Developer tells me it‚Äôs designed to always display the most recent 100 notifications, but these are NOT the most recent, they are from last fall.)

Love almost everything I love my Fitbit, however I personally have to set small goals and that includes with my weight loss so I don‚Äôt get overwhelmed with the amount I need to lose. It would be really nice if when you change you goals it didn‚Äôt restart your progress for amount lost. For example I started this journey in December and have lost 40lbs but when I changed my goal to about 15lbs less then current weight tonight, it now is starting my progress counter at current weight so I can‚Äôt easily see how much I‚Äôve lost since the beginning without doing the math on it(who has time for that). When going to the help chat don‚Äôt expect much in the way of help, I know I didn‚Äôt get a whole lot.

So far so good..!! Bought the Fitbit Blaze to help with my New Years resolution to get some more exercise.  So far so good.  I liked the easy setup and the charge seems to last quite a few days.  The Fitbit software is laid out well and appears to show me all I need to know in an easy to view app on my iPhone X.  Looking forward to losing a few and feeling better.  The subtle ‚Äúencouragement‚Äù you get from the software is just what I need to keep me going.  It looks like the Blaze along with the Fitbit software will help me achieve the goals I have set.

Landscape views on iPad I got my Fitbit charge 2 in January, mainly for the sleep tracking.  I also have come to appreciate the step counter and the exercise reminders.  What really annoys me is that the dashboard cannot be viewed in landscape mode ‚Äîexcept for a few screens.  I use my iPad with a keyboard to view the dashboard.  It is incredibly cumbersome to try to look at the screens in portrait orientation.  This is the only app I have that does not automatic reorient to a landscape view.  It can‚Äôt be that difficult to do if every other apple app does it.  There are all kinds of comments from users on the community board asking when Fitbit will update its app so that landscape viewing is possible.  As far as anyone can tell these comments are being completely ignored by the company.

Fitbit HR 3 Reason I got fit bit over an Apple Watch or other fitness watch is because it keeps track of your heart rate all day and gives you an over all calorie burn number, which is really cool in my opinion. tracks sleep too, which is awesome. It automatically calculates active minutes when you‚Äôre heart rate is in ‚Äúfat burning zone‚Äù. The only issue i have with it is sometimes I have to manually put my active days in! Even though ill like take a CrossFit class and my active minutes are at like 110, the app still won‚Äôt count it as an active day? It‚Äôs weird. I had both the earlier versions of Fitbit hr- and this one is vastly superior and doesn‚Äôt have any of the previous issues I had come to expect.
Most of what I want I like my Fitbit Alta A LOT. Counting steps are

My #1 App! I‚Äôve been a Fitbit user now through several models of their devices (currently ‚ÄòCharge 2‚Äô). Fitness is an integral part of my life and the device and the app allow me to track every aspect of my health and fitness.

Great App I have had the Aria scale for three years and the Ionic for about two years.  The scale is great. I have no suggestions to make it better.  It‚Äôs easy to set up and I‚Äôve had no connection problems. Recently changed my wi fi router and had no problem connecting to it.  As for the Ionic, it also is a great product. Two things I would like to see. 1. A comment section on each exercise so I can enter my personal comments about the exercise such as weather or how I felt. 2. Use the camera to scan barcodes for the nutritional value of foods. I‚Äôm 58 years old and not impressed with many tech gadgets but I like and Use the Fitbit products nearly everyday.

Making a Difference My doctor suggested that I start getting more sleep and exercise so I got my Fitbit out of the drawer and put it back on. My objective is 7-1/2 hours of sleep a night and 10,000 steps per day. The genius Fitbit figured out that I didn‚Äôt get to bed early enough so it tells me when to get ready for bed. I‚Äôve increased my sleep by an average of 45 minutes per night so far. The step counting has kept me strongly motivated. I get 10,000 steps by 9:00 am usually and frequently get the day up to 15,000. I‚Äôve had an Apple Watch. Aside from a bad service experience, I don‚Äôt want my wrist ringing or email bugging me all day on my wrist. This Fitbit is excellent.

Love and suggestions I cracked the face on my Charge 2 so I upgraded to the 3 and I LOVE IT.  The interactive screen is great and it‚Äôs very ez to learn.  There are only s few things that could be a tiny bit better.

It‚Äôs bugging me! I loved the app and my Fitbit.  A few friends and I do a workweek challenge, and sometimes a weekend challenge. It‚Äôs fun...BUT now the journal for our challenge is a mess. The words are cut off at the top and the sentences aren‚Äôt complete. It will say, ‚ÄúThat step goal was no match for‚Äù but I have no idea who it was because the sentence stops there. Or it will read, ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs gonna be a close call between Name and‚Äù but it stops there, another incomplete sentence. It‚Äôs like it only has one line and anything longer cuts off. It didn‚Äôt use to be that way.

Inconsistent I bought my Fitbit Versa watch primarily to monitor steps and sleep. The steps/heat rate part of it is working great; however, the sleep is extremely inconsistent and inaccurate. While I understand that it is not expected to be 100% accurate, I do expect it to log things as they occur. Some days it will log my regular sleep, and a random sleep during the day (when I was actually active); some nights it will provide detailed info (REM, deep sleep, etc) and other nights it will not, even though nothing changed between the two nights; some nights it will provide a sleep score, other nights it will not. It is always random, no set pattern as to why some days it does/logs things and other days it doesn‚Äôt.

Love the Fitbit Charge2 HR & the Fitbit App My wife & I have both had our Fitbit & the App, for less than a month. (I wanted to wait for a short time before writing a review to have at least a little experience before providing info of our use)

Great Customer Support Several years ago I bought a fitbit, but it quit working within a month or so of using it. I was in the middle of moving from Hawaii to Washington, so I didn‚Äôt have a chance to deal with the problem in a timely manner. A year later, I contacted customer support to close my account. They said they would, but they asked me why I wanted to terminate my fitbit account. Upon telling them my story, they offered to replace my fitbit at no charge. I agreed to keep my account open and received my new fitbit that worked like a champ.

Challenges are SO BORING and haven‚Äôt changed in years! Fitbit, we‚Äôre sick of step challenges. There‚Äôs nothing exciting or motivating about doing ANOTHER Weekend Warrior step challenge with the same tiny handful of people (10 max? Really?) Each of the four challenges offered is the exact same - step total, with the only variant being what days of the week it takes place during. Can we PLEASE get some Active Minutes challenges so that those of us who, say, bicycle or swim for activity can be included? I simply don‚Äôt believe that creating these types of challenges would be any massive obstacle to the app developer. Your suggestion board is riddled with literally (go count!) thousands of your customers asking for this simple challenge enhancement. Please pay attention to them; many of them are growing bored, myself very much so.

The Gift That Keeps On Giving This Fitbit was a surprise gift for me which I thought was a sweet idea but a waste of money since I am intentional about exercise BUT was I wrong!!! I love the celebration vibrations on my wrist, being able to judge how much exercise I‚Äôve gotten and best of all is knowing how much I‚Äôve slept. Working on this sleep issue for brain health for years now and it‚Äôs so hard to keep track of times you wake up and go back to sleep without totally awaking. You can create PTSD from worrying about going back to sleep and create a bigger problem. Now I just let the Fitbit do the job for me and work on my awake activities to be more balanced. Thank you!!!

Great Fitness App Can‚Äôt say there is much the app doesn‚Äôt do that I would want it to do, especially in relation to what the device is capable of.  Refreshes well and is pretty simple to navigate. Allows you to customize the dashboard a bit to your liking and put the things important to you up front. The only thing I could wish for are links in the app that have a little more detailed description to how some of the readings are calculated. For example, the fitness score, which is really a VO2 max estimation is given. Curious what is used to arrive at this calculation?

20 False weigh-ins daily to delete on my own I love Fitbit. But for some months now I have had an issue where somehow 15-20 false weigh-ins appear in the app DAILY. Let‚Äôs say that Wednesday night I deleted all the false weigh-ins for that day. Then Thursday night I delete all the false weigh-ins for Thursday. Friday morning when I check again more false weigh-ins show up for both Thursday and Wednesday. These are ‚Äúcopies‚Äù of previous weigh-ins that show up continuously, same time-stamp, same weight. I have other apps that rely on this info from Fitbit and this issue throws things off for me with these other apps. I contacted Fitbit two months ago. Their response? ‚Äú We‚Äôll keep an eye on it. For now delete them on your own‚Äù. I am a patient person. I don‚Äôt like to complain. I like to do my part to help. But at this point this is ridiculous and I‚Äôm tired of it. Fitbit, you may very soon lose a long time customer.

Steps...back Cannot stand the newest version. One reason is now I get a daily and weekly sleep ‚Äòscore‚Äô instead of just providing the average amount of time I spend sleeping. ‚Äú82‚Äù versus knowing this week I averaged 7 hours of sleep...is not helpful. I don‚Äôt need grades, I just want actual data. Layout/visual changes are all pointless and have made something I‚Äôve come to rely on and look forward to using feel janky and foreign. Can bugs and improvements be made without overthinking/rethinking the whole thing ever? Enough pop up tips and suggestions too. Have to swat these away too often when I just want to see the dashboard. Think about users! Should be two for the newest version, but gets a 3 because overall I love Fitbit. Big step back though.

Bring back the old interface or bring the green success color back! The new interface is fine, I suppose, once you get used to it. But the one thing I still can‚Äôt get used to is the intro of all the new colors for when you achieved a goal. I‚Äôm used to everything turning bright green when you achieve a goal, and now it‚Äôs either blue, purple, or orange depending on the stat. This means I have to process 2 additional colors before I can see what goals I‚Äôve achieved. It‚Äôs a small change, but the app conditioned us to feel accomplished when we achieve a goal and the stat turns green‚Äîwhy change that and force us to condition to a new set of colors instead of just one?

Unfriendly to the Vision Impaired The app used to be one of the best I‚Äôve ever used until a recent ‚Äúdowngrade‚Äù.  Things started going downhill about three weeks before the new app auto-installed.

Slow, if it works at all I'd gotten used to my Fitbit app taking forever to load my data‚Äîtaking long enough that I'd frequently open the app, start it syncing, and go back to something else for five minutes until it was (hopefully) done. With the most recent update however, it doesn't load at all. Sometimes I'll thumb through past data while I wait, but now when I try to refresh and sync, the app freezes entirely and I can't scroll or access any other tabs or screens. After several minutes, it then crashes. When it works, I like being able to look through my data (though I've always wanted to be able to zoom in on my heart rate or sleep or workout tracking to get more detail). But not being able to sync my data any more undermines my entire decision to buy a Fitbit and makes this pretty useless to me.

Life saver!! I cannot express how dependent I have become to this little device. It reminds me to move, has inspirational messages throughout the day, helps me to monitor every facet of my personal fitness and dietary needs, and does a great job analyzing my sleep.  It is packed with information you can use to lose weight, increase your fitness level, monitor calorie input and output, etc. in a tiny, comfortable package.  I must confess, I did replace the plain plastic wrist strap for a Milanese chain link replacement watch band which looks wicked and keeps my vanity in good standing.  The Fitbit Charge 2 was the best lifestyle change I have made in two years!!  25 pounds lost and still going!

Potential issue I purchased my iPhone XR over a week ago. I setup my 2yr old Fitbit a few days ago. This morning I opened Fitbit app before my 6am weight training to check my challenge stats. 35min later I come back to my phone and the case is hot and the battery went from 100 to 50%. I was at the gym; therefore, connected to Verizon data. Back home, I couldn‚Äôt get the phone to charge and I couldn‚Äôt shut it off. Uninstalled Fitbit, took a shower, checked and the case had cooled-off, but I still couldn‚Äôt shut off the phone. Had to put the phone in airplane mode to get it to power off. Reinstalled Fitbit now. Not sure if this is a Fitbit issue.

My Fitbit My brother gave me his old Fitbit when he bought a new one. The face was cracked, but it worked fine. Now I am passing that Fitbit on to my sister because my daughter got a new model and gave me her old one. This device has definitely helped me exercise my arthritic knees more. When I got the device, I was surprised to learn that I was walking only about 500 steps per day. Now I walk about 1500 on a bad day and sometimes as much as 6000. That may not sound like much to some, but its a great improvement for me and my knees feel better. I also like the feature that allows me to monitor my sleep habits and the one that keeps track of my heart rate.
More family competitions! Dearest Fitbit,

Girl at Heart I enjoy being a part of Fitbit community! I appreciate the reminders to get moving 10 minutes before the hour when I‚Äôve been sitting too long. The challenges from friends inspires me to move a little more than I would on my own. I also appreciate a place to record my water intake as I often lose track of that, even though sometimes I still don‚Äôt get it recorded. It helps keep me striving. Its interesting to check out the sleep app and keeps me accountable to regular hours of sleep. Now I want to get more regular in my strength training. Even though I‚Äôm over 65 years old it has been a gift to keep me moving! =)

Premium to see my own HR 1. I‚Äôm all OK with premium paid options to watch videos, guided programs, etc. But I‚Äôm REALLY NOT OK with Fitbit charging 10 dollars/month so I can see a CHART with my own HR at night. It cost you CERO dollars to chart my own generated data. You don‚Äôt provide any analysis or conclusions. It‚Äôs just a chart. You are hijacking data generated by me and stored in a hardware device that I fully paid for.
New UI = Uck New ap UI is terrible. Managed to take something with clean design and easy to view snapshots and make it cluttered and clunky.

Not A Fan Of The Update Enjoy the watch and use it constantly. Even use it to improve sleep quality, so obviously it rarely comes off. Normally, I don‚Äôt review apps, life is hectic who has time when your happy with something. So, before today I‚Äôd have given it 4 stars probably, the newest version is less useful. I always believe if I have to update something it should at least be more useful. The things I want to know, I could tell at a glance before. I need to click and delve now to find the same information. It now harder to find the info that use to be right there, particularly the 250+ steps per hour. The previous version made it very clear where you stood. Now you can still find whether you need to walk now or later, but not at a glance. Overall guess I just like the previous version. This one I‚Äôm just not a fan of, hopeful that it will grow on me.

Long time user I am a long time user of the FitBit app as well as different trackers. Currently using the charge 2 and it still works great. Overall no complaints with the product for my everyday uses. I like that it has a stopwatch and use it at work often. I also love that it syncs with health plans for rewards.

New UI for home dashboard is step backwards The UI update for the home dashboard is less useful and manages to show less information. I use Fitbit for primarily tracking sleep and the old UI design surfaced more information with a glance. The old tile design showed more tracking categories on the dashboard without making me scroll, the new dashboard UI now makes me scroll down to see the same amount of categories. The old dashboard UI for the sleep tile showed the sleep details within the home dashboard tile donut. The new dashboard UI Sleep row icon simply shows a solid purple donut and doesn't relay any information about my sleep quality. Please do not bury the information that is important to us. It makes me question if the Product Manager actually UX tested the changes before pushing this through dev and making it live in Prod.

Works great with one device not multiples Overall, I really love my fitbits and I love my app. The only thing I wish it had was a way to select which Fitbit I have as active. That way if I'm not wearing one it doesn't erase my steps by writing in the unused one. This has happened multiple times and I know I'm not the only one with this problem. I know some like the convenience of not having to manually put in which Fitbit they're using but I would prefer to have that as an option.

Great app with a few minor flaws The FitBit app is a great way to get healthy/healthier. It tells you how you have been sleeping, it can set alarms, it even gives you challenges to do with your friends. However, when you connect your device with Bluetooth to the FitBit to sync up, it drains the battery on both the FitBit and your device. I learned that when I got the FitBit yesterday and my battery drained a lot, as well as the battery on my phone. Also, you have to download FitBit Coach if you want to get al of the perks, which some people don‚Äôt want to do. I don‚Äôt want to download an entire different app when I can just track my steps on this app. This app is a great and simple app that I use everyday.

Sleep isn‚Äôt tracked as well when sick I love my Fitbit and every thing about it. I have the charge 2, it‚Äôs perfect for me because it has everything I want and it‚Äôs still a pretty small size. I have been sick a lot recently and I have noticed that when I go to check how much sleep I got it either doesn‚Äôt show up or it only gives me partial sleep analysis. This makes sense because it tracks your sleep with heart rate and my heart rate has been elevated since being sick. Maybe there should be a way to indicate if your sick or not so the tracking can continue. That‚Äôs the only problem I have had with my Fitbit so far and it‚Äôs not that big of a deal and it‚Äôs probably not the apps fault either.

Graphs and internet The app is put together okay, but there are two mind-bending deficiencies. Mind-bending because when you run across them you just can‚Äôt imagine why things have been set up this way.

New to Fitbit I finally broke down and bought a Fitbit just yesterday. I had been asking friends who had one  what they thought about it. One friends hadn't been wearing hers lately, so I checked to see if dissatisfaction was the reason before I purchased mine. She said it wasn't and that she would be wearing hers again soon for the summer. So far, I have tracked my steps and saw how many times I was restless during sleep. I use a different app for tracking food/water, but I am looking forward to using Fitbit for activity. Goal=10,000 steps a day. It will take a while to build up to that but I can do it! The bracelet fits well, too--not too tight.

Fitbit Versa Battery fail and great service to replace it. I have had my Versa since June 2018 with no problems until these past two weeks. The battery barely lasts 2 days now. I have no alarms, turned off sleep, and have limited the sync and battery still drains quickly. I have also done the reset. I gave both of my daughters a versa for Christmas and I don‚Äôt want them to have issues. I am not happy with my battery draining so fast.

Terrible for macros and no recipes Very upsetting to discover that I can‚Äôt see my totals for saturated fat, sugar, fiber, salt or anything except protein, carbs and overall fat. And those are not accurate. The macros don‚Äôt change with the serving size. If you eat half a serving, it counts the macros in a whole serving. It‚Äôs just a calorie counter. That isn‚Äôt helpful at all if you have life depending diet restrictions. It‚Äôs important for a health app to include accurate totals for all nutrients. If people don‚Äôt realize it‚Äôs wrong, they are risking their lives using this. People have asked that it be fixed for years and fit bit acts like it‚Äôs some new extra feature to add. It isn‚Äôt. It‚Äôs what is expected and needed. I certainly expected them to have an app that at least did what every other macro counting app can do. Be aware that most users have to use an outside app to keep track of recipes and count macros.

Used to be great, now not so much I loved my Fitbit and the app for a couple of years‚Äîit synced perfectly, and really helped to motivate me to exercise. However, since the update a few months ago, it‚Äôs basically nothing more than a watch. The app takes forever to sync, and I have to do it multiple times to get things to actually update. Hope you have patience I honestly like the App.   My versa does everything I want it to do. The issue with Fitbit is that every time my iPhone gets updated Fitbit software has issues. My problem is that I wanted my watch for three reasons; steps, text and call notifications. All notifications work except text messages. This is the second time it‚Äôs happened. Fitbit can‚Äôt seem to get it fixed. Very disappointed. Fitbit keeps asking me to be patient.  I‚Äôve been patient but now is just annoying. Absolutely HATE sleep score Specifically got my Fitbit to track my sleep and heart rate due to health issues and was very happy till the latest update. I‚Äôm not remotely interested in being graded on my sleep, and even less interested in paying to see what sort of nonsense that inaccurate score is based on.

Awesome! Except.... I love everything about the fitness tracker I have (Charge 3) as well as the app! However, I don‚Äôt think there is a way to make it track my fitness by my schedule. For example, I work night shift so my workout is from 11pm-around 12:30 or 1am. So mid workout my calories and steps are tracked on the next day instead of the previous. Not a huge deal. Just not very accurate for daily steps/calorie tracking. If this could be added somehow to have a sort-of ‚ÄúNight Owl‚Äù setting where you work out at the transition of a day, your workout and steps before you sleep could be tracked for the previous day, it would be 5 stars for sure! Either way it‚Äôs still pretty cool.

Best fitness app!! I have a Fitbit charge 3 so it syncs with the app when I have it pulled up and it‚Äôs so convenient. Some of the features of the app that I love are that it counts my macros (by percent). I‚Äôm not one to necessarily count calories anymore (it didn‚Äôt work for me & everything is different for each person) so now I‚Äôm counting my macros and it helps to loose weight and get a leaner body! Also, I love how the Fitbit app has groups you can join and a community where you can see everybody‚Äôs progress and keep each other encouraged. There‚Äôs so many features on this app , I could go on and on, but overall such a great app; I definitely recommend it!!!

Here to Stay! I joined FitBit in 2015. In 2017 I took a 6 month hiatus to see if the Apple Watch was better. Nope! Not only did I come back because the FitBit is a better & more accurate fitness tracker but the app itself is way better IMHO.

Horrible experience I used to love my Fitbit and the app. However when I switched to an iPhone and switched to a new watch, after a few weeks I could no longer receive notifications and I have to manually sync my data on the watch to the app. I have gone through all the steps multiple times. Reached out to support and followed their directions without success. Finally I was told they are aware of the issue and are working on it. My last email has gone unanswered when all I asked was ‚Äòdo I just have to deal with this issue as is?‚Äô Prior to this issue, I would have given Fitbit 5 stars. I loved the platform but when I upgraded everything, my experience is negative. I wanted to stay with Fitbit instead of switching to an Apple Watch. Hopefully this gets fixed before I make the change. Dealing with this for a month is ridiculous.

Great, only a few complaints My Fitbit Flex 2 is awesome, very sleek and the waterproof feature is excellent. The app is fairly user friendly, although the most recent update (early/mid August 2019) made the app much LESS user-friendly and more time consuming as the different icons, such as hourly step goals, require you to actually go into the icon to check your stats as opposed to previously being able to open the app, refresh, and quickly glance at the home dashboard to get an idea of where you‚Äôre at. One of my only other wishes is that they would add a macronutrient tracking feature (breakdown in grams, not just percentages) since I am currently having to use a separate app for that.

New version sync problems Usually very pleased with my Versa and the app. But it seems every time they push an update there are sync problems. Didn‚Äôt have any problems until last night. After the app updated I keep getting dropped sync. Try all the instruction on how to reestablish sync and it works for a couple minutes then sync fails again. What it even more frustrating is that when to Versa can‚Äôt sync it will lose time. The Fitbit hasn‚Äôt been able to sync in a coupe hours and now it‚Äôs 6 minutes slow. Now it‚Äôs not even usable as a basic watch. I‚Äôm sure they will fix it in a few days and it will work pretty well until the next app update and then the frustration will start all over again. Very poor quality control in Fitbit‚Äôs software update process.

No more text When I first got my Fitbit I was able to get my texts on the screen. When apple did the IOS 13 update I no longer have that feature. I called Fitbit after numerous time of trying to get the text feature back but to no avail, it didn‚Äôt come back. After talking to someone at Fitbit and they tried to find out how to fix it and talked to other associates they couldn‚Äôt fix it. Now mind you I‚Äôve been on the phone for about 1/2 hour. Finally the person called support as I patiently waited on the line, they came back on the line and told me that there‚Äôs a problem and not sure when it was going to be fixed. On the Fitbit app it‚Äôs says that the IOS update may have made issues with some notifications. My husband got a Fitbit Charge 2 and after setting it up the text feature works just fine. WHY THAT ONE AND NOT MINE???? Please explain

Done with Fitbit I‚Äôm honestly over Fitbit. I‚Äôve updated my phone to both of the new iOS updates and updated the Fitbit app, but I still am not receiving text notifications on my Charge 2. My heart rate monitor is no longer working and the app isn‚Äôt syncing correctly. It shows that I‚Äôm at 15% battery even though my battery is at 95%. It‚Äôs only good for alarms and tracking my steps. You guys said you were working on it, but it‚Äôs been a couple weeks and has yet to be fixed. I‚Äôm ready to shell out the money for an Apple Watch because at least it‚Äôll do what my Fitbit should be doing and I know it will work. Truly not happy with the company especially when the new Fitbit app update says that you worked on something other than the problem that many people are complaining over. Please get it together and listen to your customers.

Buggier than previous versions I‚Äôve had a Fitbit for a while and currently use a Charge 3. It has trouble syncing at least once per week and it has a lot of issues with the sleep function. The problems aren‚Äôt from tossing and turning too much or wearing it too loose, since I keep it the same tightness all the time, and I know I hardly moved at all last night. I slept a good 7 hours last night but it isn‚Äôt showing any sleep. I‚Äôm not sure what caused the sleep analysis to fail, but it does quite often. I‚Äôve tried closing/reopening the app multiple times, and even deleted / reinstalled the app, but nothing.

Almost perfect Mostly good. Wish the period prediction feature would adjust itself when you modify entries. Also wish my Fitbit (I have it paired with my Inspire HR) would adapt to the menu scroll order to the order I set on the dashboard. I‚Äôd really like to have the hourly step counter first right after the main face display cause I use the detailed display which already shows most of what I have to scroll past to get to the hourly goal screen.
What happened to current reviews? Update 3-5-18 Never syncs exercises to My Fitness Pal anymore?? I have to enter them manually into MFP. What happened?

Great app One feature, the women‚Äôs health tracker, is really great, but seems unfinished. This feature helps track menstural and ovulation cycles. The feature works great. I believe it even helped me get pregnant. But there isn‚Äôt a way to input a pregnancy. The app just keeps annoyingly trying to predict cycles. I just removed it from my dashboard and still use the rest of the app‚Äôs features and love them. The app already allows users to edit their cycles. It seems like allowing users to enter their due date would be an easy fix. Plus, the app would have a huge superiority to other pregnancy tracking apps that don‚Äôt allow moms-to-be to track nutrition, exercise, weight, water consumption and mother‚Äôs heart rate.

Love it Been using fitbit for a while. I upgrade every year or two to the next model. No complaints on the product or the app. It‚Äôs motivating to track my activity and I love that I can see it all with a tap tap! Some think that it‚Äôs a bit masculine looking but there are so many different bands you can buy now for each model, many of them are very sleek. The app sometimes takes a while to sync but nothing that can‚Äôt be fixed with rebooting the app. I love all of the new features for women. Tracking that part of my life is SUPER helpful. All in all, I highly recommend this app and the fit bit products. Thumbs up.
Love my Fitbit but there is one thing I don‚Äôt Love! I love my fit bit app and all that it offers me and I  use it every day, for every aspect that it offers.

Tracker Options Fitbit is amazing. I've used a variety of trackers and seem to end up always making my way back to Fitbit. They have a great sense of community and it's nice to compare stats with friends. This app allows me to gain access all that Fitbit has to offer. One thing that I would like to see in the future is the ability to use my Apple Watch to track my steps. FITBIT ! Replace your software management I have been wearing a Fitbit since April 2014, updating it almost yearly. Over the past 3 years the software they have passed off to us has deteriorated. I changed my Alta to a Charge 2 because it was giving me 1500 to 2500 less steps per day than my Apple Watch. Then again earlier this year to the Charge 3 because the data from it was not syncing properly with the Dashboard. This Charge 3 is even worse, it rarely will sync with my iPhone or iPad and when it does it NEVER transfers all the data between them and the Charge 3. 6 out of 7 days a week I meet my Hourly Activity goal of 14 in 14 hours, but the Dashboard shows I rarely achieve my goal. FITBIT NEEDS TO FIX THIS SOFTWARE. I WOULD START BY FIRING THE SOFTWARE MANAGER AND GETTING SOMEONE WHO KNOWS WHAT THEY ARE DOING!!!

Needs a bit more! It‚Äôs a pretty ok app. I don‚Äôt feel like upgrading to premium has been worth it yet but I‚Äôm still learning. I started logging food on the app and thought it was easy but I need a more complete break down of nutrition. I am bummed that it only counts total carbs!

2019 Changes The second half of the year had some changes in the overall look of the app that I didn‚Äôt really like. The dashboard changed to be a scroll through instead a grid view. It also made it more pushy on purchasing their premium ‚ÄúFitness Coach‚Äù setting, which I don‚Äôt need and honestly don‚Äôt need to be reminded everyday.

Loved Fitbit until now I have loved Fitbit for years. I had a charge 2 that I wore the heck out of so when it was time to get a new one, I went with the Versa because of all the features. I‚Äôve had it for 6 months and until now it‚Äôs worked great. After the last iOS update however it‚Äôs basically just a step tracker. They just keep saying they‚Äôre working on it but it‚Äôs been 3 weeks and I don‚Äôt get any text, phone, calendar, or app notifications. Come on Fitbit this thing wasn‚Äôt cheap and I bought it because I have a disabled mother and I didn‚Äôt want to have to carry my phone in my hand constantly so her caregiver can contact me if needed. And don‚Äôt tell me to update my app or go through the trouble shooting steps. I have done those things so many times, I‚Äôve lost count. I should have bought an Apple Watch and I still may. Go Back to the Prior Version Please I've been using this app cross platform for a few years and have really enjoyed it. It was very intuitive and user friendly with regard to daily challenges and weight loss input for example. Now just finding a challenge you have been invited to it like going through a maze. The best watch you can get! Not really reviewing the app, more the watch. But I will say the app is great! I‚Äôve had the Apple Watch, Samsung Watch, and Fitbit ionic. I wouldn‚Äôt say it‚Äôs completely a smart watch because you can‚Äôt respond to texts and calls. But it‚Äôs so much more easy to use than the other two watches! Also, if you‚Äôre looking to track steps don‚Äôt even bother with the other two watches. They are so off on steps! The challenges on the app have motivated my family and I to get in shape and we feel so much better! In just two weeks, my Grandma has lost 12 pounds. The best weight loss program you can get! Fitbit is awesome!

No longer acceptable as is! We all have tried the usual things-including delete and reinstall, plug into electric outlet, turn on & off, etc. nothing syncs from Fitbit One device to the application itself on my iPhone. They do not honor the warranty! I loved the product until it stopped working within a few months of purchasing it. Then i called customer service they said no problem and sent me a replacement that never worked. I called customer service and. Over an hour on the phone the conclusion was there‚Äôs a bug in the software that doesn‚Äôt enable you to load a replacement device when it is the same device their solution was to tell me to wait for engineers to fix the bug. They refused to send me a different product that would work. This is a breach of their warranty and horrible customer service. I was planning on buying a charge for my sister for her birthday now I don‚Äôt recommend buying anything from FitBit. Also, I will continue to leave bad reviews on every platform until the ‚Äúsupervising manager‚Äù calls me back like they aid he would.

Very helpful App I love this app. It helps me keep track of my water and food intake and also my exercise. It also helps me keep track of my heart rate while I‚Äôm out and about. I have Postural Orthostatic Tachycardia Syndrome so I have to monitor my heart rate and adjust my water and food intake regularly to avoid being symptomatic. This app really helps with that. My only complaint is that the app doesn‚Äôt take into consideration my condition so it says a 96bpm resting heart rate is poor cardiac health when 96 is actually normal for someone with my condition. Untreated my heart beats at 170bpm. If there were a way people could log their medical conditions and the app take that into account to make it more personalized that would be perfect.

Watch Face selection needs improving There are several hundred great watch faces here but it‚Äôs a frustrating process searching for the one you want. I often like to change my watch face several times a month and I have to hunt through all of them to find the ones I like the best. It would be great to be able to mark favorites with a heart or thumbs up and have those collected on a separate menu so I can keep track of the ones I like best. It would also be neat to see what the most popular watch faces are based on user feedback. One more related note ‚Äì sometimes when I search through watch  faces and then try to go backwards the app seems to crash or lock up.

Whether face I think that they should make a setting where you can see the whether in your current location. It would be handy. I don‚Äôt think that it should be a watch face, it should just be like steps or active minutes. Also I think that the watch should sink to your phone without even opening the app. I love the notification feature and that it reminds me to move and if I have a text message but I wish there would be more than just text and calls. I think that you should have access to choose what notifications you get... like Instagram and Snapchat. I absolutely love my FitBit Alta but wish I waited for the Alta HR to come out! Improve tracking throughout the day, plus account for travel I use the app every day and I like it. I have two suggestions for improvements:

Functions offered are great - if/when it works This is the most frustrating app I ever worked with. I have upgraded my fitbits from a Flex2, to Charge, and Inspire. No matter which device I use (d) I always have problems with syncing. At least 3 times a week I have to go through the motions of resetting the Fitbit, turning Bluetooth off and on, and finally restarting my iPhone to make my device sync with the app. Since this happened to me with any device I ever used with this app, I assume it is an app rather than a device issue. As great as the functions offered by this app are, the frustration that comes with permanent trouble shooting to make it work, is telling me this app still needs a lot of improvement for general functioning.

Loved my Fitbit until it was 5 months ‚Äúold‚Äù I‚Äôve had a Fitbit since December 2014 and have been through a few of them. My Alta died (no longer held a charge) in Dec 2018 after I‚Äôd had it for a year, so I bought a new Charge 3 in January 2019. About a month ago, when it was 5 months old, it would charge fine but the battery died within 12 hours! 100% to dead in 8-12 hours?! Before this sudden battery problem it would hold a charge for 4-5 days!! I updated the app & it will now stay charged for 24 hours if I‚Äôm lucky, but I‚Äôm going to have to return it on the warranty and hope the problem has been fixed in the new one or I‚Äôm going to have to change to another brand. I‚Äôm not sure if I‚Äôm mad, disappointed or really mad- Fitbit devices are not cheap, but sometimes they seem like they‚Äôre cheaply made & have a huge profit margin for the company.

Almost Perfect I have the Versa 2 and use the app on iPhone 11. Before the Versa 2, I had the Charge HR and Charge HR 2. I have been using Fitbit since 2015, and I have loved everything about it. On the lookout!
A must have! I‚Äôve been a FitBit owner for a little over 3 years now, and I can‚Äôt say enough about the products/app.

Blaze I enjoy using my Fitbit devices because they are great motivators and remind me to keep moving. For that reason, I‚Äôll continue to use a tracking device. This is my 3rd Device and for the price I‚Äôm disappointed with the Blaze. I was satisfied with my first clip-on but, when it broke, I upgraded. I‚Äôve forgotten the name of my 2nd one but, I felt it wasn‚Äôt as accurate as my first one. The Blaze Battery has to be charged about every 2 days. It‚Äôs a hassle using the charger that came with it, so I upgraded so I don‚Äôt have to pull the watch apart to charge. The heart rate no longer shows up after less than 2 months (it was a Christmas gift) I‚Äôve tried everything the website stated.
Love fitbit üòç This is my 3rd.!!  I have it on all the time, except when showering.

Great App I really like the app. It has everything g I need. By I absolutely detest the new dashboard. I don‚Äôt need or want my challenges on the dashboard, that‚Äôs what the notifications are for. And it‚Äôs so boring.

Updated app drains the phone battery I was really happy with the app until the recent overhaul. Now, it appears that the app runs constantly in the background draining the battery. For example, it‚Äôs 100% charged when I go to bed and 70% charged when I get up. Nothing else is running according to the battery data. I have always had the background refresh off, so this is something else. Really annoying, please fix this!

Worst smart watch in the market! On my second Fitbit Versa now. The first one decided to stop working less than a month after buying it. Because it was covered Under warranty got a replacement fairly easy.  Approximately a year after getting the replacement (probably refurbished I assume) I started getting crazy heart readings making my calorie count extremely high! I have approached customer service many times just to be told is my heart rate and not the Fitbit. I have send screen shot of my Fitbit reading I am at peak zone while laying in bed, even compared my heart reading done at a hospital with the Fitbit where one can really see there is something wrong with it.

Remove sleep score The arbitrary ‚Äúsleep score‚Äù is useless. Why get rid of our average time slept and replace it? Why not make it optional or be able to be turned off? If I get 5 hours of sleep a night, I‚Äôm good to go. Don‚Äôt tell me that I‚Äôm a failure or that I‚Äôm only a fair sleeper. I‚Äôm not in school and don‚Äôt need you giving me grades. I‚Äôve had a Fitbit for 4 years. My screen is cracked and it‚Äôs time to move on. This problem with the sleep score has been happening since this summer and no change has gone into effect. Not a great way to show your consumers that you value their opinions. You just create a change and assume they‚Äôll have to adjust. I work 3am-9am every morning and sleep whoever I can. You don‚Äôt get to judge me just because there is a ‚Äúnorm‚Äù. You don‚Äôt preset our step goals and not allow us to change them! Why do that with sleep? Fix it.

Remove ‚Äúsleep score‚Äù The sleep score is useless (another way to trick you into paying more?) and with it you removed hours of sleep?  This is the last straw and I will be switching fitness trackers after this one dies. It‚Äôs on its last legs (I cracked it during weightlifting) and I have already been eyeing the apple watch instead. Being graded on my sleep and not being able to change this new ‚Äúfeature‚Äù is just too much. You‚Äôve lost many customers over this! Change it back or you will lose more! Update: I got a message from Fitbit saying pretty much ‚Äútoo bad.‚Äù Also in the recent weeks I‚Äôve stopped using the sleep feature because being rated ‚Äúfair‚Äù when I feel refreshed and great and wake up before my alarm clock just feels demoralizing. I‚Äôm looking at getting an Apple Watch by XMas and ditching Fitbit once and for all. Zero stars.

Update Terrible - Developer Response Worse The new update to the dashboard has caused upset in the Fitbit Community. Hundreds of people have voiced their disappointment and wishes to revert to the previous dashboard.
User experience getting worse Thanks to my Fitbit One, I've gone from a couch potato to at least 30 min of exercise daily.

This is a great app.....but..... I love the Fitbit app. It really helps me to stay active and it‚Äôs really fun to be able to compete with my friends. The problem that I have is that it is solely geared towards people who are up during the day. I work night shift, which means that my active hours are over night. There are a lot of things that I can not do with the app because I am active at night. It would be fantastic if this app was able to switch over to nights for the large amount of people that are active at night instead of the day. As soon as this happens, I‚Äôm a 5-Star reviewer!

Problem w/ syncing to challenges Overall, the app is pretty good but I have to take away a few stars because I‚Äôm having issues with my Fitbit Ionic syncing to challenges. Oddly enough, everything syncs fine to my dashboard. I‚Äôm fairly competitive and I hate the idea of losing a challenge simply because I can‚Äôt get the information to sync properly. Please...fix it! I‚Äôd really appreciate it! There‚Äôs no point in me participating in anymore challenges until the problem is resolved. On a side note, I googled the problem and it‚Äôs not anything new. I‚Äôm confused as to why it hasn‚Äôt been fixed yet. I tried everything that was suggested, which worked for a few hours, but then it started acting up again. This time, nothing is working.

Love my Fitbit Versa I have loved my Versa from day one!  It is wonderful for my fitness goals and helps me push myself to get my step goals every day. One of my favorite features has been the sleep tracker. But it quit working two nights ago and I can‚Äôt figure out why. Also I‚Äôve noticed lately that I haven‚Äôt been getting all notifications to my watch! Another feature I loved at first was the tracker for my period. This hasn‚Äôt been working correctly for a few months and no, I am not pregnant! üòÜ Is it a software issue?? I truly have loved my watch and this app, but it seems like there needs to be another update or something to fix these issues. Tech support, anyone?!
Frustrating I‚Äôve used Fitbit for 2 years. There are several problems.

That's not how this works. That's not how any of this works. Ahhhh... Fitbit, it's clear that you didn't have any women working on your new Female Tracking module. Or maybe they were involved, but their input was not taken into consideration during the final decision making process. Here's a suggestion - how about you let users tell the app when their cycle starts instead of the app being so presumptuous to TELL the user when their cycle begins. I don't know if it's the hormone changes I'm experiencing, but it is maddening when the APP decides to reset my cycle to day #1 even when I'm really on day #29 (or whatever). A woman's cycle length fluctuates greatly so having the cycle day automatically reset to day #1 is idiotic and renders this function useless. But, on the bright side, the Versa is your BEST tracker yet and I'm really enjoying it.

Almost everything I need! I‚Äôve been wearing fitness trackers for over 4 years (Jawbone, UA Band) and now an Alta HR. Although the Jawbone app was excellent, this may be even better. My focus is on sleep and heart rate tracking. The sleep tracking and HR info is comprehensive and easy to follow and provides benchmarking over time and against age peers.

Smooth and better than Apple Watch I‚Äôm glad I bought a Fitbit rather than an Apple Watch I don‚Äôt need the extra gizmos. I like that it tracks my sleep and my overall activity everyday and I can compare it by month. The app has always Worked smoothly never has it dropped connection, I don‚Äôt understand all these negative reviews the only time it wasn‚Äôt updating my watch could had seemed like the apps fault but it tells you when an update to the app has a bug. 100% satisfied YOU WILL BE TOO! I love that it gives you wisdom every now and then on how to get a better sleep or keep being active.

Never Gets Old I have had Fitbits for three years now and I loved all of them.  I also think that the app is just as good.  You can track your steps, see how many miles you‚Äôve walked in a day, track your sleep, track your heart rate, log your weight, log the food you‚Äôve eaten, compete in challenges with friends, and there‚Äôs much more.  You can also set on your Fitbit to remind you to walk each hour.  I love how you can set an alarm to wake up, and how you can receive text messages on your Fitbit.  By far, this is the best fitness app I‚Äôve downloaded, and I would strongly recommend it to anyone.

Good app, ineffective sleep score Overall the app is good. A little while back the sleep score changed. I have tried it for a while and have decided it‚Äôs a waste and ineffective. Just because you can come up with a new system doesn‚Äôt mean you should.

App broke? Since the new update, it will show my steps that day if I sync, but then they won‚Äôt show again and it looks like steps are gone. Also my watch won‚Äôt unlock, it‚Äôs locked on me before so I know the steps to unlock it and have tried all those. I‚Äôve followed the advice online to uninstall and reinstall etc and still nothing. I‚Äôm really bummed because keeping track of my personal stats was fun and motivating. Please fix

Missing out on some key updates First complaint: This app doesn‚Äôt have a body measurement tracker. I still have to use MyFitnessPal for this feature. Please, add this so that I can just stop using MyFitnessPal and fully make the switch to Fitbit.

Great, when it works I try to be health conscious, and I like that this app can be helpful in that endeavor. However, it‚Äôs been very buggy since I upgraded my phone several months ago (from the iPhone 6 to the 8).

The Ionic not syncing with the app is sinking this combo The Ionic is nice and seems to work well while working out or doing yoga. BUT it will not sync with the app on my IPhone 6 on a regular basis. I have everything up to date as far as software on the phone & app. It could be hours or days before it syncs making it not very enjoyable experience. If that can be fixed it would be a much better experience.

If it works don‚Äôt break it! My fitbit app was working just fine so I wasn‚Äôt sure why it needed to be updated, but like the sheep that I am, I dutifully clicked on the update button the second after it showed up on my screen. When I opened the new, improved app, my screen went white. I opened, closed, shut down and restarted and waited and waited and waited. Finally the login screen lit up and I got back in. I wore my fitbit all yesterday and today. Surprisingly, I somehow managed to walk...zero steps. Now that‚Äôs it updated, I somehow squeezed in 7 steps from the comfort of my chair. Wow. None between 5:00 am to 8:00pm and 7 while warming the seat. Go figure. And go get my old app back!
More Annoying Than Useful Follow Up to FB Response.

Notifications not working I just bought my Fitbit charge 3 two days ago and it worked well for the first day but since then I haven‚Äôt been able to receive any text messages. More challenges, please! The Fitbit app is fine for individual use, but a disappointment for group challenges. There are a few step challenges, and only two racing competitions. For those motivated by competition, you may soon find yourself bored of racing around the Valley Loop and Pohono Trail week after week. Holiday races, seasonal races, ‚Äúcause‚Äù races - keep this fun, unpredictable, and motivating! It is boring!!!

Overall quite the potential but several bugs. Miles tracker will often report absurd numbers, such as today I walked 1000 steps but have 20 miles walked? That doesn‚Äôt make sense, you‚Äôd assume the algorithms would check for that. Layout has me scroll even though all my data points I track could easily fit in one screen. Position tracking is off yet I get numerous messages to enable it during the work out, that doesn‚Äôt make sense. It is off, I don‚Äôt need a notification for it every time I work out. Social side of app will show bizarrely old posts. Why would it show a post from 3 months ago? Doesn‚Äôt make sense. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, this is a decent app, but it IS frustrating and needs a design overhaul.

Best tool I've tried There never has and never will be a "magic pill" or anything that works like good old fashioned diet and exercise! The problem I've always had was focusing on BOTH at once. You can't just exercise, and you can't just diet if you want to see fast results. Fitbit is the best tool I've used to accurately track calories in vs. calories out. I was reluctant to spend the money on a Fitbit Blaze, but once I got serious about putting in the work I started seeing results immediately. All I have to do is make sure I'm burning more calories than I'm consuming in a day and this app makes it super easy to do!

Update kills Charge HR The pushed firmware update (you can't sync unless you update your tracker) for the Charge HR bricked my device. The status bar for the update goes halfway and stops and the Fitbit will not sync or connect or even allow itself to be reset. This is a known Fitbit issue and is greeted with a 25% off offer to buy a new product but no actual fix for the current product. Why does Fitbit push updates knowing many users will end up with devices that no longer work? Do they want to incentivize people to buy new trackers?

Fitbit Ap 2.53 I love the Fitbit and used the ap regularly to track my calorie intake as well as my activity, etc., but this update really messed up the food tracker. I‚Äôve never been able to get it to load the news so once again the ‚Äúsmart watch‚Äù functionality does not work. I wish I had gone ahead and just purchased an Apple Watch.

Doesn‚Äôt record all my sleep time every day I have the Fitbit app for my Fitbit 3 and I‚Äôve noticed a few days where it has cheated my sleep time. It‚Äôs pretty great I really love my Fitbit and I would recommend it to anyone willing to keep up with it. New layout is clunky The newest update for ‚Äúbug fixes‚Äù is a complete redesign of the home page. Needs few adjustments I love the fit bit! Changed My Life... Over the past few weeks I‚Äôve worn my fitbit and used the app everyday and lost a total of 11kg so far.

Not always tracking things I‚Äôve had my Fitbit One for three or four years now. Mostly I like it but I think it‚Äôs often inaccurate when tracking my activities. Lack of urgency in fixing notification issue w/ devices‚Äî‚Äúbut pay more for our premium services!‚Äù It‚Äôs extremely disappointing that Fitbit is focusing their efforts on rolling out ‚Äúpremium‚Äù version of their services‚Äîat an additional cost‚Äîinstead of trying to fix the issues they currently have. Love that we can delete calories burned!! I love my Fitbit because it motivates me to move more. I struggle with depression so this can be tough for me. Wish it synched better I use my Fitbit only when I work out. It‚Äôs a cool tool, but it doesn‚Äôt always synch your workouts. Great New Technology I recently upgraded from a 3 year-old waterproof ‚Äúwishbone‚Äù version of a Fitbit. New look for the app I ‚Äúaccidentally‚Äù accepted the updated look for my Fitbit app and I absolutely hate it. If there is a way to get the old look back I wish I knew how. Behind in technology I used to love keeping track of my steps and fitness with fitbit but now fitbit is not working as well. Getting Fit Made Simple. This is a great watch! I wear it all the time! It was very easy to set up when I first got the watch. üôÇ For the most part, this app works well. It's easy to use and sync up. The sleep monitor part is ridiculous, however, as it is wildly inaccurate. For example, I have problems sleeping and will be awake frequently and for long periods of time where I read until I sleep again. The app will say I was asleep for nine hours when the reality is more like four to five hours. Everything else seems to work fine. The only other thing is that there is not a way to remove notifications or the red circle symbol, which is just a personal preference. The exercise tracking, water and food counters, and community connections are all great!

Love my Fitbit I love everything about my Fitbit watch and app!!! The only reason I gave it a 4 star was I wish my fit bit charge 2 had the option to set water reminders. I love the fact I can track what I eat, enter how much water I drank etc... I leaning towards a healthy and physically active lifestyle! And this has been a big motivator! A small example I would do things like parking my car far to just get the etc steps in for the day! I like the fact that it reminds me every hour to get some steps in! Really useful for people with desk jobs! To give you that stretch, the little break you need!!! Fit bit makers! -> Water reminders would be awesome!!!!

App is not great For such a successful company they put little effort into the app. It‚Äôs super difficult or impossible to correct data that is either recorded from the tracker or accidentally input wrong. I wake up and it says I‚Äôve walked almost half a mile on my sleep and there‚Äôs no way to correct this or reset it. Also, when you think you‚Äôre inputting food data for the prior day then realize it‚Äôs all for TODAY there‚Äôs no way to quickly go in and shift it to a different day. You have to re-input it...which takes up a lot of time. If it was clearer on the food page which day you were on that would have helped. Other than that it‚Äôs a great app so just be warned there‚Äôs some stress points and your data won‚Äôt be super accurate with this app.

Threw my Surge away My Surge quit connecting to my phone and I used to read text messages and screen calls, as well as tracking my workouts. Awful App, product and customer service Fitbit use to be amazing. But it no longer works with iPhones. But this has been a problem for over 6 months. Don‚Äôt buy a Fitbit if you have an iPhone, get an Apple Watch or any other brand!

Message notifications We all know the issue about notifications after the recent iOS update. New dashboard is the worst!!! I‚Äôve been through 5 or 6 Fitbits over the years. The watches themselves don‚Äôt really last and have issues. Latest Update Blows Since the update I have had nothing but headaches with regards to my device syncing to the app. I've had to restart the device, delete the app, and reinstall it more times than I can count and then the app still doesn't sync with the iOS HealthKit really Fitbit! REALLY.

Don't work as good as it should Before writing this review I read some of the other reviews. I seem to be having similar issues as others do. Stop making more Fitbits and fix the app The concept of Fitbit is amazing and been a member since 2013. My problem with Fitbit is they consistently release new Fitbit models every year and forget to put their time into their app development and improvement.

Great incentive I have had the Fitbit for about a little less than a week and I love it. I can track aveything I do all day. Great App for a Great Product! Having the ability to record information about my activity, sleep patterns, heart rate and weight is a great motivator: it challenges me to do better, minute by minute, day by day.

No predictive calorie burn on new design The food tracking portion of the app used to update continuously throughout the day to show how many calories you would have burned by midnight‚Äî it was an incredibly useful feature for people (like me) who are watching nutritional intake and trying to eat at maintenance but not necessarily meal prepping in advance (and whose caloric output can vary massively from day to day.) The new design has eliminated it entirely; I have no easy way now to anticipate my total daily calorie burn and plan accordingly. Please bring this back, or at least make it an option??? I also genuinely miss the cute moon that used to pop up when I hit my sleep goal; it‚Äôs frustrating that this redesign not only did away with one of the app‚Äôs most useful features but stripped out all the character that made it fun to use, too.
New App Post 2
Suggestion for Improvement This is a great product and the app holds a lot of really excellent information. There are a few features I would love to see improved upon.

Switching between kids and parents too hard I bought 2 Aces for 2 very active young boys ages 7 and 8. They love it and I do as well. Good App Overall i have used it for about 2 years.  I like the app a lot, it overall is reliable and good.  Only reason i rated 4 vs 5 is because it can have issues. Love it I use my Fitbit and all of its features nearly every day. I do everything from watching my HR when I work out to keep it in the right zones, to logging my food and water intake. I really want to love this but I‚Äôm getting really frustrated I have been. For bit customer for may years. I currently have the Fitbit versa, and the aria scale.
