Love my Fitbit It is super satisfying to reach my goals with Fitbit! Fitbit motivates me to exercise... the app does have a few shortcomings, but is great anyhow.

Love my Fitbit Been 7 years since I bought my first Fitbit and now I miss it on my wrist when it‚Äôs charging. 3rd year with Fitbit With so many options on the market today‚Äî I think Fitbit has a stronghold on the sleep monitoring options. Great but would like to see some other features I love my Fitbit and Fitbit app! I‚Äôve had the charge 2 for 3 years now. Sleep I really like my Fitbit. This app is really helpful. There are so many things you can track. Since iOS 13 App use to track my Cardio during walks; from forums this quit w/ update late July. Alta HR Edit: I wrote this review days ago and reviews before and after my post have had comments from the developer. Obviously they don‚Äôt care that their update bricked my Fitbit. So I have since changed my rating to only two stars. One star for each year the Fitbit Alta HR worked.

Half of a great watch I love all of the features of this watch. I had the Charge 2 and screen cracked without hitting it on anything. So many updates and none work Was happy with the app when it was working. Now I get notifications after notification about an update. I update and none of the problems are fixed. Recent update Since the update My Mobile sync doesn't work nor does my Fitbit record actual movement time. Ugg I wish pencil pushers would leave things alone. I can't log sleep time. Love it I was skeptical at first that this app would be affective in getting and keeping me motivated and moving but it has really changed my life. Won‚Äôt Sync. UPDATE: It‚Äôs been too many times that my Fitbit won‚Äôt sync with the app, even trying all the troubleshooting tips & tricks. I‚Äôm done with Fitbit, moving on to a different tracker brand. Bye.

Don‚Äôt like the newest feature... I have been using a FitBit and the app for almost 2 years and haven‚Äôt had much trouble. One of the latest updates took away a feature I enjoyed and really need. Sleep Score is Awful I still love my actual Fitbit and use the app every day. I would give it 5 stars except for the ‚ÄúSleep Score‚Äù. This appeared out of the blue one day to take the place of the average hours slept per week. Each day the app rates my sleep with a score. What does the score mean?  Who knows? FitBit Review Overall, I have been happy with my FitBit and find it to be a great tool. However, I find the food logging to be inefficient and unnecessarily time consuming. For example, when I am packing my lunch for the following day and have logged all of my food and serving sizes entered, it oftentimes glitches and puts it under the food I have eaten today. Fitbit One I love the Fitbit One which to my understanding is not being available no longer. I‚Äôve had mine 2 years and really like the accuracy of the step counter. I wear mine as a necklace and it rest on my chest. Wish they would bring it back I‚Äôm not interested in sleep or calories just 10,000 steps a day. If my Fitbit One quits on me I will be lost. Love my tracker and the app ...Although I would love to be able to have the option to see the messages I've sent. Especially the ability to track  my sleep , I love my sleep and it's so cool to look ans analyze my sleep stages !

Great I have been with Fitbit for over 4 years. First with the Fitbit One and now the HR. Both work equally well and the app was easy to convert from one to the other. One issue I have a charge 3 and love it, love the app too. Very intuitive layout. However, I am having a problem with it. I am young and normally quite active, and I had gotten my heart score up to the mid 50s. I then got a bad cold and was totally out of it for a week, and unable to do any intense exercise for over a month. Now, my heart score seems to be stuck at 25 - poor. Why is this, and what can I do to get it back to normal? I can run several miles in an hour, I don‚Äôt think poor is an accurate reflection of my heart‚Äôs health. I would appreciate any insights from the Fitbit team. Overall, no other issues from the app.

Great; but Sleep Tracking could be upgraded Overall the app is fantastic. However, I see two upgrades that could make sleep tracking much more useful. The first would be to have the ‚Äú30-day-average‚Äù be able to toggle between percentages, which are less useful, and actual hours/minutes, which would be much more useful. The second would be to display the actual number of ‚Äúwake-up events,‚Äù which would be more revealing about the quality of rest one gets; 1 hour of awake time all at once has very different implications than 1 hour occurring 30 times throughout the night!

Used to be great Fitbit App used to be great but continues to get worse with each update. The most recent update it is a confusing mess. Now it‚Äôs just a big sales pitch with management of MY data removed. Where has the weight tracking history gone? I don‚Äôt need to know only what I weigh today from my Aria scale. Is this an app for grown-ups concerned with their health or geared for teenyboppers and nit wits who have nothing better than do then tweet?

Disappointed with the new version I am very disappointed with the changes made in the new version. The app is harder to navigate. We used to be able to add exercise, food, weight etc by tapping the + on the top of the screen. Now I have to scroll down to find the section I want.

Add Pregnancy/Nursing Features Love my Fitbit and enjoy the app. It would be nice if you could add a feature where the user could mark that they‚Äôre pregnant and some of the tracking would change like water goals, weight goals, step goals, etc. Same with nursing. New app layout not available First, I LOVE Fitbit. That‚Äôs why it‚Äôs getting 5 stars, but I am disappointed that I am unable to upgrade to the new layout. Sleep I have used a cpap machine for over ten years and In more recent years I used my Fitbit to track my sleep. It gives me info not only for my total hours of sleep from start to finish, but also minus restlessness and awake time to give me the actual hours of quality sleep. Then it gives me the average hours of sleep per night over a weekly and monthly period.  I can share this information when I have my next appointment with my doctor.  I am now 85 years old and I attribute a history of good sleep as one of several factors for my longevity besides my daily lap swimming time which I also track with my Fitbit.
I am excited to have my 2nd Fitbit  (4.4.20) I went a year without my Charge2 after it stopped reading my heart rate.

Period tracking is so bad they should turn it off I‚Äôve been using the period tracking feature for almost a year and there seems to have been absolutely zero thought put into the prediction of your next period.  I think it is literally taking how many days you entered as your typical cycle length and the start date of the very first period you tracked and that‚Äôs it.   No matter how many periods you enter, the prediction never gets better.   If you forget to enter one, it still calculates from your first period.   My tracker now shows a predicted 11 weeks between periods.   I should have quit long ago but kept hoping for an update that would fix this.   Just turn off the period tracking feature if you‚Äôre not actually going to invest in making it work.

Pregnancy Tracking Fitbit is already awesome but it would be incredible to have data and tracking during pregnancy. A feature allowing this would help because Fitbit can offer things that Activities can't, like food, water, and sleep tracking, but your Apple watch automatically syncs your step count to Activities.

Great for charge 2 App works great with the Fitbit charge 2. I love it so much!  I‚Äôm addicted to checking my sleep patterns and heartbeat everyday. It‚Äôs like how it tells me how much deep, light, and REM sleep I get each night. It also tells me how many times I woke up during the night and how often I‚Äôm restless.  If you select ‚Äúbenchmark‚Äù it tells you about how much you should be getting in each area for your age. I find these things directly relate to how well I feel in the morning. Now I know why I feel groggy and unrested sometimes. It‚Äôs because I‚Äôm not getting enough deep sleep!!

Grandma 8 Just got my Fitbit for Xmas set it up last night an was very pleased about the ease of set up. I too have noticed it has racked up steps not taken but you can't have everything perfect. I am going to do another review after I've used it awhile. I have the charge 2 I like the way it monitors your sleep too.

Lots of Pros! But def Annoying Parts I love the functionality of the Fitbit blaze. I love what gets reported to my app on my phone. The thing I can‚Äôt stand about the app is that, I will select things correctly in my food entries and when I see what I‚Äôve submitted, it shows something completely different that I did not select and it is extremely annoying!! I‚Äôm trying to track what I eat and see my caloric intake and out - and I can never get an accurate picture of what my days look like. I would‚Äôve otherwise given it 5 stars. I haven‚Äôt used the social aspect of it and I haven‚Äôt done challenges. I may update my review once I use it more. Maybe it will improve.

Water Glitch I typically LOVE this app. But one of the main reasons I actually go to the app every day is to log and keep track of my daily water intake. Pretty much daily at this point the water function will glitch and if I‚Äôm not really paying attention it will tell me I‚Äôve had less water than I‚Äôve actually had so it takes me much longer to reach my goal and if I do catch it I have to delete all my water entries and re-enter them all again. Even when deleting the water amounts at the point it says the wrong amount. This is extremely irritating. And since I don‚Äôt always catch it I‚Äôm not sure how many times is ‚Äòcheated‚Äô me. Please PLEASE fix this issue. I‚Äôm probably not the only one who would greatly appreciate it.

DO NOT Recommend I have used Fitbit products for 10+ years. I even regifted an Apple Watch and upgraded my Fitbit. It has been months since texts and notifications stopped working on my Fitbit. They asked for patience and told us updates were coming. Nothing has changed. Now, my clock is an hour and a half behind my time zone. So it‚Äôs not even functioning as a clock. It‚Äôs literally just a fashion piece for my wrist. I‚Äôm extremely disappointed that it‚Äôs not functioning. I loved my silent alarms, sleep tracker, exercise tracker, notifications without pulling out my phone, especially that I could quickly see the time. I really hope Fitbit figures out what is going on. Until then I DO NOT recommend purchasing any Fitbit products and I plan to look into purchasing an Apple Watch.

Wish it worked better I want to like my charge 3. It seems like the features should make it a good fitness tracker. There are two main issues. I can‚Äôt sync the fitness data with Strava or Apple health kit and the constant sync issues from the device to my phone is downright annoying. I regularly have to quit and restart the app two or three times to get it to sync. I sometimes have to reboot the charge 3 as well. I had a Garmin device prior to the charge 3 and didn‚Äôt have one issue with sync. It also was much more friendly with connecting to other apps. Overall I am disappointed with Fitbit. If this didn‚Äôt cost so much, I‚Äôd switch back to a Garmin. Once this device stops working, I‚Äôm done with Fitbit.

Wonderful, just want more Honestly I love fitbit as a company, it has helped me so much and I encourage all of my students (I am a fitness instructor) to be able to track their activity and food intake, and this is a wonderful app to do just that. If I could add one thing, I would LOVE to see a way to track waist/hip/bust/etc. measurements. I personally prefer to see weight loss in this way. With weight and height, it only tracks BMI (which is problematic in many way, but that is a rant for another day) but inches shows you something tangible, something real.

Disappointed As a Fitbit customer of over 5 years, I am truly disappointed in the level of service Fitbit is providing. Since the iPhone update months ago (6+ months) Fitbit has yet to figure out how to get text notifications sent to my Fitbit versa. I used to receive all notifications on my Fitbit (text, calls, etc) and now I don‚Äôt receive the text notifications anymore. This was one of the top reasons for my latest upgrade to Versa but after this I won‚Äôt be getting any more Fitbit products. They‚Äôve offered no fix or solution for the issue and have lost a loyal customer as a result.  This is truly disappointing as I thought they‚Äôd have it figured out by now. Don‚Äôt waste your money on Fitbit- get an Apple Watch instead, that‚Äôs where I‚Äôm taking my business.

Not happy lately I absolutely love Fitbit but lately I‚Äôm not loving it. The notifications are still only coming to my watch when the text preview says always. I don‚Äôt like this at all. I don‚Äôt want everyone being able to see my text messages when my phone is laying around. Also, every morning I have to turn my phone off and then back on to even get the watch to vibrate my wrist. All these updates but this hasn‚Äôt been fixed. Also, I have old messages and and posts from people from years ago and they never go away. There has to be an update that lets you delete these messages after you read them.

Past few updates have been very buggy. About three or more updates ago, the notifications in the app stopped working. There is a permanent red dot alerting me to a notification that I don‚Äôt have; they are all read. Also, the last notification that the app says I received is from June 11, 2018. In hope of red dot removal, I keep updating and the update before this current one seems to have dismantled the all-day sync. I received my weekly report email and was missing data from 3 days since I hadn‚Äôt opened the app. Now the most recent update pushes a notification upon closing the app ‚ÄúOpen Fitbit to keep your data synchronized.‚Äù

Alert to keep app open is annoying I have had a Fitbit, two Fitbit HRs and now an Ionic over the last 7 years or so.   As far as the actual trackers are concerned I love them but after a new recent app update you get an alert every time you close the app notifying you the app needs to stay open to sync.  It is extremely annoying and there is no way to turn it off.  I have read many others on forums complaining of the new app alert and Fitbit from what I can see doesn‚Äôt care.   Fitbit has refused to listen to its consumers about the Apple health synch which I don‚Äôt like (but understand) but now with this new annoying feature and fitbit‚Äôs lack of listening to the consumers it‚Äôs getting hard to stay a loyal consumer.   Fitbit NEEDS to start listening to their consumers.

Not happy! I assume, and everyone knows what assuming does to me. However I downloaded the app that showed to work with the Fitbit versa. I get notifications of messages or notifications and can not get rid of the notification. When I asked Fitbit over a year ago they said were working on that.

Never buying another Fitbit Every problem I‚Äôve ever had with Fitbit has NEVER been fixed. There will be numerous forum posts but they never fix the issues, they just announce more and more devices. But what brought me here today is once again I got a notification that my period is going to start (it‚Äôs not) when I turned off the setting and notifications MONTHS AGO. And now, the setting isn‚Äôt even in my app so they say to uninstall, reinstall, restart phone, restart Fitbit, then the setting should be there. THEN you have to delete all the logs so you don‚Äôt get notifications, EVEN THOUGH YOU TURNED THEM OFF! Like this is some BS! If I turn it off, I turn it off!

Highly highly disappointed in this company My fit bit completely stopped working after I updated it, super disappointing as I have only had it barely a year. The watch is completely useless, won‚Äôt turn on ; app won‚Äôt sync to it . It‚Äôs just a hunk of junk laying around my house. Fitbit customer service was literally NO help at all , clearly this is a problem that FITBIT caused so I was hoping they‚Äôd replace my device but NOPE , all they offered was a lousy discount on another Fitbit product that will probably break in under a year AGAIN. Also I KNOW I am not the only one with an issue after the update , so many people complain of the same issues over and over and Fitbit doesn‚Äôt seem to care. I really don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll waste another dollar on these products .

Won‚Äôt sync I love my fitbit, have had it for almost 3 years now. The app has continually come out with new exciting and helpful tools. However, the new update will not let me sync. My fitbit dies almost a week ago and absolutely will not sync with the app, whether on wifi or not(and this has happened before since the last update). If this continues, I will stop wearing my fitbit, but I would like for it to get fixed.

Ruined App I am glad I have not rated my Fitbit app until now. I will say I used to really like my Fitbit app not that I always used all the features to it but they were there if I wanted to use them.

Updated layout worse They updated layout is definitely not an improvement. It is far less visually appealing. I was purposely not updating the app because I did not want to new layout. However suddenly I opened my app and fitbit changed everything automatically with out me even updating the app. I wish there was an option to be able to revert back to the old layout.

A total fail The redesign with the latest update is a total fail. I went from seeing everything on one screen with nice graphics towards progress and that is gone. Furthermore I had to delete and reinstall other apps to be able to view anything other than the home screen. The ONLY thing that is good is that it now displays a battery percentage for my tracker not just full, partial, or empty. Following this initial post of this review I received feedback from the developer that shows they did not actually read my review or acknowledge my concerns. If it weren‚Äôt for the community and my current financial commitment I would totally leave the community. As it is when my current device hits end of life it will be harder to decide to replace it with on of their products.

Disappointed I got my fit bit and this fit bit all because of a school PE class that requires me to get 10,000 steps per day. Then I was suppose to take a screenshot of the weekly report showing that I met that goal. However I was very disappointed when I saw that there was no option to show the number of steps I got in the whole week, which was the whole reason I got the fit bit. Besides that, j can say that the quality of counting is amazing and very accurate which I like, I just hope that in some kind of new update I‚Äôm able to see a weekly step counter as well.

Poor battery life I have been having poor battery life. Only lasts maybe two days! For months I have been working with customer service and tried everything. Then they noticed I didn't have the latest update. I was told to do that and deplete my battery then charge it all the way and that will take care of it. It made it worse!! Call customer service back and now they are saying there is a glitch in the update that drains batteries and they are working on it. It still didn't make sense because my battery lasts just the same. They refuse to send a new battery saying it will have the same problems but how do they know if they don't send one! This has been going on for months. And I need it for the sleep log really bad. But they don't seem to care.
Fitbit Alta HR My Fitbit Alta HR is everything I expected and more!

Can‚Äôt Sign In Went to log back in to my app and it‚Äôs telling me my account is pending deletion and I can reactivate it by signing in. Well, I can‚Äôt even sign in. So can we fix this? I signed in online through my browser and that was fine. I don‚Äôt see where my account would be pending deletion or how it would be. ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

New Device New Problem I absolutely love my Fitbit Ionic. I had a Charge and then a Charge 2 before this and was so excited to start using my Ionic recently to track my runs without having to have my phone on me with all the bells a whistles without the price tag of an Apple Watch.
Fitbits are short lived. Although the app is good, there are a variety of problems. For example, it will randomly no longer pair with your device for a few days, weeks, or something even a month.

Necessity for Fitbit But Not Good At Syncing The app does a terrible job at syncing. You have to check the app daily for it to sync all of the data from your Fitbit, and if you don‚Äôt, it‚Äôll just be blank (calories burned, steps, activity minutes, etc.). I will say that the Fitbit itself though, is a five out of five. Yes, you need the app to set up the Fitbit, and it does that well, but if you want to track your daily steps, it doesn‚Äôt work well unless you open the app numerous times or after you‚Äôve completed your goal for the day. So, if you‚Äôve completed your goal, then you have to open the app before the next day, or else it won‚Äôt show up.

Can‚Äôt turn off ‚Äòinsights‚Äô I use the Fitbit app maybe 3 times per week. When I do, it‚Äôs to check out my weekly stats or change a clock face. But often the app has a large ad or message at the top that obscures a good portion of the app. The ads pester me to buy a new product or service and the messages are mind-numbing (eg caffeine interferes with sleep).

Worst customer service I‚Äôve had my Fitbit blaze for a few years. Worked great with notifications until iOS 13.  I‚Äôm ok with it having bugs on new systems but it has been over 3 months and no update.  They just keep telling us to be patient.  I‚Äôm done.  Selling my Fitbit and closing out my account.  It‚Äôs been nice but it seems they don‚Äôt care too much about the customers.
Missing one thing The only thing it is missing is the ability to zoom in at a specific time frame (heart rate, sleep, etc.)

atrocious update This is by far the worst update in the history of updates!!!! I went from an Apple Smart Watch to Fitbit because I use to love everything Fitbit until this horrible update that ruined the app. My app now fails to sync, it constantly disconnects from my Bluetooth, and it constantly strolls back to the top of the page refusing to sync while I‚Äôm trying to log information. Stay away from this update!! You will regret it!! I‚Äôm thinking about just deleting my Fitbit account and going back to Apple!!! I wouldn‚Äôt even give it a 1 star!!!

Iffy The past two updates have driven me batty. It isn't really coordinating, even though it is syncing, and I need to close the program and go through the log in process a few times daily (as opposed to the fact I never HAD to log out before at all) to keep it focused and correct (as well as doing the sleep stage correctly. It recently has begun giving generic "sleep" readings and excusing itself by saying it lost contact or couldn't get a steady reading with my heart rate, yet it was captured perfectly well when I look into that section.

Love this! I‚Äôve been using this app and I don‚Äôt even have a FitBit yet (it‚Äôs shipping) and I love it! Logging meals/water, checking nutrition facts, and setting weight loss goals has been very easy with this app. I‚Äôve even manually logged my workouts and it estimates my calories burned (although I‚Äôm sure that will be more accurate once I get my FitBit and wear it during my workouts). Haven‚Äôt noticed any bugs/glitches so far. The app is easy to use and I love the visuals (color-coded bar graphs and line graphs) as they really help me ‚Äúsee‚Äù my progress or what I need to work on.

Bugged out There are so many bugs in this app!! Takes forever to sync my steps, I get notification after notification saying ‚Äúso and so hasn‚Äôt posted in a while‚Äù when they literally posted something 20 mins ago. I‚Äôd like to see more challenges in different places. You can only do the NYC marathon so many times. Not to mention, while doing the challenges you have to check in every so often and collect the diamonds so you can complete a badge. But if you don‚Äôt collect the diamond in a certain amount of time it disappears. I‚Äôve done the challenges so many times that I don‚Äôt need to collect them anymore, and now I‚Äôm at the point I just don‚Äôt want to do them at all. You have a long ways to go Fitbit.

Great idea for an app and love the community, but so many sync issues! My Versa hasn‚Äôt been syncing for over two weeks, I tried everything, including deleting and restarting the app, updating the app, deleting my Versa and losing all my unsaved data, and it synced once, but now a few days later it‚Äôs not syncing again. I love using my device to track sleep but it‚Äôs such a hassle to have to spend 20+ mins on it just to see if it will sync and ends up not. I don‚Äôt want to delete the device again and lose all my data just to have it sync one time. Please fix these sync issues, it‚Äôs making me unsure about the quality of this program.

Doesn‚Äôt Sync Steps w/ Apple Watch Some of my friends started doing the FitBit weekly challenges and asked me and others to join them. We downloaded the app and eventually found that our steps were not fully syncing with the app. After researching further, we found that the FitBit  app was only using steps calculated by the phone itself. It does not sync with Apple Health or the steps recorded by our watch when our phone is not on us. It looks like a simple fix by FitBit, but hasn‚Äôt probably to force us to buy their product. I wouldn‚Äôt mind paying a low one time fee to unlock this feature, but I‚Äôm not going to go buy a FitBit when I already have an Apple Watch. If this app is included in the Apple App Store it should be fully functional not only part time.

Fitbit is the best! I‚Äôve had several types of Fitbits since 2015 but I‚Äôve remained with the Charge2 (currently on my second). For Type A personalities who like to meet goals, Fitbit will be very rewarding. It‚Äôs a great motivator and I live to see the light show given by my daily goal settings when I achieve all goals. Fitbit keeps me moving and makes me want to walk and exercise, which is why you‚Äôll find me walking our inside parking lot on a rainy day or doing laps around my house before bed if I have achieved all my goals yet. Fitbit literally changed my life. Thank you!

Love it! I just set up my Fitbit Charge 2!  I waited a while to set it up! My husband got a Fitbit for Father's Day last year from his kids! They had a hard time setting it  with no instructions!  I feared the worst!  I set up  The Charge 2 myself in just a few minutes! It was super easy and quick! I love It!  It is taking me a little bit to maneuver through the app but I'm catching on! So far, so good! I recommend it! I also love how I can keep track of my calories! You really don‚Äôt realize your calorie intake until you start recording it! I love this app!

author_name: i sync we have a problem
review_body: App keeps resetting my steps I used to love the Fitbit app. However, a few months ago the app started resetting the steps on the device and app the first time I sync it after charging. This is extremely inconvenient as I often go most of the day without syncing and then lose all of the steps I took that day. Also, my device sometimes gives step reminders at the wrong time. I have tried resetting my Fitbit several times and still haven‚Äôt solved the problem. This started after one of the app updates so I know it is the app and not my Fitbit device. This is extremely frustrating and inconvenient, please fix this issue!

Annoying to manage family accounts To switch between a parent and child account is rather annoying. It makes the assumption that every Fitbit is paired to it‚Äôs own, dedicated device...but my 4- and 6-year-olds don‚Äôt have their own phone.

Missing key feature The app is fantastic and I love the sleep score. Overall I must say that I am satisfied with Fitbit, but not as of late. Unfortunately I purchased my Versa lite thinking it would solve the text messaging problems that my blaze was having since upgrading my iPhone. Text notifications just stopped working and phone call notifications would not recognize that I answered the phone so it kept buzzing. A new Fitbit product DID NOT fix the issue. Very unfortunate as I would not have spent $150 on a new fitbit. I would love to know when this will be addressed. I do not seem to be the only person having this issue. Thank you in advance for your reply (and for keeping me active and healthy!)

As a Senior, I love my Charge3 .I don‚Äôt want to be without it! This is my second Fit Bit.  I love its features and don‚Äôt want to be without it. I am in my 60‚Äôs and found it invaluable in assisting me in my daily goals, which I can set, for my limited activity level. Being disabled, I use the ‚ÄúDaily Steps‚Äù option to assist me in knowing when to get off my feet, rather than over doing it, and ‚Äú Paying the Piper ‚Äú .plus it delivers my messages to my wrist, rather than having to get my phone. I know seniors will enjoy their fit bit as well !

Great App Ruined By SaaS and Advertising I paid a lot of money for my Fitbit (I‚Äôve bought three over the years and was an early adopter of the tech). I really like the app, but the advertisements for new devices need to go. It‚Äôs ridiculous. Leave me alone, I just want to use the app for a device that I paid over $100 for. Worse, is how the app features are neutered for the sake of hustling a Software As A Service subscription. The app was less annoying in the early days, the insights are nice and I see the improvement but there‚Äôs no excuse for disrupting the user experience with ads for devices that I have no need to purchase as my existing Fitbit already meets my needs.

Annoying Ads I had a Fitbit One which I loved and when it died the One was discontinued, so I switched to the old Zip which is Ok and I like it now. Wish it could count flights of stairs and monitor sleep like the One did. I don‚Äôt like the wearable devices, I only wear my good watch and I am not going to wear a tracker on the other wrist, so don‚Äôt even suggest it.

Bad dashboard and I can‚Äôt make new alarms. I can‚Äôt set or have any option to make a new alarm. This isn‚Äôt intuitive or should be in a general settings category. It isn‚Äôt found anywhere on the sleep option and can‚Äôt be set through the watch. I‚Äôd like to set a weekend alarm but it‚Äôs not possible.

Unimpressed Extremely disappointed with Fitbit recently. The new IOS update unfortunately requires Fitbit to change the personal settings on your phone, no longer allowing you to disable you previews, in order to receive texts on the watch. I also still have not gotten used to the new dash. It‚Äôs terrible, as all Fitbit users have been complaining. I‚Äôm officially moving over to the Apple Watch. Doesn‚Äôt seem to be a solution and no ones seems willing to help. They just keep telling me I need to turn on the previews in my messaging notifications which again means every time I get a text it will be out on display for anyone to read on my phone. Too bad. I‚Äôve owned 4 of these watches over the last several years. Fitbit has lost a customer.

Text message issues I have the Versa and when the iPhones went through the new update. It did something with the notifications for text messages to the Fitbit. I use to get the notifications to my watch and ever since that update, I am not getting my text message notifications to my watch anymore. All notifications are turned on so not sure why this is happening. I restarted my Fitbit and everything and still nothing. Is anyone else having this problem? My friend and I are having this issue. Everything else about my Fitbit I love. Need to fix issue!

New design interface fails Been a loyal Fitbit user for years, recently upgraded to a new tracker, but now the new UI phone app update kicked in automatically and I hate it. I feel foolish for spending good money on a new device and then Fitbit just downgraded the app! Tiny dull icons that look like an ugly menu you have to scroll through just to see your dash. Tons of wasted white space. The original one was vibrant and large tiles that filed the screen so you could easily see everything in one look, no scrolling or flipping through menus to get to. Why ruin a good thing? Not so sure about Fitbits direction after this...disappointing move from a brand I used to love. Change it back or customers will have to make their own choice to stick with your brand or leave!!

PLEASE FIX!! I‚Äôd give Fitbit a 5 star rating, but this app (& it‚Äôs not just me, but several people that I‚Äôve talked to who own Fitbits) won‚Äôt update my personal best for any type of weekly/weekend step challenges. A couple of weeks ago, I had gotten around 55,000 steps by the end of the week & it said 55k was my new personal best when in reality my personal best for a workweek hustle was 88,000. I don‚Äôt understand why the app is doing this. It‚Äôs quite frustrating actually when you‚Äôre trying to go back and look at your trophies & see that, that one is super low & not accurate. Also, it hasn‚Äôt changed back to saying 88,000 steps is still my PR. Annoyed & saddened. That‚Äôs all.

Love Fitbit, hate the recent update. I tried to give the most recent update some time (both for me to get adjusted and for Fitbit to work out the kinks and bugs).  I‚Äôm really unhappy with the changes. I‚Äôve followed all the troubleshooting articles that I‚Äôve seen suggested by the developer on other reviews and none have helped.

Child friendly? Fitbits are great and I think there the bast watch, and the app is super easy to handle and use. The one issue hat I have is that it‚Äôs not child friendly. There a lot of cuss words and words that kids shouldn‚Äôt be learning. I have reported countless people for nudity and language, and they I haven‚Äôt got a response!!üò° I got in trouble for something that I didn‚Äôt even do, and these people are getting away with a lot of inappropriate things. And lastly I can‚Äôt message people that are my friends, even if they just friended me it says that I‚Äôm not friends with them.

Great...when it doesn‚Äôt crash App is great when it works. For about the past month it‚Äôs been unreliable and crashes for no apparent reason anytime day or night while using. Unpredictable since you‚Äôll be going along fine using the app then it will just crash and close itself out for no apparent reason. In addition, it‚Äôs a battery killer. For the past month or so my iPhone 6‚Äôs battery has been dying extremely quickly. Even to the point of the battery level percentage ticking down like a clock right before my eyes. I thought I‚Äôd have to get a new phone because it was essentially unusable unless it was plugged in. But, I decided to turn off all notifications from the fitbit app and close it out when not using it. Voila, battery acts normal again!

Love this app, but... This app is great I have never had a problem with it until I got a new Fitbit. I originally had a Fitbit flex and it worked great with app. Whenever I opened the app, it would immedietly have my steps and other information. Now, I have the Fitbit Alta HR, and when I open the app it never has the data right away. When I first got the new Fitbit, I noticed it was slower to load, which makes sense because the Alta has a lot more information to process. Now the app won‚Äôt load at all and I will normally have to restart my phone and open and close the app multiple time before it will work. Other than that, the app is great and I love my Fitbit Alta.

Sleep insights broken? I normally don‚Äôt have any problems with the app. But recently when I go to look at my sleep, it hasn‚Äôt been tracking my sleep stages as often. Which could be a problem with my Fitbit but I‚Äôm not sure.

Need some improvements on heart rate tracking. If I go on a walk, typically 2+ miles, tracks my heart rate beautifully. However, when I get home and get on the stationary bike, the heart rate tracking goes to the crapper. My bike tracks it, I keep it in the peak range, but my tracker sometimes has my heart rate at almost 100 beats slower. (Bike reads 151 when tracker reads 55) I can‚Äôt go bump it either. Seems a little ridiculous since I have the Charge HR 2!!

Awesome ! Got mine for Christmas. It is amazing. I have AFib and need to exercise. Not good about either in the past. Now I am doing this everyday. I like that it buzzes to remind you of the steps needed. I like that it is waterproof. Only take it off to charge. It makes me very accountable. If I don‚Äôt have enough steps towards the end of the day, I go walking. The same with water. I like being able to monitor it to. Most of all, I like the heart rate graff. This has made a huge impact towards my being healthier and more fit. One of the best presents I have ever received. I rate it 5 stars!

I want to give 5, but... The entire syncing issue. I have a moto e 4 plus, and it was doing awesome for the first 2 weeks. Then with the last app update, it stopped working. I tried for days to get it to sync; the only thing I didn‚Äôt want to do was delete it. Then I decided to try and see if it would work on my iPad. It syncs with my iPad(6th gen), so I‚Äôm not giving up on it. However, this entire issue has messed with a lot of people‚Äôs accounts and devices, and even though I got mine figured out, it‚Äôs really disappointing that anyone is dealing with it. You guys need to fix it. If it gets fixed, I‚Äôll change it to a 5, because I‚Äôm entirely attached to my ionic.

Fix the annoying message (2) Update: In response to the reply from Fitbit, it is not adequate enough to adjust my rating higher. The App running in background is no problem. Closing the App has been the same since I‚Äôve owned & used it with iOS. It just started, as I mentioned & others on your Community Board, with a recent upgrade. It has ‚Äúnot‚Äù been the expected behavior. We do not need to be reminded to ‚ÄúSynch‚Äù after it was done less than 5 seconds before the message appears. Oh, my iOS settings were not changed. Again it‚Äôs a problem  noted by Fitbit Moderator(s).

Second to improve my sleep but here is the problem, I often get up at least once during the night and most often that simply registers as a few minutes of awake. However if I get up sooner in my 7-8 hour sleep time Fitbit then ignores the first several hours of sleep. MOST FRUSTRATING. I found this happening more recently so maybe one of your updates is causing the issue. Last night I was not out of bed for more than 3 minutes and 2-3 hours of sleep disappeared!

Used to love Fitbit I have had various styles of Fitbit's over the years, and have enjoyed them. This is until I updated to iOS 13. After going through all the help pages I could find, I was able to get my notifications to work. However, when I get an incoming call, my Fitbit continues to vibrate even after the call has been answered. This is not going to work for me long term, and am looking for other options. I have been patiently waiting for a fix, but it‚Äôs been over 2 months with nothing. If there is not a solution by the end of the year, I will change. If anyone reading  this (developers) can give me additional help, it would be much appreciated.

Good, But Needs Polish I love the Fitbit app. It excels compared to the other #1 fitness tracking app. I enjoy the weight tracking via my Fitbit Aria scale! I love the integrations with other apps. I do think tracking food needs some focus by the Fitbit product team. It‚Äôs extremely difficult to understand macros on a food line item. When selecting a serving size, I want to see a breakdown of macros for that selected food. I think the nutrition facts should dynamically adjust as you adjust serving size. Additionally in the daily summary, the macro pie chart is impossible to read. I have no idea what color maps to protein, fat or carbs! Please improve the food logging section of the app!

Love but can‚Äôt receive my Text message notifications I love my Fitbit been using it for years now but I‚Äôm having trouble get my text message notifications. I can receive everything but my text messages. I have done everything that Fitbit has suggested and it still doesn‚Äôt work. I hope that they fix this soon because I really enjoy getting my notifications. It reminds to go back back to respond to people because I‚Äôm not super active on my phone that was part of the reason why I bought the Fitbit in the first place. Please please fix this Fitbit.

Time. So, I have a feeling I‚Äôm the only one with this problem. 2 years ago I got a Fitbit. I was in love with it at first. It was fun to work out, run, and more cool options about the Fitbit. Now I‚Äôm not the most responsible, so a year later I lost my Fitbit. This year, my family is moving so we empitied out our old house and we found my Fitbit. I was so happy. I even got new bands and everything! So then, when I put it on I saw that it was a WEEK off and TWO hours off! So I looked on the forums and found that I needed to change the time zone. Oddly enough, the time zone was right. Fitbit please help me to change the time on my Fitbit, it‚Äôs messing my fitbit‚Äôs health status up! -L

Incorrect Step Count in Notifications UPDATE 19 SEP 2018: App has been working great and has not shown a huge discrepancy in step counts lately. I would still like to see the food database grow in restaurants and food, and clean up some of the duplicates that seem to exist when searching the database.

Loading music is ridiculously complex I like my Versa well enough. It is not perfect, but nothing is, and it serves the purposes I need it for well. If I wanted a Garmin or Apple Watch, I would have bought one.

The watch won‚Äôt lock... So the watch has a bunch of battery sucking features turned on by default. You configure all these features down until you get the battery life you like but there is still a feature that neither the app nor the watch address: two tap wake up. So you jog and jog and jog and feel your wrist vibrate and look down and see your jog was force completed by your sleeve even though you have lift to wake turned off.

Barely worth installing For the initial few months after installing, I loved this app. But now it's basically worthless. Yes, I can see my steps walked, but I can see that on my fitbit as well. I mostly used this app to see my calories burned and calories remaining, and that hasn't worked properly in weeks. I emailed support and got an answer of "thanks, we'll notify our engineers", and that was weeks ago and it's still not fixed . The app is basically useless now, which is a shame because it has a lot of potential.

Fitbit charge 3 Great technology an smart fitness tracker it has alot of great features including telling time counting steps tracking sleep tracking heartrate tracking calories burned tracking exercise tracking periods it has a awesome alarm that vibrates you awake it has a stopwatch an timer an tells the weather temperature it can be connected to your phone by Bluetooth an displays calls an text messages and you can change the bands an the color an look of your Fitbit overall its a great accessory an piece of technology to own

Fun! I‚Äôm enjoying the fitbit so far. I‚Äôm mostly disappointed with the inconsistency of the sleep stages portion. I‚Äôve had the Charge 3 for 6 days and the sleep stage has only worked 2 of those six days. The other days it switches to sleep pattern which only tells you when you were awake and when you slept. Sleep stages seems to only work when you‚Äôve fully charged the fitbit that day. A little irritating cause that means I have to take it off once a day to recharge and reset in order to get an accurate look at my sleep stages. It seems a lot of people have had this issue with Charge 2 also. It‚Äôs sad it hasn‚Äôt been fixed yer.

Get it together Fitbit. I loved my Fitbit app until about 3-4 months ago. Before things started going wrong with weekly challenges. Fitbit build its platform on steps and challenges right?! So when you have an app that doesn‚Äôt sync your weekly steps correctly in challenges, it becomes very annoying. In the past two months I have joined numerous of challenges. Yet in every single challenge (no matter if it‚Äôs in the same time zone or a different time zone than my location) My step numbers (and many others users) are not syncing correctly the numbers are not even matching what the app claims your weekly steps are. And when you contact support they don‚Äôt understand the issue....Really?!

Calorie tracking I love my Fitbit and how I can track calories within the app.  However it would be great if I could change days once I track & save like I can go back and edit measurements.  It‚Äôs a bit time consuming to delete and start over something I accidentally tracked for today that I want for tomorrow instead.  Also it would be great if you had a repeat feature to press and then add to other days.  I often eat the same lunches for a 5 day work week since I started meal prepping.

Fitbit inspire HR So I got the Fitbit inspire HR for my birthday a few weeks ago and it was working perfectly fine and everything but then today I got this notification talking about my location, I‚Äôm not rlly sure. But then when I went on the app I was logged out and I tried putting my password and email and it wouldn‚Äôt let me in so I tried resetting it by sending myself an email through the app but I‚Äôm not getting any of the emails I sent myself. (And yes I have the correct email but I‚Äôm not sure if someone hacked into my account or it‚Äôs a glitch, so If i Can get help i would be grateful!)

AMAZING!!! I looooooove Fitbit! I currently have a Fitbit Alta and it is just amazing. I feel so happy healthy and organized. Thank you Fitbit app! But....If I may I have one suggestion! I REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY REALLY HOPE YOU PUT THIS INTO CONSIDERATION!!!!! So on a normal Fitbit it has a relax button. I really love to mediate and when my friend showed me that I'm like "whoa!! How did you get that?" Than I realized you can't do that on the Fitbit Alta! So it would be great if you could put a relax or mediation button thingy on it!! It would make me even more pleased. Besides that definitely get this app! Thanks againüëç :)
Syncing issue seems to be resolved. Update: I rebooted both the device and my phone and now seems to be syncing again just fine.

Love my fitbit tracker and aria scale, but the app falls short for me I'm trying to be more health-conscious and watch my eating habits and exercise. I'm totally blind and use a screenreader called voiceover on the iPhone. One of the reasons I chose Fitbit was because the app worked well with voiceover. I loved being able to track all of my stats and change my goals independently. However, in recent updates this has changed. I can still do the absolute basics, but it seems like with each new update, The app becomes less and less usable with voiceover. I have to give the app only 2 stars because it's becoming so unusable for me. If usability with voiceover improves in the future, I‚Äôll be more than happy to change my rating.

Bluetooth issues I love my Charge 2.  The issue I have been having the last 2-3 updates (and I have one waiting now) it doesn‚Äôt sink all the time with my Bluetooth on my iPhone 6.  I had no problem when I get my 2 last year and it stayed synced with my phone Bluetooth (for calls and text) until about a month or so ago.  I have to keep reconnecting it. I googled it and for a solution, but it only lasted till the next update. Also it‚Äôs not good with keeping steps while your pushing a shopping cart Other than these, I love it for everything else and it‚Äôs features.

Works Extremely Well The app works great! I am finding it to be a comprehensive tool for weight management. I was using three separate apps to collect the information in Fitbit. Having everything in one place makes for a much clearer picture. My only complaint is that the food search does not provide specific calories on meats. You have to select from a large range of calories for the same weight and cut of meat. This is not helpful. Otherwise, most foods are in the database and easy to add. Though I did also find one food that did not match the package calories per ounce.
Love it! I have the Fitbit charge two and this app has made me obsessed!!!

Phenomenal potential, terrible at listening to your customers This app has tremendous potential. The amount of things that can be done and tracked inside it is amazing and highly motivating. However, we have been requesting macros to have the option to be displayed in grams as well as the existing percentages for a long time now. Anyone into fitness knows that this is a no brainer. This should be a simple piece of coding as you already can view them in grams in the web application just not the mobile app. Why???? Am I really suppose to open a browser and check my macros in grams when I sit down to eat? Come on Fitbit, listen to your consumers and get this done! I‚Äôll gladly rate the app five stars when this gets done as I feel this is the only thing it lacks.
Can't update your app anymore ??Impossible to download, because of iTunes glitch that Apple is not fixing

What is taking so long?!?!? Similar to ALL of the recent month long reviews, I no longer get messages on my versa. I recently had to replace it (about 14 days AFTER the warranty was up) because I jumped in a pool with it on and it was not waterproof (even though it said it WAS). I was given a 50% off discount so I bought a new one. Now no messaging. This was the original reason for purchasing the versa. I am a therapist and cannot answer my phone during sessions. However, I have my own small children and it is important that I have access to messages in case of emergencies. What will it take for Fitbit to fix this issue?? I‚Äôm embarrassed for the company. Shame on you. Please don‚Äôt respond to my review with ‚Äúsorry you feel this way‚Äù. Fix the issue.

Alta HR no longer syncing after update I‚Äôm on my second Fitbit device and have never had a problem I couldn‚Äôt solve by a combination of updating, re-syncing, and/or resetting the device, my phone, or the app.

2.49 Version Killed My Syncing Ability Did the app update now my Charge HR2 WILL NOT SYNC. I‚Äôve done everything. üòë And no it‚Äôs not my phone, my phone works with all my other Bluetooth devices. I‚Äôve done everything but plug it into a computer to sync wired. üòë Please fix. I have used FitBit since launch; the tiny pink & black one that clipped; fix the app. I am seriously about to throw this Charge HR 2 away and buy an Apple Watch or Garmin. The app bug in 2.49 won‚Äôt sync and it‚Äôs obvious from the other reviews it did it to all different models. You‚Äôve made the product inoperable. I had to sync it with my MacBook to get my Charge HR 2 to function. Ridiculous. UPDATE: So now that I fixed that, every time I take a nap now it doesn‚Äôt register. ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è So sad. Not sure what‚Äôs going on at FitBit.

Loses workouts I have a Fitbit Blaze.  One thing that I have repeatedly noticed is when it is auto recognizing a bike ride, I seem to only get credit for a portion of it.  For instance today, we headed out on a ride on a bike trail near us.  We rode for about 35 minutes out, turned around and rode about 10 minutes heading back. We then took a walk around an area for approximately 10 minutes, then headed home the remaining 20 minutes or so.  After syncing with my phone, I got ‚Äúcredit‚Äù for a 22 minute ride.  Discouraging.  I‚Äôve noticed that on walks also.  If I stop for awhile in between two activities, it seems like the first one gets overwritten.

I love the app! But I use your app on my phone all day. And I love that you have added a period tracker. With that it hard to change when my period has moved or more or less day I have. I will like to see something that‚Äôs ez to see or fixed With that. I also use/like the weekly exercise tracker. I‚Äôd love to see if you added more then just for walking. Like doing house work or other workout. That‚Äôs all I have I hope you will take in some of my suggestions. I feel it will make the app with exercise tracker big time.

Constant bugs I have the Alta Fitbit and I‚Äôm finding it is consistently tracking less steps than my phone and the app when i input the steps. The app on the other hand has constant bugs that need fixing. There are challenges that you can participate in and they are usually fun to be apart of, unless the app isn‚Äôt syncing your activity properly. The last week and a half my app has counted 6-8k less than what my Fitbit says and even though in the dashboard it has appeared to be in sync, it leaves me way behind in any of the challenges even though I should be in the lead. Really disappointing that they can‚Äôt get their ducks in a row

Fitbit is the one and only! I‚Äôve tried other fitness watches before, none of which have lasted even close to as long as my Fitbit has, and I‚Äôve only had this for 3 months. The app is great and user-friendly, and gives you ‚Äúinsights‚Äù to help you improve sleep, how much you exercise, and overall health. The Charge 3 has everything I need. I‚Äôve never had any problems with the app, and I love checking it every day to see how my day-to-day schedule affects my health. The battery life is amazing as well. Love the app and my Fitbit!
Annoying constant pop up notification with version 2.92 Why this annoying pop-up notification with no way to opt out or turn if off!?!?!

Fitbit Great way to keep yourself moving. Also, wonderful way to evaluate sleep quality. I have had a Fitbit since they first came out in the 1990s. At first I was disappointed that I couldn‚Äôt get a Fitbit One replacement, but the interactive quality of the watch with the app is tremendous. I‚Äôm now in my 70‚Äôs and the quality of life is much better than most of my peers (no life debilitating chronic conditions). A great gift for yourself or someone you love. I‚Äôm somewhat technically challenged but so far the support staff has managed to keep me connected.

April update I loved this app until I was apparently part of an ‚Äúinvited‚Äù group to beta test the new version of the dashboard. I was not asked to beta test the new version and as I posted on the Fitbit community page, I HATE IT! Not only does the dashboard look completely different than the picture in the app, a old notification popped back up from 2 years ago that I can‚Äôt delete. There is no way to go back to the older version. And by the way, the new version looks NOTHING like the picture on this page. Other people have also been switched without knowing it was happening. I would say this is a huge fail on Fitbit‚Äôs part. I may be looking into an Apple Watch going forward.

author_name: This app is awful after the update
review_body: New app version is severely lacking Just bought matching Inspire HR's for my GF and I on prime day. We both downloaded the app and she got the old version while I've got the "new improved" version... It's horribly over simplified. I can't update my exercise goals, it always reverts to the preset 5 days. It's much harder to navigate, and doesn't provide the same level of details as the older version. For example, it does a much better job breaking down the sleep cycle information and it details the amounton REM sleep on my GF's app when the new version doesn't. We have identical devices but because of the app differences it feels like mine is a cheap knockoff because of the limitations of the new "streamlined" app.
Updated review Update: the app STILL ISN'T SYNCING with my Fitbit. Several "bug fixes" later, and still not working? What's up guys? I've tried every troubleshoot there is.

Food entries- Everything about the Fitbit app is really awesome. I really love Fitbit and most of their products work very well. The only part about the app that I don‚Äôt like so much is that most people don‚Äôt put the correct nutritional information in, or it might be that the (food) brand makes the difference, I‚Äôm not sure. But I try to put all of my food in myself (customize option) because every time I check the calories or protein someone has entered the wrong information. Other then that- it‚Äôs amazing!

When it works, it‚Äôs great I have a Charge 3, which is the third Fitbit device I‚Äôve owned. They seem sturdy and well made but I‚Äôve had recurring issues with the Bluetooth syncing process that makes me question if they use a quality Bluetooth transmitter/receiver in the tracker. Customer support has been great, they‚Äôll stay on the line with you for a long time to help get things fixed. On an earlier device, they sent me a replacement at no charge, which I thought was pretty cool move on their part. But the problems with the Charge 3 have me thinking of looking at other devices. Just needs too much tweaking to keep it operational.

Downhill notifications When I get some form of electronic device, I give it every benefit of the doubt and presume when I follow the directions, it WILL WORK! The first several months I had it, it was perfect! I received texts, phone calls and calendar notifications- just as expected. I loved it. Then, for the past several months I only received calendar notifications. No phone calls. No texts. I deleted and restored the app. I checked notifications and made sure they‚Äôre on, etc. Trouble shooted every which way from Sunday, and still do not receive text notifications. I DO receive phone notifications now, but the the texts do not show up. It‚Äôs aggravating and annoying.
24 May 2019 Update for app 1 star review is ONLY for the latest update. I usually love my FitBit app and have always rated every update with 5 stars.

Problems with app I‚Äôve experienced some problems with this app. When it is working properly it gives good details and I enjoy loading my workouts, however this app is terrible with syncing. I will have my watch either on the charger or sitting right next to my phone and it will repeatedly fail to sync. I have a new charge 3, I‚Äôve only had it about 3 months, and yet I‚Äôve had to ‚Äúforget this device‚Äù and completely reset it with the app 4 times, usually right when I‚Äôm about to go work out! I find it very frustrating to work with. Would recommend the watch- would not recommend this app.

I used to be a fan. I used to be a huge fan of Fitbit, but after the update in October 2019 my Fitbit Versa has not received text message notifications from my phone. I've restarted my phone, deleted the app, rebooted the app and rebooted my iPhone from before the update. Nothing has fixed it. It is beyond frustrating because it was one of the main reasons, along with counting my steps, using it for exercise, and checking my hours for sleep. This is my second Fitbit and now have to switch to an iWatch. My Versa will turn a year old in December, and until October I never had any types of problems. I wish there was better help out there for this problem to be fixed instead of spending more money on something else.
If the app worked correctly Everything is great with the product.

Less useful, more infuriating Thanks for making my charge 3 a negative experience for me.  The app is cluttered and less functional since you ‚Äúimproved‚Äù it.  Reading other recent reviews tells me that you have succeeded in alienating your user base.  That is certainly the case for me.  Until recently, my wife and I were happy with Fitbit.  We have bought 4 of them.  Sadly, no more for us.  You have lost us due to paywalls, decreasingly useful apps, and increasingly irritating user experience.

Sleep Score is useless and causes anxiety Ever since the new update to Fitbit that includes the ‚Äúsleep score,‚Äù I have been considering getting rid of my Fitbit. When I wake up and see that my sleep is scored as ‚Äúpoor,‚Äù but with no context (unless I pay for the subscription version of the app), it just causes me anxiety. It was helpful when I got my average hours of sleep because that was something I had at least a little control over, but the sleep score just makes me feel like a failure with no way to improve. I hope Fitbit listens to the people in the community that find this anxiety-inducing like I do, and either gets rid of ‚Äúsleep score‚Äù all together or makes it optional to choose between that and average hours slept. This is a terrible update!

Challenge Stats I do like the updated app with the exception of all the challenge winner postings on my main page which clutters my options. I don‚Äôt want to flip up and down to find my ‚Äúlog water‚Äù or sleep tracker. How can I get rid of the unnecessary challenge results on this page? I currently have 6 challenges displaying and I only have a challenge with 1 person everyday. These have resulted from being unable to accept challenge and no way to delete this mess. I have to close Fitbit multiple times a day because a normal sync doesn‚Äôt work. Would send you a screenshot but don‚Äôt see an option to include it.
Great!...except for one little thing Update: previous crashing problems seem to be fixed.

Love this app  would like to see more My wife bought me a Fitbit charge 2 for Christmas and I absolutely love it !! And as far as the app goes it gives you all the settings for you Fitbit that you need as well as a very user friendly way of seeing you stats one thing that I would like to see more of us more virtual trails that you could ‚Äúhike on‚Äù  I would really like to see the appalachian trail as an option that is one high I have always wanted to go on but I simply do not have the time or resources to pursue right now

Stopped receiving text messages with update .. Once I purchase my iPhone 8 Plus, my Charge HR stopped receiving texts messages. I did everything I was instructed to do. I deleted the app, re-synced it, re-paired it MULTIPLE times, called and lodged a complaint and was told they were still trying to develop a new software update which has yet to come out. I receive phone call notifications but not the text message notifications. What‚Äôs the point of having this Fitbit if it doesn‚Äôt work? I‚Äôm extremely disappointed. Nothing makes it work and when I called the rep I talked to only made ‚Äúnote‚Äù of my concerns. Prior to upgrading my phone I was very happy with the product. It‚Äôs been 9 months since this watch has worked as it should. UNIMPRESSED ever since.

So good I worry about getting some other watch brand Kind of funny how an app could engender brand loyalty, but it does. I‚Äôm older, don‚Äôt really want to mess with too much, but love HR, steps, auto exercise, vibrate alarms etc etc. Great feature set for TRYING to stay not too fat. Started getting a little mad that syncing seemed to get messed up two updates back, but maybe recent update ‚Äúmisc bug fixes‚Äù solved it... cause it‚Äôs gone. Which is the last point. Apps are only as good as them being constantly updated... and this one is.

No apple health integration - get with the program The title says it all.  Wow.  Relinquish my data to me please.  I know you want me to use the Fitbit app - and I will - but I want all my data in Health too.  Tell your PMs to stop obsessing about product stickiness and give users what they want.  There are several looong threads on the Fitbit support site asking for this.

Crashes and freezes, won't sync, iOS 10.2.1 This review is in regards to the app update from April 18th. The app was working fine, but since it updated April 18th it is broken and I can no longer sync my Fitbit. It freezes, heats up my phone, and either crashes or in one case crashed my entire phone. My Fitbit hasn't synced since the 18th making the device nearly useless.

Only works for a couple months. I‚Äôve had my Fitbit Charge 2 since the beginning of April when I received it for my birthday. I was stoked. I got the Fitbit app and synced my Fitbit up to my phone and it was great. I loved having all the notifications on my phone and alarms and just being able to track my steps and sleep. Well now it‚Äôs July and my Fitbit stopped syncing up to my phone and my Bluetooth. I keep turning on and off my Bluetooth and I‚Äôve restarted to app several times and I‚Äôve even deleted the app and got it again and my Fitbit will not sync up to my phone whatsoever. It‚Äôs horrible. We spent over hundreds of dollars on something that I can‚Äôt use for half of the things  I use to.

One of the best around!!! I‚Äôve loved Fitbit for a very long time and think it‚Äôs a great way to keep yourself challenged and motivated. HOWEVER, I wish I could be able to use this app alone for tracking everything each day. Please please please add a larger selection of workouts to choose from! I want the ability to be able to add my HIIT classes as well as my weight training, squats, etc. Also, please allow us the ability to track our vitamins and supplements as well! Keep up the good work and keep expanding the app! I would love to switch over to the Fitbit app completely

Disclaimer: this review is about the period log. I have been a loyal Fitbit owner and user since their invention and love the app.  No complaints until now.  I was very excited when the period log option was announced.  So far it‚Äôs pretty disappointing.  It‚Äôs not terribly user friendly yet,  for instance I used to be able to edit the dates and now I don‚Äôt have that option.  So I‚Äôll go back to using another separate app for this and watch for updates in this area.

Love my Fitbit I‚Äôm trying to stay active and fit. As a 70 year old retiree, it‚Äôs easy to retire to my recliner and watch TV and watch the news all day. My Fitbit tracks all my activities including sleep. This motivates me to move and do what I should do. It even has exercise challenges and coaching available. The only downside is the screen is too small. I bought the Fitbit 3 because of the price and the way it looks on my small wrists. Guess I should have sprung for the larger screen. I still like my 3 and wear it constantly. Great tool!

Kind of bummed out I just got a Fitbit charge 2, and I was super stoked to integrate it into the data I‚Äôve already got in the Health app; however, there is no integration, short of paying for third party apps. It‚Äôs not super accurate as far as steps because it uses wrist movement to track steps. Perhaps the calorie count is accurate because arm movement still burns calories. I haven‚Äôt yet gotten out of bed today and already it‚Äôs telling me I have taken 147 steps. Wondering how it will perform when I go to my workout tomorrow. Maybe I‚Äôll only wear it when I go running, but then I might as well just continue using my phone since that data is already in the Health app (which syncs with my other fitness app).

Good product, faulty bands. I love the Fitbit functionalities. I started with the That clips to your clothing on your hip. That got washed with my clothing and continued to work. I had a ChargeHR next that worked fine. I now have the Alta HR. It works good as well and the has a long battery life  the problem I have is with the bands.  I gave lost trackers because of faulty bands. The bands are not constructed to endure the life of the product, for its intended use. Customer Service is very good. They respond timely with instructions and or replacement of band. I have looked in to buying a different tracker, but I‚Äôve been with Fitbit for so long now, I‚Äôm staying until this Alta stops working or lost.

Love it when it works Fitbit is a really great way to track workouts without thinking too much about it and most of the time it works great. I do have repeated issues where I will start my workout on my watch to find out that it never started recording my workout and if I am doing weights it does not even record active minutes. Receiving text messages in my Fitbit is hit and miss. And running on the treadmill never matches my Fitbit. The faster I run on the treadmill the less mileage my Fitbit says I have gone. Very frustrating. But overall I do depend a lot on it.

Good except for... I love my Fitbit and depend on it daily to challenge myself to get the steps I need. One apparent glitch with the app bugs me, though. I frequently have to turn my phone‚Äôs Bluetooth function off, wait a couple minutes, then turn it back on in order for the phone app to sync with the device on my wrist. If I don‚Äôt notice it for a few days, the app sometimes shows ‚Äúzero‚Äù steps for those days until I re-sync it. I found this workaround (turning Bluetooth off, then back on) in an online forum, but I can‚Äôt seem to find a permanent fix.

Love the layout The layout and features are great and easily understood. My wife has an Apple Watch, which tracks everything and probably a little more, but the interface is so difficult to understand and the information is not laid out as well that she actually likes this better, despite probably having a device that is ‚Äòcapable‚Äô of doing more. Fitbit‚Äôs App is so pleasantly surprising that it is the first thing I tell folks what I like about Fitbit - crazy as that sounds it‚Äôs not the device ... it‚Äôs the app!!!

My Fitbit has been life changing As the title says, my Fitbit has been life changing. The food tracking is much better than both My Fitness Pal and Weight Watchers. It tracks your sleep in great detail which has enabled me to be more refreshed and well-rested for my day. And there‚Äôs even a period & ovulation tracker. I had an Apple Watch before which broke from too many ocean swims, and this Fitbit is legitimately better for many reasons such as sleep tracking, the way that they track calorie burning, the food logging, etc.

Lame ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù up sell I paid for my Fitbit and expected to be able to use it with the app.  It was great for a while but now the sleep analysis is part of some premium feature I need to buy separately.  No thanks.  Why should I pay to use the fitness tracker that I already bought??? It‚Äôs about time for an upgrade anyhow, so no more Fitbit for me.  Looking at alternatives.

Great pair, but bad pairing after updates. Was working fine until latest update.   Now it does not pair like it use to and not able to get notifications as well. Fantastic set of features It was mostly easy to use the app and set up a new Alta HR. The only issue was solved with a search on the Fitbit Community forum. Since then, I‚Äôve been very impressed. If I did want to keep using my previous apps, the Fitbit app would be compatible with many of them, and that‚Äôs just awesome. But so far Fitbit does it all just as well or better.

Terrible product shouldn‚Äôt be bought I just bought the Fitbit charge 2 less than a month ago. I have had the Apple Watch for over a year. Fitbit Versa Great App I love it. I had a Fitbit charge 2 for several years and loved it. For Christmas I upgraded to the Versa. Charge 3 - Overkill? My wife and I received new Fitbits as Christmas gifts from one of our children. We are active seniors and have been wearing Fitsbits for at least 3 years. Switched Back! Last weekend I purchased an Apple Watch. As I started to use it I noticed the battery life was bad, really bad, and the app or should I says apps were lacking. ‚ÄúActive Days‚Äù My biggest complaint with this app is that the ‚Äúactive days‚Äù tracking is ALL over the place. I strive to get an active day every day, and sometimes it acknowledges and records it shortly after I earn the active day, and then sometimes it waits 7 hours before registering the exercise and active day. That‚Äôs problematic for me because I‚Äôm striving to achieve that active day, so I don‚Äôt know if I need to get more of a workout in, or if it‚Äôs just not registering it ‚Äúat that moment‚Äù. I always struggled with weight gain until Fitbit I started using the Fitbit in March 2013 and consistently lost weight to my goal. Whenever I stop entering my food I have a tendency to start regaining weight slowly. However, by creating custom meals for most of the foods I eat routinely, it takes very little effort to input those foods. The barcode scanner is great for packaged foods, and lookup is easy when eating out. Nothing else has ever allowed me to consistently lose and maintain weight as well as this does.  I still use it every day.

Easy to Keep Track of Your Stats I especially like the barcode reader, because looking that stuff up gets old quick.  No issues with sync. Good level of detail on sleep stages. Calories burned may need a little tweaking; I should weigh 78 lbs based on how many calories I burn every day, but I‚Äôm still a hair under 240. But that‚Äôs a function of the watch not the app.  Lets you manually enter your weight. I haven‚Äôt tried looking for blood pressure for those that have a machine, but if not that would be a good add.

Charge 3 sync issues I recently upgraded from the Alta to the Charge 3. With the Alta I had issues with syncing to the Fitbit app. Would work sometimes and then others would not. Please fix food entry I love Fitbit!  I‚Äôve been a happy customer since 2014.  I‚Äôve had about 3 fit bits over the years and have been satisfied with the interface and features of the app.

Bought a fit Was super excited to try out fit bit, I bought the fit bit charge 3.

Great App, but More Adventure Races Please! I love this app so much, and I‚Äôve never had any troubles with bugs or glitches. Need more insights with respect to Heart rate: Failed expectation I have bought  a new Fitbit charge 3 as my pulse rate gets too high sometimes.

NOTIFICATIONS ON ALTA FITBIT WATCH I‚Äôve had my Fitbit Alta for about a year now, I absolutely love tracking my steps in my family especially on hikes or walking around Disney World parks. An alright app I think this app is alright at the things it does. I don‚Äôt use it daily, as I more trust that it is collecting the data I want from my Fitbit. THANK YOU I love your app it helped A LOT. I loved having a fit bit and this past Christmas I got an Apple Watch. Now I didn‚Äôt want to get ride of my fit bit because I LOVED I SO SO SO MUCH!!!!! Works for/with me I really like this app the more I learn it‚Äôs features. It provides incentive for me to better the results in all areas. I need numbers in total grams protein, etc. Maybe that stat is there - I just haven‚Äôt found it yet. The custom food feature is awesome. First World Fitbit Problems I frequently check the app to see the progress I make throughout the day. I already work out daily, so keeping tabs on the app does keep me that much more motivated.  However, my biggest complaint is about the 250+ Steps per hour part.  I have contacted Fitbit five times about the same issue. Very great! Plz make more watch faces for Versa! I absolutely am in love with my Fitbit Versa! I love that you can change the band and watch face and seriously make it your own. Sleep, Walk & Heart rate My Fitbit is a regular item, day and night.  Helping me keep track of my activity level (or lack of) and checking my heart rate during the day then charging while I shower. I may have to update to a newer model (I inherited mine) so I can read the face when outside in the sun

Zero Customer Support for App If report a bug on this app, don‚Äôt expect a meaningful answer. For months now, users have been reporting a simple but annoying issue - the fact that the graph lines on the detailed heart rate don‚Äôt line up to the actual data. So, for example, a pulse rate of 68 will line up with a 75 line on the graph. The bug arose after a specific update, and the fix for Fitbit would be simple. It was immediately reported by users, and has been repeatedly reported for months now. Every reply from Fitbit has been ‚ÄúThanks for letting us know. Please keep your app up to date as we work to solve this issue.‚Äù No time commitment, no substantive info, and no fix. One star for abysmal customer service and a glitchy, bug ridden app.

I like the app, but a few tweaks would make it better I do really like the Fitbit app and it is easy to use. I find the notifications about low battery to be too slow, and wonder if you could have an approximate battery percentage in addition to the colored bar indicating the battery life. I have received an email telling me my battery was low, and then it was empty. I do not carry my charging cable with me at all times, nor am I always near a USB port, so I would find the % battery life most helpful to make sure I could charge it when I am able.

Notifications control is mediocre The ability to control your notifications is poor, at best. When you join a fitness group, and you comment on a post within the group, every time someone also makes a comment from there on out, you receive a notification from the app on your phone. How do you stop this? I don‚Äôt want my phone continuously going off because this app sends the notifications to me. I removed myself from the group and then joined again but it still continues to tell me others responded. I don‚Äôt care what everyone in this group continues to say 24/7. How do I make it stop?

Love the new styles I used to have an older generation Fitbit. It worked well but was clunky and not very stylish. The band broke on it and I haven‚Äôt had one in close to two years. I recently purchased the new Alta HR and I‚Äôm very happy with it so far. I like the slimmer design and the ability to change the bands. The only thing that I don‚Äôt like is that it doesn‚Äôt register my walking when I‚Äôm holding onto something like a stroller or shopping cart. At least that was true with my old Fitbit. Unhappy with a change on the updated app When I used the previous app for my Charge 2 it enabled me to review my weeks, months and year and have it show me my accumulated steps, miles or calories burned even while scrolling. Now, I can only see specific time periods as the app decides. I‚Äôd like more flexibility with reviewing my achievements. For example, I like seeing a month‚Äôs worth of accomplishments from two weeks of the previous month and two weeks of the current month. The updated app with my Versa watch won‚Äôt allow me to do that.

The app is part of what I love most about Fitbit. The Fitbit app is well-designed, customizable, and the built-in sleep tracking ‚Äî due to the long battery life of my Fitbit tracker (my Versa easily goes a week on a single charge) ‚Äî is fantastic. We tried being Apple Watchers, but switched back to Fitbit in under a month! Keep up the great work, Fitbit. We *would* love to see the ability to customize the vibrating notifications, and the need to integrate with Apple Health will be increasingly important. But for now, we are fully Fitbit!

Alta HR I have had the Fitbit Alta HR for almost 2 years now, and I love this watch/tracker!  I wasn't crazy about the band that came with it, but after wearing it, I find that I like it.  It is comfortable, and easy on my skin, even when I walk and exercise and get sweaty.   Also, I love the fact that the battery LAST almost a week before needing a recharge!!! That is much better than my Apple watch.  The Alta HR does an excellent job of tracking my daily steps, exercise, heart rate, and is really helping me with sleeping.  This is well worth the money!

Disappointed So I‚Äôve had this for a couple of years and it‚Äôs ok as a step counter, but the calories are way, way off.
