My Inspire HR I love my inspire hr. I only take it off to charge it and bath. It is a great source of info on my activity throughout the day and my sleep at night. I also love the new layout of the app.

Won‚Äôt sync with 2 devices I‚Äôve had the ionic for over a year now and I‚Äôve had Fitbit devices for as long as I‚Äôve been wearing a watch. Fitbit Flex It's a little early for a review.

Zumbagal I just got the Fitbit Alta and love some things about it, but the instructions available are terrible. Great but one thing... I really like the app. It has helped me be more mindful about my health and well-being. Step reminders & goals I like the app but I would like it better if they were going to have more than one step goal for the day. For instance it would be nice to set my goal limit to 10,000 and I also have a secondary goal of 12,000 so I can know that I can go beyond on my 1st goal of 10,000.

Win the Game Fitbit is an awesome app and utility. Bring back the old dashboard I updated recently and received the new dashboard even though it didn‚Äôt indicate this to be the case. (The update indicated it would ‚Äúfix bugs‚Äù. I‚Äôve read that a ‚Äúlucky few‚Äù were just given the new dashboard to ‚Äúhelp test it out‚Äù.

Denied the update, being punished When given the option, I denied the chance to update. After reading your reviews, I‚Äôm thankful of that! Atrocious Update The last update took the app twenty five steps backwards, possibly more being nothing works accurately anymore! Unable to track steps, sleep, anything really. Could be better Most of the activity portions work well. Selections for exercise should include something to give you credit while doing water sports like swimming. New update. Had to re-log in twice in the past 2 days. New Update: The newest change screwed up my friends list. I am number 6 and I cannot scroll up to see who is #1. It keeps showing me the cheer etc stuff.   Fix this

Need to fix bugs in latest update Update:  What eventually worked after my original post was to turn off my FitBit Charge 2, then resync.  Kudos to FitBit support for reaching out.

Great app but often have sync issues I have a Charge 3 and I love it. Awesome until the last update I drive for transit and have to turn my fitbit off in order to prevent getting fake steps. I turn it back on by clicking the left button when I‚Äôm on breaks. Ispire HR on Iphone 6 - text notification fix! I‚Äôve been using Fitbit for over 3 years with my Fitbit Zip. I recently upgraded to the Inspire HR and I love it!

Only 1 thing wrong I am 64 yrs old. Loved my Fitbit until 1 day there was an update & it no longer showed my actual steps. Had a completely different screen! So, consequently the Fitbit got shelved. Fitbjt FTW Being a previous Jawbone UP24 user transitioning over to fitbit was a breeze especially since I had no choice since Jawbone is now defunct. FitBit Blaze Received the Blaze as a Christmas gift from my daughter 2 years ago, replacing the Flex. Fitbit This is my 2nd Fitbit more bout that later. I have been please with my Fitbit. Easy to setup and use. My only issue is the poorly design strap. Disappointed I had a Fitbit charge that fell apart so bought a blaze. Was extremely disappointed it didn‚Äôt come with ANY instructions. Good if you don‚Äôt walk faster 14 minutes per mile. If you walk faster then 14 minutes per mile the app shorten each mile by 0.12 mile and changes you pace so you think you are walking faster.

Amazing App but has Connection issues. I just got my Fitbit Charge 3 a month ago and I‚Äôve noticed all day sync won‚Äôt stay on and I have to forget device and then reconnect it with Bluetooth. App gets worse and bloated over time I‚Äôve been a long time Fitbit user and I just get more and more annoyed with the app r erupting I open it.

App doesn‚Äôt update correctly Love my Fitbit and it‚Äôs nice to have a real time tracker of my movements throughout the day.

New Layout is Super Frustrating Ever since I was forced to update to the new layout, it‚Äôs been glitchy and buggy. It doesn‚Äôt always sync right. Not to mention the layout is super annoying. Awesome I feel motivated to workout, which I need to do for volleyball!! I enjoy the trackers of sleep, water, and calories the app provides. Pamet Girl I received the Fitbit Charge 2 for Christmas.  I‚Äôm in my sixties & had back surgery in the past few months. Honestly, I never even thought about getting a Fitbit for myself. Mostly great, but could use improvements I‚Äôve had a fitbit and the app for almost two years now and enjoy both! my only complaints are when you add in an exercise that the fitbit didn‚Äôt automatically pick up (ex: it rarely picks up my treadmill activity), the steps you add don‚Äôt get added into challenges. today I did 3 miles on the treadmill and my main screen shows 9k steps, but only added 5k into the challenge for today? Love/hate First I have had Fitbit form the beginning and loved it. Until the ionic. It worked good for about a week then now it won‚Äôt ever sync. Sleep analysis rarely works I gave up my Fitbit One for the Alta HR because I wanted the heart rate monitor and the sleep analysis. Love It! But... I love Fitbit! I even prefer it over My Fitness Pal. The flow of it is just easier and isn't complicated. It keeps me motivated too. All right Alta user here. Overall app does what it sets out to do. The initial screen could be more user friendly to put all the info there at once. Fitbit I use to love the Fitbit app but now I don't because I don't know how many steps I taking if when it needs to be charge. Getting worse I used to be a fan of this app, but as ‚Äúcoolness‚Äù gets added, reliability gets subtracted. App is not fully functional since last night. Update: I can now access features from my Today screen. But not the info is a lil inconsistent. I was getting detailed sleep info but not for today. Can‚Äôt Delete Messages? I would give this 4, maybe 5 stars, if you could just delete messages.  They recently added a feature allowing you to delete the actual message exchange, but you can‚Äôt delete the whole thing.  Seems like such a simple, rudimentary feature to not have.

A Waste. The app updates from the last couple of months have really screwed up my device and tracking. I really love Fitbit and their app. I have tried Garmin, and the major advantage is that I never have to figure out when to recharge (don‚Äôt move, your steps don‚Äôt count. Won‚Äôt load on IPhone 7 with newest update It worked fine this morning & then said it was updating around noon...ever since then when I go to open the app it won‚Äôt load. ‚ÄúUpgrade‚Äù is ugly and buggy and SLOW I do not like the new appearance at all, but the latest upgrade has made syncing horrible! Awful New Layout What did you do??  The new layout is harder to read, smaller fonts, less information at first glance, harder to interpret, more wasted white space. App freezes This app freezes and takes too much time to load my results. This app is comepletely frozen in my phone and does nothing. Love the device; despise the ‚Äúcommunity feed‚Äù feature on the app I wish there was an option to remove the ‚Äúcommunity feed‚Äù from the app. I never use it, I never plan to use it, and I dislike that I am basically spammed with posts by complete strangers every time I want to check my friends list. My personal trainer Love my Fitbit! Count my steps. Now I‚Äôm keeping track of the foods I eat. The calories I consume. And I‚Äôm losing excess weight because of it! I‚Äôm keeping track of how I‚Äôm doing during all of this and I‚Äôve started exercising! All thru my Fitbit!                             I recently accepted challenges from a friend on my Fitbit. I‚Äôm learning more everyday. I have been ill for two years now and I thank God for my Fitbit device and i phone because I‚Äôm stronger today and doing better because of it‚Äôs help.

Great app, just one problem I have It‚Äôs not a big problem but it‚Äôs pretty annoying. The app is making my Fitbit blaze have the time inaccurate because of what seems like a 30 second lag or something. I spent about an hour thinking it was the watch that was messed up then I realized the part in the app that says the time it was last updated, was about 30 seconds late. Again it‚Äôs nothing huge, it‚Äôs just extremely annoying at least to me. I would appreciate it if you guys would fix this.

Motivates me... The Blaze & FitBit system data recorder has helped motivate me to move into a healthier lifestyle. The instant feedback is good for me. By being able to document the nutrition of my meals & snacks, I‚Äôm eating better. I like knowing how far I travel during my twice daily walks. During the year I‚Äôve had my Blaze, I‚Äôve lost 70 pounds & am maintaining my goal weight. My doctor is pleased & I no longer need to use 3 medications. So for me, this device & feedback system is a wonderful tool helping me to a better life.

Fitbit is great for my health and weight loss What really makes this Fitbit and Aria 2 work great is having friends that also have them to help keep me on track and pushing me to do a little more each day. That accountability to others who can see my progress and I can see theirs helps me psh for my goals and succeed. Good except sleep tracker - heard back from developer I really like this app end it keeps me on my target. The problem with the sleep tracker is that sometimes it gets the bed time wrong. Bad update I have been using a Fitbit for about 2 years now and I loved it. I recently bought a charge 3 to replace my old Fitbit. Not showing detailed sleep since last update UPDATE: Today I was able to get detailed sleep data for the first time in a couple of days. Perhaps it was the logout and phone reboot that fixed it. Crashing issues and strap durability I love my Fitbit. I wear it all day everyday, except in the shower or when I go swimming. Also, I‚Äôm not sure if it‚Äôs because I sweat a lot at work or what but the ‚Äústrap‚Äù or whatever you call the part that keeps it on your wrist doesn‚Äôt stay together very well past the first month or so. Helps Mental Health I've only been using my Fitbit for a short time, but it has helped me to move more throughout the day and especially on weekends. Just awesome Since having a fitbit, which has only been for a few days; It has allowed me to stay stay focused on my day to day activities by setting realistic goals that are achievable. Few days So far I‚Äôve only had the Fitbit a few days. I really like it so far. All the tracking is nice. Although it‚Äôs a little frustrating to enter everything in all the time. My husband likes that I don‚Äôt have to set dumb and obnoxious alarms on my phone, the silent alarms are one of my favorite features!

Save yourself the money, do not get a fit bit This app always fails to sync with my device. Versa no longer connected I‚Äôve had my Versa for almost two years and I love it. Though in the past week (since this most recent update) my iPhone can no longer connect to it. Meh I love the idea of this app. When it works well it‚Äôs great. However, over the last couple months it has given me nothing but issues. I constantly experience issues while trying to sync. Reporting FitBit to BBB Why have you not recalled your product? Your product claims to receive text notifications which only some IOS users are actually able to receive. App is all jacked up now The app syncs to MyFitnessPal but 1 Day FitBit thought not to sync my exercises from MyFitness Pal to FitBit so beware if you sync a app to FitBit may decide it does not want to sync certain days from the supported app to FitBit you add exercises manually in FitBit it refuses to sync the exercises you manually enter so you lose a day of exercises. I love the style of the versa but theperformance is terrible I‚Äôm working on my third versa Fitbit. I‚Äôve been using Fitbit since the first little clip on model came on the market. Would rate 5 stars if Fitbit could interface with other devices I love being able to see my texts & keeping track of my sleep patterns, & the ability to track my water consumption & calorie intake for weight loss.I really love being able to add friends & seeing their progress, the ability to invite friends to a weekend step competition is fun and helps to be competitive. New Dashboard UI is GARBAGE Been a long time Fitbit user and have gone through some changes. This is by far the worst. They broke something that didn‚Äôt need fixing. Wish I‚Äôd gotten an under armor My flex 2 tracks spotty, sometimes it misses entire workouts and other times it tracks folding laundry as though I was on the elliptical (and believe me I don‚Äôt put that much effort into my laundry). Pleased so far Got the Charge HR this week for a birthday and, so far, I love it. Love that it syncs with my phone and I'm sure I'll like it even more as I investigate all it can track. I just have 2 complaints.

Subscribe? After buying a really expensive watch, you now want us to subscribe to paying a ridiculous amount of money per month/year to use features of the app? Why? We‚Äôve already bought the watch. Why should we pay more? I think you‚Äôre getting a little greedy.

Love my new Fitbit versa lite edition but... I got my Fitbit versa lite edition for Christmas I was so excited that I got it so I downloaded games on there adding a background. Horrible I originally went with the charge 3 because it sent text alerts in addition to the fitness things it tracks.

I hate my Fitbit charge 3 Ever since I earned and received this from my workplace, August 2019, I have had trouble with it. The notifications and all day sync won‚Äôt work. No issues The app does everything it‚Äôs designed to do. If you use your Fitbit correctly, it will track correctly on the app. Plain and simple. Love it Love my versa! Everyone always asks if it‚Äôs an Apple Watch.... no way man. Great watch half the price . I use my Fitbit versa for swimming laps and hiking mainly. The only thing I wish were better it my notifications for messages. I don‚Äôt get them all the time through the watch.

Great app This app is very easy to work with and as long as you don‚Äôt go too long between syncing your Fitbit it doesn‚Äôt take any time at all to sync. Needs work I got the Charge 2 at work as a Christmas gift and I love it.

Fitbit is love As long As i have my Fitbit I‚Äôm on track, no more laziness, no more dehydration, no more junk food (under control!) , and of course if you don‚Äôt do what this guy - Fitbit - tells you, you‚Äôre gonna get a bad guilty mind rest of the day. what a letdown I got my versa as a christmas gift, and it was working wonderfully until about 3 weeks ago. the watch stopped syncing, and whenever I tried to sync in the app, it couldn‚Äôt find the watch. I love my Fitbit BUT.... I love my Fitbit but this last update has not been one of their better ones.  It does track my steps, but if you‚Äôre part of a challenge, don't expect to sync correctly. Intuitive and practice I received the Charge 2 as a gift. The setup was quite easy as the app guided me through the procedure in a straight forward manner. Next level fitness Fitbit was something that I never thought I needed. My Fitbit was gifted to me and it quickly took charge of my mind. this app is going downhill This used to work great but I am currently (always) getting the red banner alert on top of the app saying that I need to connect to the internet to view history logs, when I am always connected to our wifi. Ionic fitbit I had 3 Fitbit ionics. The 1st one always worked fine until an update on January. Then I wasn‚Äôt able to turned it back on, after the update. I thought that‚Äôs ok . It updates a lot but love the Fitbit OMG so I got the Fitbit ace 2 and it‚Äôs awesome as heck! But it updates so much! Add some new features please We spend good money on our fitbits and research and pick the right fitness tracker for us. Then we find out the app for our new expensive tracker is only subpar.

Love it almost 100% One of the very few apps that I check multiple times a day... well organized, consistent, with very few problems. One issue - the one time I did report a years old issue (that had been reported and complained about numerous times) the developers were amazingly slow to respond and simply dismissive when they did. It was a horrible customer experience. They could just fix the issue, however, they chose to be jerks about it. If not for them I‚Äôd give it 5 stars.

Refresh/sync troubles, cool sleep data Ok app- wish I could turn off calories and a few details I don‚Äôt think are accurate/helpful on the Fitbit itself. The device doesn‚Äôt sync itself so I have to do it manually, even though it is set to auto. That means I get weekly email reports saying I did nothing if I don‚Äôt manually sync which is annoying.  If the battery dies, the time is off until I manually sync as well and I lose any data collected up until the manual sync, which is even more of a bummer.  I expected more given the price of the Alta, but oh well.

Pretty decent but... Overall this is a fairly easy to navigate app except for the ‚Äúfemale health‚Äù section which I find to be not super user friendly if you want to log info from previous days. I wish you could just tap a calendar day and then log info (Clue does this really well). I also wish that it would sync with my Apple Health app so I can have everything in one place. Otherwise, it is a pretty good app, displays all the information nicely, and does almost everything I would like it to do.

Great tracker for any lifestyle I‚Äôm constantly switching between ‚ÄúI‚Äôm going to get fit‚Äù and ‚ÄúI‚Äôll eat whatever I want‚Äù stages, but one constant is always my FitBit and the tracker app. The app helps me track things I wouldn‚Äôt normally think about, like water intake and sleep patterns, but also accurately tracks calories through nutrition and exercise.

App Good - wish there was a fishing short cut for Fitbit I find the app to be very good and useful. Easy to input info like food and water intake into the app.  When accessing your Fitbit via the app to update exercise shortcuts for the Fitbit, I wish there was an exercise short cut for fishing.  I see there is one for golf.  There needs to be one for fishing, especially for hose or is that Muskie fish and cast - cast - and cast heavy lures for hours on end.  Sometimes it‚Äôs on a boat and sometime it‚Äôs hiking and wading.  A exercise short cut would be nice to track some of the time / casting data.

No Strava or MMR Sharing While in any other situation, I would give glowing reviews to the Fitbit app, it‚Äôs frustrating to wear a heart rate monitor and not have that data be shared with other fitness apps that are more robust in calculating effort based on your exercise and what the environment was when you reached that level of effort. Strava and MapMyRun do not get the full heart rate picture to see real improvement over time. The Fitbit app only gives overviews of your exercise and is minimal help in training. I‚Äôve had a Fitbit tracker for 6 months now. I‚Äôd buy another if it shared the data with the other exercise apps, but it looks like I‚Äôll be getting a basic heart rate monitor to get the full use of other apps as well.

Cellular must be on? Since the latest update or one before that(?),  I notice that you MUST allow FITBIT app access to Cellular( turn on Cellular in iPhone settings) when all you need is Wi-Fi. This is ALSO true when I‚Äôm using my cellular service(not wi-fi) with Fitbit.  I don‚Äôt need Fitbit to connect to the Internet! I‚Äôm just using the basic Fitbit interface without a watch when I want to view and use. This seems like a privacy thing. It also wastes my battery. Overall, I do like Fitbit. It‚Äôs very accurate compared to my GPS watch.

Your new update ruined my fit bit HR. Because of your update my perfectly good running fit bit is now worthless. I have tried everything from many of your technicians. Including the last instructions from your final email. I am very disheartened.  I will be using my wife‚Äôs fit bit until she can purchase an Apple Watch.(that‚Äôs the only reason you see the new login credentials on my part)  We will never purchase this product again.

Fitbit is the worst investment I totally hated the fact that I had gotten a Fitbit . I really wanted a galaxy watch at that time. The only thing that made Fitbit not an absolute waste of money was the app. Well now I can‚Äôt even login into my account. I can‚Äôt even be sent a reset password email. The Fitbit team told me that I should just create a new account with a different email address. That‚Äôs like Snapchat or instagram telling you that you have to create a new account because their system locked you out. Save your money and buy a galaxy or Apple Watch.  Fitbit is a joke and a complete waste of money.

author_name: Ice cream is the best dessert
review_body: Fitbit is a great thing to use The Fitbit app is really good. I like how you have the Fitbit tracker on your wrist when it tracks your exercise and footsteps. I also like how you can change your goals for footsteps, calories burned, miles walked, and active minutes. It is nice to meet your goals on any of the fitness categories I mentioned above because you feel good after you meet your goals. I like how the Fitbit can track how many hours you sleep every night.

Disappointed I used to be absolutely in love with my Fitbit app. I would check it regularly all the features. Now, I‚Äôm stuck with barely being able to sync my Fitbit to the app. The app freezes and i have to completely go out of the app and wait for it to reset to re-open it. Trying to join challenges or groups is a struggle as the app continues to freeze up. I‚Äôve tried to delete the app and re-download it, as well, as removing my tracker and re-adding it. I‚Äôm hoping you guys fix these problems as I love my Fitbit and want to continue using it. Thank you.

Good but needs improvement This is such a good app but it does have some miner bugs and things that need improvement. One thing is that no sound when you lose it or your kid does also you should make it make a noise to show that it‚Äôs there also I tried setting an alarm it‚Äôs buzzes are not noticeable and I am a light sleeper and you should also try to make it to where for people who have azma it will stop buzzing you to move. Please fix these miner issues but other then these it‚Äôs pretty good

Feb 2020 update buggy for me Up until this last update it was great. Then it wouldn‚Äôt let me view details of my sleep or exercise and pulse on my home ‚ÄúToday‚Äù screen. So I rebooted my iPhone, then my Ionic, then my iPhone and Ionic simultaneously and it still didn‚Äôt work. So I uninstalled the app reinstalled and logged in. That fixed my ‚ÄúToday‚Äù screen details but now it is recording my workouts as being 6 hours after I do them.  My 3:13 PM walk today is recorded as 9:13 pm and it is only 4:30 in the afternoon. What gives? My sleep records accurately so it can‚Äôt be that my settings are not synced from my iPhone and Ionic. I hope they fix this

Apps ok, but I don‚Äôt know how accurate First it takes me force closing the app at least 3 times to get my Fitbit to sync. Then there‚Äôs the bingo, which is hard enough as it is, but my total steps/minutes/miles haven‚Äôt increased since the last update. My total steps have been tallied for the trails, and for the daily cumulative numbers, but not the bingo.

Good tracker messages no longer work I have always enjoyed having a Fitbit. Until recently they have worked great. Since I purchased my Charge 3 I have noticed more and more issues with it.  The biggest being I can no longer receive my text messages on my Fitbit. This is disappointing because it was a great feature.  Looking into the Versa it seems to have the same problem.  I enjoy all the other features with the Fitbit I just have to be careful how much I move around while sitting or it tracks it as steps.  Hopefully the text messaging issues get fixed soon. Otherwise great fitness tracker.

Please update! I had a Fitbit Charge 2, and I loved it! I just purchased a Fitbit Versa Lite, and so far I‚Äôm loving it even more. One of my favorite features was the text notifications. However, since I upgraded my phone to an iPhone 11/IOS 13, my text notifications stopped working. They stopped working on the Charge 2, and the feature doesn‚Äôt work on the Versa Lite either. When will the app be updated to fix the notifications feature?

Great way to track healthy living The fit bit along with app are a great tool to keep track of healthy living. From daily activity to eating and sleep. My only issue is as most apps or diets they do not include tracking the amount of sugar one eats. Eating healthy is not only determined by the amount of calories, carbs, protein, and fat you eat but also sugar. Too many Americans eat too much sugar that our bodies can not breakdown which can lead to several health problems. If you can not keep track of how many grams of sugar you consume daily. Then counting calories is a waste of time.

Mrs. Barbara Leggett I absolutely enjoy being able to use the Fitbit app. I like being able to monitor my weight, sleep, heart rate and activity on the a spot. It motivates me daily to improve my health.
Great, sleek app! I got the watch as a Christmas gift (2018) and wear it pretty much all the time, until it needs to be charged.

A Bit Fitter I‚Äôm happy with the Fitbit app & wrist device. It‚Äôs easy to use, connected to my iPhone & stores my daily fitness info. I have easy access to the info to make the necessary improvements to my daily routine. The reminders are suttle rather than annoying & keep me on track. The cute rewards are encouraging. The app definitely ensures full use benefits from my Fitbit device.

Annoyed I‚Äôm so frustrated with this app!!! I have soccer games and you can‚Äôt wear your fit bit during them so I have to take it off but I make sure to know the time so I can add my 90 min of running after the game. But when I go to add it, the app only gives me like a thousand steps?!? I get over 4 thousand when I run/walk for 45 min. I just hate the app because of this. I want to be able to get the right amount of steps everyday. I really should be getting almost 20k but it barely gives me any when I add it. Please!!! Fix!!! It!!! I love this app but it is really annoying

New update is terrible. I hate the dashboard I have read all the reviews on feedback about the new layout and I must agree. Without wasting 20 minutes of my day going into detailed review that the developer will respond with a ‚Äúsorry, not sorry‚Äù about the changes response.... in short I have stopped using the app.

Don‚Äôt do the update! Before the update everything could be accessed/added to or updated from the main screen. Now you have to scroll through all competitions- if it allows you to join, I‚Äôve had several instances where it won‚Äôt and it won‚Äôt let you preview- then find what you want to update- water/food/exercise- then access. Very inconvenient. Liked it much better when you just hit an icon. Notifications don‚Äôt come through as easily. Wish I had not updates üò°üòïüòüüò°

Crashes all the time I have not been able to even open the FitBit app for months! When I tap the app icon, it crashes and shuts down before it will ever even open the dashboard to update my information. I have my options turned to synching all day but when I open the site on a desktop, there is no information since this began. I have tried to be patient assuming the bugs would be fixed but it doesn‚Äôt seem to be happening. I have uninstalled and then reinstalled the app hoping that would help. Nothing! I am so upset that I can‚Äôt even use my Fitbit the way I shapeless be able to, unless I want to manually enter everything. Please fix this!!

New layout Great job developers! It‚Äôs really easy to navigate through. One question though ü§∑‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èwhy I‚Äôm not able to post to friends as an option? Already, did a re-sync too. Also, I called support about the syncing of the 250/hr setup. He had me try several things. I have mine set for 11am-11pm. It still misses on my app and not the watch. I‚Äôve called 3 times about this and am being told it‚Äôs an app issue that the developer is aware of. So, I don‚Äôt know.

Heart rate tracker stopped recording during walks. Love my Tracker HR3. It has helped me lose 40 pounds and keep it off for 4 years now, but this week, something changed: my Fitbit stopped giving me a recording  of my heart rate during my tracked walks. It records my heart rate all day long and displays the graph in the heart rate tile, but no longer in the summary of my walk. Not sure if it is the Fitbit or a software issue. Would like to get it back but don‚Äôt know how. Otherwise, great device and app.
Love my fitbit! ETA: I've updated my app and it no longer works. At all. It wants me to log in and when I try nothing works and I have to reboot the phone. The app is dead.

Bluetooth will not stay connected Thanks to this latest update that was pushed out a few days ago I can no longer sync my new Charge 2 HR with the app. Bluetooth will NOT stay connected anymore. Fitbit seems to think I need to be troubleshooting and digging around for a fix by sending me all these links and telling me to ‚Äútry this and see if it works‚Äù then get back to us. Excuse me? NO! I have better things to do with my time than to sit around on my laptop trying to find out where your CRAPTACULAR update broke. I‚Äôve had Fitbits for almost 2 years and never had an issue, magically, the second the update is done, nothing works anymore. What a coincidence!!! Get your life together Fitbit.

Sleep tracker problem I love my Fitbit and the app, but for the past couple of days it hasn‚Äôt calculated my sleep.  It shows where it tracked my sleep, showing the whole graph of my time in each cycle and the hours I fell asleep and woke up, and it seems to be calculating my average hours okay, but when it comes to actually saying how long I slept and how long I was in each phase it just says 0, and from the home screen it‚Äôs stuck saying ‚Äúhow did you sleep‚Äù while showing the little graph.  Please fix this bug!
Horrible Software Updates Wanted this just to challenge friends and family. Received Christmas 2017, Fitbit ionic.

June 11th update causing GPS problems I just received the versa as an anniversary present and had been impressed with how close the GPS tracking I‚Äôve been with the Nike app. I had the blaze previously and my running time and distance were consistently much slower and shorter than the Nike app. Since the update three days ago I have going on two runs and the versa is much worse now than the blaze was and now it is not showing my route anymore. According to the Nike app I ran 5.49 mi. today at an 8‚Äô19‚Äù pace- Fitbit says I did only 5.29 at a whopping 8‚Äô47‚Äù pace, that is a BIG difference. Please address.

Fitbit Review I love my charge 2. I wear it everyday and it has lasted well over a year. It has tons of food I can look up to track my eating and has excellent nutritional facts. I track my weight daily and like that I can look back and see how my weight has changed over time. Love tracking my exercise. There are features I don‚Äôt use but I appreciate they are there! My only wish would be that it would notify me if my pace while i am running.

Great app in terms of fitness. This is really a great app in terms of fitness and challenges. I've always had a blast challenging my family and friends who also own Fitbits. The only reason I give it a 3 stars is because I recently upgraded to a Pebble smart watch. I was hoping my smart watch steps would somehow sync into my Apple Health app then transfer those step counts over to my Fitbit account. Now I feel as though I have abandoned my family and friends.

FitBit Charge2 I love my Fitbit watch - I got it for Christmas in2016. I had a stent put in my artery in October of that year. It has enabled me to monitor my heart and vitals to see what is going on with my body. I love it. I have had to replace the band twice - so you have to be careful with it not to pull on the band with clothing going on and off. Would recommend this app to everyone. It does much more than vitals - you get phone call notifications text messages time steps - lots of things - love it!!

On Fire I really enjoy my Fitbit, or as I call it, my constant reminder that I am fat. The only drawback is that it repeatedly comes on during the night with the slightest movement; however, when I am riding my bike and attempting to see har far I have ridden, I can shake my arm like I am on fire and it does not turn on. I have to press the button in order for it to show me the screen. Understanding this is for the app and not the watch; nonetheless, no one ever asks me if I like the watch, unlike asking me to rate this app, on what seems like a daily basis.

Interval Timer Bug Overall, this is a good app with comprehensive fitness tracking data. However, there is a very annoying bug that makes the interval timer on the charge 3 completely unusable. The time settings revert back to their defaults every time I try to change them, usually before I even attempt to sync my Fitbit with the app. I love doing interval workouts and having haptic feedback to know when to switch exercises would be great, but I can‚Äôt adjust the time settings to suit my workout. Please address this issue in the next update.

Fitbit helps you make healthy choices My Fitbit helps me make healthy choices by showing me how many steps I have taken and how long I have slept. Sometimes I think I have been more active or slept longer than I really have.  When I see my actual activity, I can adjust to be more active or go to bed earlier as needed.

complaining Everything fine except that my heart rate is not accurate at all. I have complain several times , talked to two different tech from your company unsuccessfully. The garanty is over. In the past they sent me a new watch if there was a problem it could not be solved . I feel less happy to buy another Fitbit.

Lost Data will not sync I was very excited about acquiring my Fitbit and found it to be exciting, challenging and quite rewarding initially.  Unfortunately there was an update, to the software and now It doesn‚Äôt recognize my password nor email account.  I googled and followed ALL advice noted in the FIBIT forums.  To my dismay nothing has changed for the better. It was suggested that I uninstall and reinstall the app.  I lost all my data and it may not be recoverable.  I am no longer a happy customer considering the greatest features are meaningless.  I can now download a free app to my iPhone and receive the same data for free.  My Fitbit device is a CHARGE 3.

Usability Is Terrible With the latest update, key usability features are gone. The main screen now requires a lot of scrolling to see data, the calories no longer displays calories remaining (which was a supremely helpful tool), there‚Äôs no quick add button, and when you do hit an activity goal, it doesn‚Äôt turn a satisfying green anymore. It‚Äôs just unappealing all around, and getting used to the new look won‚Äôt make up for key features not being available anymore.

New sleep score feature I don‚Äôt mind the new sleep score feature and will probably learn to really love it as I use it. However I do not like that I can‚Äôt change the settings to display it differently. I like to see my average hours slept for the week, and I like to see how many hours I slept each night. I DO NOT like that the average has been automatically set to sleep score and the stages and hours slept display has been reduced. At the very least there should be an option to change what average displays and also the option to rearrange the main sleep page. Having to scroll through screens to find my stats that I want to see is annoying.

Fitbit itself is great! Sometimes app glitches I‚Äôm updating my review to encompass my overall experience üôÇ I love being able to track my sleep and steps and activity effortlessly. I have come across a few glitches during 2 particular app updates where it stopped syncing, but after either a new update or simply waiting, it seems to get fixed. I haven‚Äôt experienced the newest dashboard issues as of yet, but I‚Äôm sure I will find out what the outcry is about soon enough. Currently enjoying the slightly older dashboard, hope it sticks around!

Continues to make USELESS changes! Fitbit continues to make changes to the app that are not useful, come at the expense of more useful features, and does not listen to feedback from any of their users. Changing the layout of the dashboard, adding sleep score and getting rid of average sleep on the sleep display despite the fact that the sleep score is absolutely useless (I don‚Äôt care if my sleep score is an 86 if I only got 4 hours of sleep!). As many other people have said on Fitbit forums, I will likely be purchasing a different fitness tracker like a Garmin watch as Fitbit continues to make changes with zero respect for their customers and no way to toggle these useless features on and off.
New update to app is terrible I‚Äôve had my Fitbit for somewhere between 3-4 years. I use the Fitbit app every day to track my sleep, calories, and water.

Just trying to report an issue I enjoy the Fitbit app and my Charge 2. There‚Äôs an issue with the app. I originally had the app set to notify me when I ran a mile. I‚Äôd like to change it to .5 miles, but when I try, the app crashes and the change doesn‚Äôt save. Also, in the updated app, food and water entries are sometimes delayed with the water entries not always accurate. Sometimes a water entry is doubled. I had to delete all the entries and re-enter the correct amount for an accurate count.

Safety I love this app because I can track my healthy and sleep and all but there are some problems. Messaging should be like actual texting so you know what‚Äôs been said and what you‚Äôve said. And groups, they should be limited in aging. I don‚Äôt know how I was found but someone started talking to me and the platform became very uncomfortable and I felt very unsafe. So if messages could be seen and ages are categorized then this platform could become a safe environment for teenagers and adults who may use this app just for health then find a creep is talking to them. Please look into it

Fitbit is great (HR monitor needs work) I am really enjoying the Fitbit but the HR monitor is not accurate at all. I would do a 45 minute cardio workout (reaching max effort) and my Fitbit wouldn‚Äôt even register my heart rate during the high point intervals. Every time I look down to get an update on my heart rate it wouldn‚Äôt register. I have been told Fitbit needs to be tight while working out and running but it doesn‚Äôt help. I just hope they can upgrade the Fitbit to be able to read your heart rate during an entire exercise accurately.
Fitbit app UX & Design Pros

Students Schedule I love this app, however the main thing I‚Äôm a little annoyed about is that the 250 steps an hour has to be continuous. A student that has to be at school from around 9 to 4 can‚Äôt get up in the middle of class to get their steps. If there was a way to still choose the hours, but choose them so they didn‚Äôt have to be continuous it would be a lot better. Other than that I really really like the Fitbit. It helps me stay active and gives me messages to keep doing so.

Worst App Ever. By far this is the worst app you will see in 2018 to transfer music to ionic. Looks like we are back in 80s, such a PIA, and hassle to just copy songs.. why can‚Äôt be it as simple to copy song directly to watch from PC to watch or phone to app. All you need a reference and location when copying from phone to watch using app. Even a 5$ made in china MP3 player does better job than you guys.. highly not recommended. Worst mistake to buy fit bit in first place. Apple watches are far superior or matter of fact cheap products from 3rd world country is 100 times better when it comes to ease of use.. your IT department need some serious introspection. Very unhappy customer.

Great-reliable and easy to navigate! Have been part of the Fitbit FAM for a while. Works great with my Ionic. Had the competition as part of an iPhone user, but like the Fitbit battery life and cost/functionality ratio better, since I swim and am very active in fitness! Can get up and move so much easier faster, since I don‚Äôt have to hook, unhook it from the charger everyday! The app records my steps perfectly and I am glad to have it on my phone ...works wonderfully!

Fitbit App is being used as a dating site I didn‚Äôt load Fitbit to date. I loaded it to help me keep track for my activities for medical purposes. I think it is horrible that men think just because you join something your looking to date and the best part is when you tell them you have a great man already and don‚Äôt want to change that they tell you, ‚Äúwell I am in a relationship as well with a great woman‚Äù. Well why the heck are you trying to get with other people on Fitbit. Find a dang dating site and get off the site people come to for medical reasons.

Fitbit One & the APP I have had the same One for more than 5 years.  It has been washed a couple of times too, since it gets clipped on clothing.  Using it makes me want to get my 10,000 steps in, so it helps me to stay more focused.  The app helps me to see everything from steps, nutrition, sleep, and helps to motivate me more by sending me prompts that I am close, or even to start winding down for bed.  Being able to sync the Fitbit app to My Fitness PAL is awesome too!!

Does not sync at all. I‚Äôve had my Fitbit for a few months, it always worked perfectly fine. In the past month it‚Äôs not been syncing properly. I can run for hours and it says I only ran for 20 minutes. The steps don‚Äôt sync, the active minutes don‚Äôt sync. I thought it was just my Fitbit, so I went out and bought a new one but the new one does the same thing. Then I realized that it‚Äôs the app that has a problem. I wake up early to exercise daily, and I‚Äôve always loved having my Fitbit track everything. Now this just makes it so stressful since nothing is syncing properly. Please fix this.

Great!-one small bug I love this app it makes it super easy to see your progress and see others' updates. It's just that when I first set up, I accidentally clicked fitbit Alta HR instead of Inspire. I existed out, and set up my inspire. Now, where ever I open the app, I am greeted with a pop up that says, ‚Äúare you ready to finish setting up your Fitbit Alta HR?‚Äù With options 1) yes 2) remind me later and 3) never. I select never every time, but it still gives me the pop up every time. Super annoying, but just a small glitch.

Sync notification on app close - Why?!?! Ever since the last update, whenever I close the app, a useless and annoying banner notification comes on my screen reminding me to sync my data in the app. So frustrating because I just closed the app. It syncs the data when it‚Äôs open so why remind me after I close the app. What‚Äôs worse, is that there appears to be no way to turn this notification off. It‚Äôs driving me crazy. Please fix this. It‚Äôs an annoying and useless feature on an otherwise great app that I use multiple times every day.

Blaze Won‚Äôt sync after Apple updates Used to be very good, last month wouldn‚Äôt sync, saw latest version at App Store, was then able to sync. Lost sync yesterday, said battery was charged, died during night, will not sync, sync line goes to t in Fitbit, drops out.
Randomly logs me out Overall, it‚Äôs a fairly solid app. I use it mainly to track sleep and resting heart rate with my Charge 2.

Easy to use I like the app! It's easy to learn and understand. I just wish that my messaging/calendar notifications worked. It worked for the first hour of setting everything up, but hasn't done it since. I've had my Charger 2 for a week now. The notifications on both the phone and the app are set to the "on" position. I've tried other things and nothing seemed to have worked. Hopefully they will figure that out soon. Other than that, no other issues (knock on wood).

Love My Fitbit Charge 2 But Issue With Dashboard All of a sudden, my dashboard is reflecting my current night‚Äôs peep for everyday on the dashboard. I have called numerous times, but no one can give me a reason as to why the sleep does not show for what it was daily. There is not reason that last night‚Äôs sleep is showing on every Dashboard day on my record. I can look at any given day for my steps, Miles, etc., but the sleep is my last night‚Äôs sleep record. This needs to be fixed so that when you look at any day on your dashboard that it completely shows your actual day‚Äôs results. No one at Fitbit could explain the reasoning for why this is happening. Otherwise, love my Charge 2.

Fitbit Charge HR locked up when doing the update. My Fitbit was working perfectly fine.  I logged into the app and it says an update was available so I started the update.  It says it should take 5-10minutes, OK fine.  An hour later, there is a update bar on the Fitbit that is stuck at the halfway point and it will not display anything else.  The app says it cannot connect.  So now my Fitbit is a brick.  Thanks a lot.

Help I love my Fitbit and use it 24/7.   Problem is this. I updated the app a few days ago. Since then, when I log in my food, the app excepts one item and kicks the rest out. I am not getting an accurate account t for food diary.   Did I do something wrong or is it an issue with the update ?    I will continue to use this app because it is very good but I will log my food another app that is linked to my Fitbit till I get this issue fixed.              Problem is now solved with another update.

This app is great and so are the developers I have used several popular fitness watches (Garmin, Apple Watch, Fitbit) and Fitbit honestly just can‚Äôt be beat. Not only are their products superior to all of the others, the app is just awesome. I love having the running count of calories available, as well as calories burned throughout the day. They have added a few new features and responded very quickly when they had issues. Team Fitbit forever!
Worse update! 1-star for the upgrade and 5 star for product overall.   The 1 star is for the upgrade that no longer works for my Blaze.  What a way to force someone to purchase a newer Fitbit .

Months without a fix!! I can get notifications for calendar reminders and calls but I cannot get text notifications. When Apple came out with an update Fitbit said there are notification issues with the new update and working to resolve. It‚Äôs probably 3 months since then and other Fitbit updates have happened. Nothing is fixed. It‚Äôs so annoying that I‚Äôm considering an Apple Watch so I can get notifications for text messages. I don‚Äôt keep my phones sound on because of personal/medical reasons. I‚Äôd rather get a notification on my Fitbit than having to check my phone all the time.
Apple Watch - JUST DO IT. I just bought an Apple Watch and will NEVER look back. Goodbye forever fitbit. I gave you at least 100 chances to make easy fixes.

Notifications I love my charger 2 but unfortunately with the update software for my iPhone my text notifications no longer work I‚Äôve tried all troubleshooting ideas and nothing has worked. I‚Äôve been trying all troubleshooting ideas for over a month now and nothing has improved. Still waiting for the final fix for this feature. Otherwise it definitely gives me my exercise stats like a pro which why it was given to me as a gift I still use it but wish the notification text still worked
Used to love it! I got the new charge 3 for my birthday in July. I loved it and it worked great it gave me my messages and lots of notifications.

Mostly good The app overall works pretty well. The dashboard gives me a great, customizable way to see and track what I feel is relevant to me. My only complaint is the period tracker isn‚Äôt accurate. ‚ÄúSleep score‚Äù messes up core functionality of the device I was a devoted Fitbit user for several years, mostly for the seamless, reliable sleep-tracking feature. Great tool I just received a Charge 2 as a gift and I‚Äôve enjoyed having it these past few days. I think having the ability to know where your activity level stands (as well as water consumption, food, etc.) has given me a bit of a boost to go just a bit more. Having the insight has been great.

It worked great until.. I loveeeee this app and it was and still is great. Text messages no longer visible I‚Äôve had my Ionic for nearly a year (and have been a Fitbit owner for practically as long as they were invented). Fitbit Versa/Fitbit Iconic I‚Äôm pretty sure that it tracks my steps quite accurately because I REALLY have to work sometimes for the 10,000 daily steps. However a great majority of the time the watch doesn‚Äôt declare my 10,000 steps until after it reaches past 10,000... sometimes up to 10,003 or 10,020. I wish that stairs climbed was part of the daily exercise in the dashboard and or that it was its own button in the dashboard! =o)

Fitbit for life I‚Äôve been a Fitbit lover for years. I recently went from the Apple Watch series 2 to the Versa, and this app works wonderfully for my Versa. Really the only ‚Äúcomplaint‚Äù I have with the watch is that you‚Äôre not able to send back quick texts if you have an iPhone! Please make that happen soon! :)

Charge 3 New to having a Fitbit, and I usually never rate an app - but, I can‚Äôt believe I didn‚Äôt get one sooner. As a sport‚Äôs official - love the countdown feature - will be keeping the time at games.  Overall, really like my Fitbit.

Love the App, but.. I LOVE this app. I have had a fitbit for a year now and it‚Äôs amazing! I have a fitbit charge 2, and realized something. For the notifications section, there‚Äôs only calls and text messages. Can you maybe add more notifications such as social media and other texting apps? It would make the app better especially for someone very paranoid, like me lol. Love the app in general, keep up the good work, but if you would added more notification options it‚Äôd be even more better. Thanks!

Most Useful Platform in my life Fitbit itself is great. I have two watches, a Charge, and a scale.  They‚Äôve changed my life. Helped me lose and keep off weight, become and stay more active. Transformative. The Ap itself is pretty good. The calorie counting element needs serious improvement. The library of foods has significant errors: if the maker says 100 calories on the label, Fitbit‚Äôs data says 90. I rely on an integration with MyFitnessPal, but that integration breaks a lot and I would vastly prefer the Fitbit improve their food library.

Seems to be very accurate I have been using the One for just a few days, but it has given me very accurate information on tracking my daily activities. It keeps the data separate, so I know how I am doing every day.  It was relatively inexpensive and the apps were very simple to understand.  I would recommend this to anyone interested in keeping track of their daily activities at a low cost.

Like app features I like the app features and the way information is presented. Would like better accuracy on heart beats though. Can be 13 beats higher than treadmill monitor. The sleep monitor program though gives impossible data on your sleep in and out of phases of sleep it cannot detect. But is programmed to show you it. I liked the old style better as it shows what it is capable of... just detecting when you move.

Not syncing to phone I received a replacement and it will not sync to my phone and it keeps saying update your tracker. I clicked on to update it and it says it will only take 5-10 mins to complete. I left it on to update all night long and it was stuck and wouldn‚Äôt go any further. I keep trying to update it and will not update. So I‚Äôm guessing that‚Äôs why it will not sync to my phone. I‚Äôm not happy and now I‚Äôm considering just buying a Apple Watch since this will not sync or update.  I‚Äôm only giving this a 2 stars bc of the customer service I received when my first Fitbit stopped working on the update.

Very inaccurate This charge 3 is a waste of money.  Very inaccurate on the exercises.  The only thing it is good for is a timer, the date and time.  Have called several times and no one has answers after running me through several different restarts to try and other things.  purchased a new one and still didn‚Äôt work.  When I swim a half mile it says I swam a mile and a half.    When I am on my iPad it counts  steps.  When I clear text messages. Do not recommend this Fitbit.

Like but not love I want to love this app just as much as I love my Fitbit but I can‚Äôt quite get there as sometimes my app doesn‚Äôt update with my watch, saying that I have had 0 active minutes all day when I worked out twice that day. PLEASE fix this bug as it is really frustrating after paying for a watch that is supposed to give you accurate information!

Logging Pregnancy? I‚Äôve used fitbit bands for four years, and I‚Äôve always liked the app, but since becoming pregnant there‚Äôs no feature to log this into my fitbit app. Pregnancy effects my heart rate, my weight, my cycle, and my sleeping habits; which the app isn‚Äôt considering when calculating my cardio health and other stats. Issues since latest update I‚Äôve never had too much of an issue with the app. Though there has been times I‚Äôve needed to reconnect with Bluetooth and often WiFi as well. Works fine Lately, everyday actually there are too many ads to buy a new watch and too many tips. Have to constantly exit out. It was never like this before. No one needs this many ads and tips before they can check how many hours they slept. I bet that even if someone bought a new watch from it showing on an ad in their Fitbit app they‚Äôll still continue to get new ads to buy a new watch. Smh, That‚Äôs ridiculous. Terrible I added my Fitbit (charge 2) to the app. Worked totally fine till I got my child a fit bit ace. So I created a family account. It is terrible to navigate. The app is updated. I can‚Äôt navigate from one persons account to the other. There isn‚Äôt an option to switch views. It‚Äôs now on my child‚Äôs account but says it‚Äôs connected to a charge 2 which is my fit bit. I deleted the app and will delete all devices and reload them back on. I shouldn‚Äôt even have to do this in the first place. Now before you say I‚Äôm not doing it right then the people at fit bit are telling me wrong. There is no option that says switch to kid view or parent view.

Not thrilled about the new layout - can‚Äôt read HR while training The new main screen layout change makes it  hard for read the heart rate while I‚Äôm working out. I don‚Äôt wear my reading glasses when I run and now I can‚Äôt read the HR number!! The most important information is minimized - for example the sleep score is giant compared to other information. New update is frustrating It‚Äôs harder now to get into the Fitbit settings to switch the HR on and off. Before I could tap on the icon in the upper left corner. Updated app and now won‚Äôt open Updated the app tonight and now unable to open it. I‚Äôve been using the app for a couple of years and love my Fitbit but not happy I‚Äôm unable to access information now. I‚Äôve rebooted my phone and still can‚Äôt open. Fit bit review The fit bit is great to keep a person in touch with their excise by monitoring the daily steps taken plus stairs climbed (floors)and keeps track of your heart beats so you know when to slow down or speed up. Pandora Problems I have spent hours upon hours trying to get my pandora to sync and download the stations. Sleep,step and workout inaccuracies!! What is going on with the sleep tracking? I‚Äôm missing hours of sleep!! It says I slept one hour or 4 hours, which is completely inaccurate!! Great for seeing progress and The Easiest way to: Lock in on my daily food/water reality. The Easiest food and liquid logging app! Charge 3 I just bought the charge 3 and it‚Äôs been nothing but an issue. I can use two other devices (phone app and MapMyWalk app) and both read the same. Like today I walked 6 miles. Love! Can‚Äôt live without it! Knowing how much deep sleep I had that day or week and comparing it to my energy level and mood is pretty interesting. Fitbit for my birthday My daughters bought me a Fitbit 2 for my birthday New Year‚Äôs Eve and I‚Äôve used it daily since then an feel better and more energetic. New ‚Äúsleep score‚Äù is ridiculous I use FitBit to help me get data. In addition to a new interface that makes the app harder to use, the new sleep score takes information away. Heart rate stopped working on tracked workout I am a huge Fitbit fan.  My daughter and I both have Fitbit - I have charge 2 and she has the Versa. Always says Bluetooth is off when it‚Äôs definitely on Whenever I open the app, it always tells me that my Bluetooth is off and I‚Äôm not connected to my Fitbit Alta HR, when I definitely am. Logs me out Love this app and everything about it... except it constantly logs me out. I have to log back in at least two or three times a week. Twice today already. Steps in Challenges Don‚Äôt Match Dashboard It‚Äôs very frustrating that my challenges don‚Äôt reflect my actual steps. Real quick question Stick with me here because it gets complicated, but how do I sync the wristband to the app? Great, reliable, customizable This app works so well with my Alta HR, it offers a more detailed description of all of the activities that the Fitbit band tracks throughout your day and even throughout your sleep. Macro counter needs grams! Worst food tracking app I use the Fitbit Charge 2, I stopped using it for a while, but wanted to start tracking my sleep again. Keep Active Share with friends to keep motivated. Great info on your activities, time active or moderately active, calories and many reward badges to keep you going. Even tracks sleep and weight if you want.

Please fix app for iOS 11.0.2 Since updating from iOS 10 to iOS 11 it now takes about 10 - 15 minutes to sync the app to my Fitbit device. Fitbit, please put out an update to your app that resolves this.

Update issues So I‚Äôm on my second Fitbit (the replacement) and this update just popped it. This update ruined my Fitbit. It keeps saying it‚Äôs an error and it only downloaded halfway. Need workouts for injured and older generation I have a fractured foot and I‚Äôm older than most people pictured in workouts.  I cannot do most workouts where feet are concerned until I improve and get out of boot.

Awesome! Just got a Fitbit Alta HR for Christmas and it‚Äôs great! Very intuitive and has great features. However, i wish there is an option to input detailed weightlifting information. Two thumbs up Just bought my first Fitbit this weekend. After a lot of research and reading my reviews, I choose the Charge 2. So far, it has been perfect. The Fitbit app works with no flaws. Worthless app since updates The app used to work great. Then they changed the layout, and it started to be less great. Then they changed the entire app and it has become absolutely worthless. Text Messages...when? I see that the text messages are still not fixed. We haven‚Äôt seen a firmware update in a long while. Does this have to do with Google‚Äôs purchase? No text notifications on charge 2 I absolutely love my fit bit charge 2 and the app is super easy to use. Fitbit is life lol I live my Fitbit! I've had a few different types over a 3-4 year period. My New Fitbit I love it, I love it, üòç. I got Fitbit 3 for my birthday and it is the greatest gift in the world! I have stepped up my exercise tremendously. Issues with accurate steps in Challenges I just upgraded from a Charge HR to the Charge 3 and while I love the way it looks and that it‚Äôs more comfortable then my old Fitbit, I do not love that my steps on my dashboard do not match my steps in challenges. Room for improvement I love fitbit, dont get me wrong. But after downloading the most recent update (that I didnt even need) I cant open the app anymore. As soon as I try to open the app it crashes! Absolutely LOVE my fitbit I have had my Fitbit flex since February 21, 2014! I bought one for my two daughters, my two sisters  and two friends. New update needs updating Old version of the app was very good. I understand the desire of making the new app with a fresh design but it shouldn‚Äôt lose capabilities of the old. Disappointed üò¢ I have been using Fitbit since my son gave me a Charge 2 a few years ago.  I on my 4th Fitbit, and second Charge 3. App is buggy? I like using my Fitbit in all, but the problem I have is the app itself I believe has issues. I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs buggy or what, but it seems that every morning when I wake up, it would only sync halfway and then freeze up. Cheesy sloppy app I don‚Äôt see Fitbit as a leading competitor in another few years considering the many issues reported repeatedly and the continued complaints. Shocked at how this app has been poorly designed. Was time consuming to set up, should have been much easier. Instructions are awful. New app update/platform is terrible! I‚Äôve been using the app since 2016. Loved it and was on it daily. They‚Äôve recently updated the app and have completely changed its platform. It‚Äôs horrible! Ionic......don‚Äôt waste your money I was given this as a gift for Christmas in 2017. I take exceptionally good care of this watch and yesterday the screen went black. App malfunction For a while I was enjoying the use of the Fitbit app. I‚Äôll be honest it‚Äôs a great way to track and set goals

Needs a little work but good. The reason why I gave this 4 stars is  because the steps aren‚Äôt always accurate. I had my ALTA HR for 2 years now. Wonderful I‚Äôve used fitbit for a few years now. I‚Äôve loved it and it‚Äôs always been great for me. But today I‚Äôve noticed a glitch in the app itself. it‚Äôs all a rip-off I bought the charge two expecting what it told me, and while it‚Äôs good at measuring sleep, it‚Äôs absolutely horrible at measuring heart rate. Absolutely loving it I fully recommend Fitbit.  It has given me a new excitement and accountability that I find incredibly fulfilling. Use to be a good app but.... Unannounced updates added unwanted advertisements that you must click through. Shame on you Fitbit! App needs work I love my Fitbit! I‚Äôve had it for about 4 years now and it really helps me to keep track of my health and makes it easier to reach my goals. However, the app needs some work. Easy, Healthy, I love my Fitbit I‚Äôm amending my review from 5 stars to 3. I paid $150 for it but constant Ads want me to pay MORE now for ‚ÄúPremium‚Äù. The App is awful, the Versa watch is wonderful The watch is fine, no doubt about it, but the app, is awful. Fitbit sleep If you‚Äôre buying the Fitbit to track sleep there are difficulties.

Hiding data behind paywall I was a loyal Fitbit user for the past few years, even recommending devices to family members. This new Fitbit premium is absolutely ridiculous. Hate the sleep score Fitbit has gone downhill. All changes, not so good Ok with the update to the app, in some ways I like it better. Great app for fitness feedback I have used Fitbit and it‚Äôs associated app ever since the Fitbit worn on the waistband was developed and the app was born! Still get 5, but... I have had my Blaze for quite a while and an HR Charge before that - and liked both. Mostly excellent Love it. Helps me stay more aware of my physiological state (HR and sleep) as well as my weekly activity stats. WORTH IT I really recommend this! I would assure you this would help reach your fitness goal. I love how this app has helped me maintain my health & has inspired me to set goals for myself. Best Bang for the Buck! On my third Fitbit product, the Blaze.
