Is this supposed to happen?.. üò¨ I have a Charge 3 Fitbit and I absolutely love using it! One thing I want to point out though. I had woken up earlier than I usually do, and I couldn't sleep right away again. When I woke up for good, my Charge 3 gave me my sleep result end time of when i was awake for some time early morning. Is this normal? I hope this review was written decent enough to understand, thank you for reading my review!

After update, app won't launch After app update, no longer would launch. Tried deleting and reinstalling.  Still no launch when tapping on app, just sits there. Really liked it when it worked but now useless.

Loving my Fitbit I‚Äôve been using the app for maybe a little over a month or two now and I am loving it. Super easy to use and I like how you I put what I want to see and set my own goals. Only thing that‚Äôs been bugging me is the friends tab that shows everyone‚Äôs steps does not fit properly in my screen anymore. However I am not sure if this is something that happened after the recent app update or my phone update since I did them at the same time.

Not good with iOS 11 ! Extremely, ridiculously slow to sync with iOS 11. I don‚Äôt think Apple change Bluetooth at all, FitBit needs to be updated to work with it. iOS 11 has rendered this app useless. The same thing happens to my husband iphone/Fitbit app.

Never Again I‚Äôve had this app for years and have had it on 3 phones and all was great. Recently after an update it asked for a password for the first time since I first loaded it. I couldn‚Äôt remember it so I asked to have it sent to me. I have now asked SIX times with no response. I have an easier time with my bank and credit card apps than I do with this one. Why do I even need a password for this? Is Fitbit concerned that someone will sneak in and look at my calorie count or steps for that day??? I‚Äôve read that calling doesn‚Äôt help either. Life is too short for this. Since my Fitbit is now useless I will be looking elsewhere to buy a new tracker.

Was good until ‚Äútracker update‚Äù Loved the the app- I‚Äôve used it for almost 2 years now. Then today ‚ÄúTracker Update‚Äù showed up on my home screen, so I clicked update on it....now my Fitbit no longer works- the update ‚Äúcould not be completed‚Äù...and my Fitbit screen just has a bar across it with an exclamation point in the middle, and will not connect to my phone or do anything. üò© I tried all their troubleshooting tips, even deleted and reinstall d the app- but now it can‚Äôt find the Bluetooth connection because it got stuck halfway through the update.

Need charging information in the box, not in the online instructions Yesterday I tried to set up my new FitBit.  As a went to the online instructions, I got a message that I could not proceed because my Fitbit did not have enough charge ...But the instructions on how to charge it were explained later in the online instructions that I COULD NOT ACCESS.  This is absurd! I finally figured it out on my own; but it‚Äôs crazy to have the charging instructions only accessible online.  Print them on paper an put them in the box, PLEASE,
80% of a great app Just downloaded this a few days ago and have been trying out my new Fitbit. Originally ditched Fitbit focus for Jawbone up but the hardware seems way better this time around.

Amazing app! But... I absolutely love this app and all the Fitbit that I have purchased. My only discrepancy is that it doesn‚Äôt show you in detail how much fat, protein, and carbohydrates like apps like MyPlate and MyFitnessPal. As someone who has to stick to a pretty strict regiment in terms of dietary means, it would be nice if the developers would show all the grams you‚Äôre intaking as well as the percentage circle.

Fitbit Charge 2 Love my Fitbit and the app is pretty awesome!  My only issue is it takes things forever to sync and in the beginning I had to delete my watch and reconnect to the app multiple times because the data wouldn‚Äôt come through at all. But I‚Äôve had my watch going on two years now and love it!  The app has so many neat features and ways to stay active and track your activity. I love monitoring my sleep as well and the sleep ‚Äòtips‚Äô the app gives!

Good but a glitches with calories I have been using the Fitbit charge for 2 days and everything has turned out good but there is one problem. One day I woke up and it said that I burned 523 calories even though I didn‚Äôt and plus I have just walked 1747 steps and when I go back to check my status, it says that I burned 511 calories more. Please fix this. Anyways, all the features are working fine and overall it‚Äôs ok. Just fix the calories burned section.

Still no built in sync to Apple Health Great app works really well. Just wish it would sync to Apple Health without the use of having to buy a 3rd party app. Would also be nice if you can arrange icons on the dashboard. I would also like to see an update so it would let you know how long it's been since you last charge your Fitbit as well. Soon as this feature is added will change my review to a 5 star. I must be one of the lucky ones I haven't had any syncing issues are app crashes since the new update.
Stop updating Ever since you updated this app, it freezes and is totally useless. If you can‚Äôt improve it, stop ruining it with updating

Worked better previously. It seems the newer version of the app does not work as well as it used to. It takes an act of God to update the mileage, even from the previous day. Eventually it will update.

Sp02 FINALLY Available on Charge 3 You lost A LOT of your client base due to this feature not being available 2 years ago. For further updates you promise, do make sure at the time you mention it, is on the watch.  Promise, you lost a lot of clients due to not making good on your word, especially those who have been diagnosed with Sleep Apnea, and purchased this particular watch for that one reason.

Not secure My fit bit app was starting to get friend request on it which I thought was weird cause I don‚Äôt use it for connecting with friends. So I look further and I realize that someone from Canada was accessing my fit bit profile and adding people to it and also wrote weird stuff under my profile like it was some kind of porn account. Pretty upset I don‚Äôt even know how long it was up there with my picture with weird sexual stuff under my name. It makes me not want to use the fit bit anymore weird people had added me and who knows what other kind of info they can get through the app. Super disappointed.

Great for time, texts and phone calls January 20, 2020: At this point, I‚Äôm using my Fitbit Charge 2 to tell time, to get a part of each text message to my iPhone, and sometimes see who‚Äôs calling me. I generally am taking it off at night as I find the flashes of light from it disturbing when I roll over. The display is cracking, which means it‚Äôs reaching the end of its life. My last one (a Fitbit Charge?) end up falling apart and failing.
My ALTA HR Fitbit stop giving me sleep stages unless I buy a expensive app?!

Frustrated!!! Received a new Versa 2 on Tuesday, I was able to sync it on Tuesday but now it can‚Äôt even find it, says no device found. Now after spending good money I can not use the Alexa function or any tracking function. The Fitbit app just updated to fix bugs, still having the same issue even after deleting the app and reloading it. Why does this continue to be a problem. It won‚Äôt connect to WiFi or Bluetooth. Basically at this point it is a glorified watch!!  This is disgusting and needs to be fixed. How many people need to complain, I see no good reviews at all. Get some better tech help that can fix this!!!

Recent problems logging specific exercises and inconsistent detailed sleep info Until the last few days I could log yoga, walking, spinning, tennis as well as weights and bike on my Charge 3 device. Now I see bike, weights, pilates, pilates, pilates, pilates as my exercise choices on the device. It‚Äôs annoying to have to go to my phone to rename the other exercises each time. Also, it would be nice to have pickleball as a choice.

Potential warning. I am STILL UNABLE to receive messages on my Fitbit and this has been going on for WEEKS. I just get some blanket response back from Fitbit to ‚Äúbe patient‚Äù and they give me some troubleshooting steps that obviously don‚Äôt work. I love my Fitbit but I loved it more before the iOS update. Step it up Fitbit, you‚Äôre a huge company that should have fixed this already. I would warn any new customers who are looking to buy a Fitbit to wait until they fix ALL the problems. And you would think that with all the negative reviews they would do something about it. Obviously people love their Fitbit and would like for it to work üôÑ.

Fitbit changes sleep time to sleep score! Not helpful Fitbit changed the software and took away the most important statistic for the HR. It is the sleep hours and average sleep time. The first graph shows the score instead of the time asleep. This seems to be the case throughout the new design, the useful information is no longer visible at a glance from the main screen, everything requires digging now.

Awful Update to What Was a Great App I don‚Äôt know who conned the Fitbit folks into thinking their users wanted a Sleep Score, but they were totally wrong. There are many devices that provide a sleep score. This score is arbitrary and means nothing. Everyone calculates it differently and there is no standard. And now Fitbit wants a monthly subscription to find out more about a sleep score that I didn‚Äôt want in the first place! Just report the facts, not a score you made up.  I‚Äôm interested in the average hours of sleep per week and now I get some stupid score average instead. Clearly the Fitbit company has gotten greedy and is trying to justify charging a monthly fee.

Mostly great but users should be able to customize their data better There needs to be more options to customize your data per users preference. The latest update wiped out your weekly sleep average times and replace them with an average sleep index score. The sleep score makes little sense as if I sleep 11 hours it says I almost have the same score if I sleep four hours .... yet as we all know four hours of sleep is not enough. Thank you for taking a step backwards with the latest update.

Constant Problems As much as I love my Fitbit and using the app, I have had nothing but problems the app communication with my Fitbit. It seems every time the app automatically updates the time changes on my Fitbit backwards three hours and then the two won‚Äôt sync for a day or two. I lose the ability to track sleep info and all the reason I own the Fitbit are hindered and it happens TOO often to not be a complete annoyance.

Absolutely hate the new layout!!! I‚Äôm disappointed in the new UI design on this app. My dashboard seems bland and hard to read. Makes me not want to use my App anymore. I don‚Äôt want to see challenges on my dashboard. My dashboard should be just for my data and should be easy to read with clear distinctions between sections. This new list view is just not as friendly as the square section view. I felt like I was able to see my all my stats at a glance,  but now I have to keep scrolling on this bland almost colorless list. Very disappointed with the design. Fitbit should hire a new UI designer. Maybe I‚Äôll start looking for an alternative to Fitbit.

Quit changing crap!!! Yet ANOTHER app changing for absolutely no reason and just making things worse. It was such a unique design for the dashboard before which is why I loved it, but with the new update it looks like every other stupid scrolling list. It‚Äôs so much harder to read and not near as fun and endearing. The point of Fitbit is ease of access to track your progress on a myriad of items, but now I won‚Äôt be checking much til the old dashboard is back. Never had any problems before this besides random trouble syncing to my Fitbit that would resolve by the next day.

New Home Screen is UGLY!!! I wish I could take my ‚Äúupgrade‚Äù back but I can‚Äôt!!! The Today screen as it is now called is ugly!!! It‚Äôs not that I don‚Äôt like change, if it‚Äôs better I‚Äôm all for it but...

Charge 3 - Cardio Fitness Graph The cardio fitness graph needs to be fixed. I went from being in the good to very good range with a score of 45-46 to the poor range of a score of 25 overnight. My resting heart rate is normal and healthy for my gender and age (average resting 64 bpm). It doesn‚Äôt make sense to go from the healthiest part of the scale to the unhealthiest part of the scale overnight. I contacted support but they weren‚Äôt able to resolve the issue. This is an error on Fitbit‚Äôs end not a user error.

New Version Still A Step Backwards They did another update and yet this new version is a step backwards!  They laid a new home screen on top of all the other screens.  They believe that small icons that don‚Äôt give you readable status indicators for your hour step tracker and elimination of the quick access to set silent alarms is offset by having a lot of nice white space.  Guess what, it‚Äôs not!  Add back the functionality from the previous version.  Make it so you can see your current status on the hourly step tracker and a quick action button to access silent alarms for those that travel and need to regularly change this.

Not sure about the new update I love using my Fitbit and being able to keep track of my steps, exercises, sleep, etc. The most recent update was to make options easier to navigate and find, but I was just a little disappointed that it didn‚Äôt have the same colors and/or relative formatting. I did like the fact that I could pick specific days for setting my silent alarm, but I would rather go back to the previous setting.

Works Great, but is Awful for Trans People I thought I loved the app, but after a few days I remembered calorie requirements differ for ‚Äúmales‚Äù and ‚Äúfemales‚Äù. As a trans male who hasn‚Äôt been able to get on hormones yet, using the ‚Äúmale‚Äù option gives me the wrong health tracking.

Very well done app Fitbit trackers are one of the best out there for monitoring health data and their app is equally well done. It‚Äôs brightly colored and user friendly. The graphics are complimented by informative explanations. The online community is active and helpful when encountering navigation issues or technical problems. I recommend the tracker because the app is so good! Data is easily shared with my doctor if necessary. Best app I‚Äôve ever used.

Great to monitor activity levels and vitals I have been using this app for multiple years. I am pleased with the level of information it provides and the summarized data. It is easy to use and intuitive for me. It has allowed me to make small impactful changes to my lifestyle that paid off in overall health and happiness. The dashboard feature is what I use most to monitor my daily progress.
Versa I want to start out by saying I'm a long time fitbit owner and have owned 4 different styles and purchased over 10 devices for myself and others as gifts.

Fit bit app Use it every day. Do not think it is accurate as my hubby and I do our stuff together. He will walk with me and we will do 10 miles he was have 24 floors. I will have 10. We are the same height and almost same weight. I also do not like that if I sit down and rest it monitors me as sleeping. The same thing for him. If he does his work at the computer it is logging him as sleeping. Weird. We do compete for steps and miles and exercise program.

Fitbit Metzger Family We received 2 of the Fitbit Charge for Christmas. Everything is great on the units except we had to reload the app twice to our iPhones because of an error message. We are impressed with FitBit but can't award 5 stars because of buggy app. App has improved considerably over time. Do wish I could track activity on more than one Fitbit without setting up an entirely separate account

Fitbit Charge 2 I exercise on a treadmill daily. I'm really disappointed the heart rate does not register as I'm using it.  For the amount of money I paid for this I really expected more. That was one of the reasons for my purchase. Also, I wish it would link up with MyNetDiary as I use this all the time too. It sure would simplify keeping track of calories. The app is not very user friendly and hard to follow.
Lots of Info The FitBit has a lot of information and feedback to help with steps.
Great app. Been using this for years - it‚Äôs very good. Prefer to rate it 4.5.

Difficult to Read Unfortunately, this new update (2.94) is a downgrade in terms of functionality and design. As of the time I made this post, the App Store images are still of the old dashboard which is much nicer. When I first saw this update I thought it was an older version. The iconography is not easy to read, they are significantly smaller, and the colors are not as easy to see. Plus you have to scroll down a lot to see everything on the dashboard as they are all listed one after another, and not in a grid. If at all possible, please revert back to the old version, or consider better icons and colors in the future.

Wanting?? Fixed?? I am writing this to complain more about the last couple updates that seem to be broken? The new program added to the app I do like the idea that is if it would work half the time. Most times when I click on the period tracker it freezes up not just that part of the program but the whole app freezes up and won‚Äôt work at all. I have to close the app down and restart it to work and even doing that the tracker still won‚Äôt fix it self I click on it once more it freezes up and I am restarting the app again! PLEASE FIX!!!!!

Great app The app and the watch sync well. I think a five day memory on a watch is long enough to remember to connect to the app. Interface is user friendly and it‚Äôs great to see that now you can track women‚Äôs days too.

Food log not working I don‚Äôt know how to contact Fitbit to let them know about a problem with their app, but it isn‚Äôt saving my food entries. Like I‚Äôll enter different food items and select them, and it will act like it adds them and then immediately delete them, so I‚Äôll add goldfish crackers or hamburger bun or something, and it‚Äôll appear for like a third of a second and then disappear along with all of the calories and everything, so I have to reenter all of my food each time I open the app. Very annoying, I wish Fitbit made it easier to report these software issues
Used to work great... EDIT:  FIXED!  THANKS!!!
Mobile track doesn‚Äôt work/bad switching time zones I have 2 recurring problems with this app and/or my Fitbit device.

Great app I've been using Fitbit for several years now. I love the devices & have upgraded all the way to the Versa. The app works & looks great. I can see the states I want in the order that I arrange. The regular updates keeps all the information up to date & looking good! I love tracking my steps & seeing my progress between activities & sleep. It's really handy to use. It certainly keeps me motivated to move constantly.

Great features for fitness This app is great. It has almost everything you need to manage your fitness regimen. Data Analytics put to good use. Want to know how much movement you are getting on a daily basis and over a period days or weeks, the Fitbit app has that. Want to know how much sleep you are getting and the quality of that sleep, it‚Äôs right there in the app. I could go on.... but you get the picture.
Works great for me / FIT BIT CHARGE 3 The first paragraph of the review on my charge HR two.

Love my Fit App Because my Alta Fitbit is often difficult to read in the sunlight or while exercising, it is so nice to have the app open and right with me to keep me up-to-date with the progress I am making toward reaching my goals‚Äîall day long. Wearing a Fitbit for the last several years has been a game changer for me. I, honestly, believe this ‚Äústep‚Äù üòä was one toward many that are changing and lengthening my life! Thank you!

How do I marry Fitbit? This app and the products connected to it have changed my life for the better. I use the sleep tracker for my sleep disorder to regulate how much more sleep I need to get in a day. Ive also gotten really into weight training lately and can tell how my body is reacting to my workouts. I think everyone should get a Fitbit. It‚Äôs helped me change my life for the better and become more conscious of how I treat myself.
Fitbit App is very good at monitoring BP and Pulse! I have for years wondered whether your watch/fitness device and associated iPhone app.

Needs bug updates I love my Fitbit but since the app has been updated the notifications bubble in the app doesn‚Äôt go away and hasn‚Äôt shown any notifications since October even though it says I have some. I had to manually enter a workout and it took away the active minutes it said I had instead of adding my workout to my active minutes.

Good but could be great I have enjoyed using my Fitbit HR during that last 2 years. My only wish is that there were a pause workout feature on the watch. There are workout days when I just don't want to take my fone or the weather is an issue. And while I'm here, the distance has always been a mile off between the watch and the fone. The fone app always has been accurate. Any way to calibrate. I always have to edit the distance on the watch.
Pretty Great just missing some key features I love my Fitbit but I wish the app was slightly more comprehensive.

Good but not amazing I find I need other apps to workin conjunction with this. The food tracker needs some work. I have to use MyFitnessPal and a calculator in conjunction with this to meet my needs. Would be nice if the app could take into account specific dietary needs/diet plans to track macros better. Additionally you can find specific foods but if you change the serving size the app doesn‚Äôt adjust the macro counts only the calories. For this reason I have to go to another app or use a calculator to adjust  the correct numbers for fats carbs and proteins.

Useless if it WONT LET YOU LOG IN! I used to love this app. I went a few months without using my Fitbit and redownloaded the app as I wanted to start using it again. I went to log in and it threatened it was going to delete my account for inactivity and prompted me to recover or cancel. I click recover and it says sorry some unknown error. I go to the Fitbit website and have NO PROBLEM logging in and viewing my dashboard. I am now getting fed up because all I want to do it update the clock on my watch. So I then decide to see if making a new account works. I go through all the setup stages and it comes time to press ‚Äúcreate account.‚Äù What happens? ANOTHER UNKNOWN ERROR. Useless. USELESS.

Love Fitbit I absolutely love this app and watch , but today I have been having issues with the app. I accidentally close it while on my mile walk and now it won‚Äôt let me continue the work out or click on any of my stats to see my progress, like sleep, heart beat etc. I‚Äôve tried shutting down the app and opening but it‚Äôs not working. Hope this is a bug you all can fix!

Frustrated on Syncing I love my Fitbit charge 3 but lately it isn‚Äôt syncing all my data. My watch shows 9 active hours but fewer hours show up on my phone. It says I have 12K steps on my watch and phone. However, when you click on the 12K steps, it shows 8K steps with no steps for the first few hours of the day. What‚Äôs going on? Why isn‚Äôt the full information coming over to my phone?
Very helpful data Overall, the app has been very helpful to review data and track trends so I know how to adjust routines as necessary.

author_name: all the good names b taken
review_body: IN LOVE I absolutely love my fitbit and the app. I have never been the type to want to get up and go, but being able to participate in the challenges and compete against my friends and just myself has began a shift that I cannot be more excited and grateful for.

Still no updates  üò°üò°üò° Still no updates on all the things EVERYONE has complained about. I‚Äôve had my Inspire HR for a few months. I did the IOS13 update and this watch has been crappy ever since. No text notifications, call vibrates the watch but doesn‚Äôt display who is calling anymore, alarm just stopped working.  I like the watch but please fix the app and make it work like it should!! Apple is getting more and more customers because of the customer service with their canned (basically turn off and on again) answers!!!! üò°üò°üò° I‚Äôm about to head over to Apple also! Do you actually listen to your customers???

Still Waiting for Text Messages LOVE my Versa, upgraded from a Charge 2 last year. I didn‚Äôt have my Versa for long before some updates were made to the software. I‚Äôm not sure if it was the Fitbit content itself, or if it was a compatibility issue with latest iOS updates - but I have yet to receive texts on my Versa. I am alerted to phone calls, but no longer text messages. I‚Äôve made sure all notification settings are enabled. Will definitely change to 5 stars when this is fixed!
Needs updating again Love love love Fitbit Versa. Needs to show your miles you‚Äôve done all year.

Loved it until I didn‚Äôt This app was great. I love my FitBit, it‚Äôs become a great tool for taking care of my health. However, with the last update my Charge 2 no longer syncs. This close to a major holiday this feels like a subtle forcing to buy a new FitBit, a feeling that sours FitBit for me. The update history looks more like an effort to give people stuff they don‚Äôt want (1:1 messages) and no effort given to fixing problems. Not to mention the blatant oversight in the lack of pregnancy settings (hello this is a significant health factor). After all this I‚Äôm seriously thinking about switching to another device.

Notifications I‚Äôve loved having my Fitbit but one of the things I liked best was being able to receive my text messages on my watch. I‚Äôm so disappointed that even with the update the option for private messaging still doesn‚Äôt work. I wish Apple and Fitbit would get this working again. I don‚Äôt like having to choose ‚Äúalways preview‚Äù just to get this option to work. Based on other comments within the app I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôm the only one frustrated about this change.

Premium ads abound, clutter up the ux Here‚Äôs a health trend I don‚Äôt need Fitbit‚Äôs premium service to analyze for me: when I open the app and am bombarded with up-selling on every module, and even have to keep a tab visible that will never be relevant to me as a die hard hardware + freemium software user, my heart rate rapidly increases. It‚Äôs not classy, it‚Äôs not helpful, and it certainly doesn‚Äôt motivate me to use the product or the service. Unless this changes quickly I‚Äôll be switching to a new system at my next hardware upgrade ‚Äî I might even make the switch sooner so I may bid adieu to this pathetic cash grab experience.

Crummy, but necessary if you use a fitbit tracker. People seem happy with it (currently stands at 4.2 out of 5) but it seems buggy that me, and has been buggy since my first Fitbit several years ago. Issues are:

The Ionic doesn‚Äôt work after the iOS update Now I can‚Äôt get my texts on the ionic on my watch.  I updated to the new phone as well.  Ridiculous.  I tried to delete the app, delete the watch, reinstall them both and it still won‚Äôt work.

Sleep Score makes this device useless With the introduction of the Sleep Score (and not coincidentally, the premium subscription you MUST buy in order to access Sleep Score details), this device is useless if you care about tracking sleep.  There‚Äôs no way to turn the score off.  Weekly Hours Slept have been wiped out individually; you can only look at the current week‚Äôs average and only if you dig for it.

New app UI is a downgrade imo I enjoyed the previous version. This one seems too streamlined, unintuitive, and obviously engineered to drive the user to their upgradable features. Which is fine. But, why tinker with everything that was great? Even the ‚Äòcelebration‚Äô feature of a daily step-goal is like an old Atari game celebration.

Please start working with Apple Watch I had a Fitbit last year.   I loved it.  But it was cheaply made and fell apart after 9 months of use.  I fell in love with the app.  I received an Apple Watch for Christmas.  I would gladly and willingly pay for my watch data to sync with your far superior app.  I love my watch.  The ability to sync my music and work out hands free and wireless - freaking awesome.  The only thing missing is your app.  I miss the community aspect and fun challenges.  And all my cool stats in one place.  Not spread amongst 6 different apps.  I miss you!

Love it I wear my FB everyday, except when charging. I love the variety of tracking it offers. Being OCD though, it is driving me insane seeing ‚ÄòNotifications‚Äô tab with the red dot. I go in and see all the notifications (Look at you sports star... Almost there... Overachiever) but I cannot delete them!! There is no ‚Äòread‚Äô, ‚Äòdelete‚Äô or clear button. I can not swipe them left, right, up or down. Please fix this!! The notifications and red dot need to go away!!

Connie Eastern USA I truly enjoy using and rely on my Fitbit Alta. However, on occasion I find that I want to delete or discard a tracking record that I know is incorrect. I was tracking a walk and then failed to stop the tracking when my walk ended. When I remembered two hours later, it had recorded a 2 hour walk for a distance of 9 miles. Totally wrong; however, I was unable to discard that result. Please provide a way to edit or delete, or tell me how to do it.

Doesn‚Äôt Send Text Notifications Let me just say that I love Fitbit; I‚Äôve had several over the years and love them all. BUT‚Äîsometime around August of 2018, either Apple did an update or FitBit did (not sure which) and I stopped receiving text notifications. I thought it was my FitBit Charge 2 that was malfunctioning, so I switched to the Versa and had the same experience. And yes, I‚Äôve done everything all of the blogs and tech articles have suggested and still not working. It‚Äôs not a critical feature, but if you‚Äôre going to offer it, can you at least make sure it works?

Happy Loser! Fitbit has helped me quantify, and record my fitness journey! I‚Äôve lost around 50 lbs, but didn‚Äôt start recording and tracking until the last 30 lbs. It tracks everything I could dream of tracking, and it helps me connect with friends so we can help motivate one another. I looked into the Apple Watch, and I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs great, but I‚Äôve been super happy with my Fitbit products and community. Thank you, Fitbit!

Great device, app interface could be better Love the device!!   However As others have stated- when it comes to the app use the old design as long as possible because the new one is quite a pain to look at.   Recently purchased 2 and downloaded the app.    When we compared our two phones  my wife had received the new design before my phone did. We both thought that my phone (with old design) was the new interface as it was that much easier to look at.

Hate the new updated version The older version was so much better!!! I can‚Äôt find anything you have to scroll through the app to find anything. I liked when all you had to do was open the app and there was all the info I was looking for!! Now when exercising you have to stop and scroll and hope you can find what you‚Äôre looking for!!! Leave things alone!!!!

New update The most recent update is so disappointing! I don‚Äôt like it at all! It is hard to use and you can‚Äôt customize the home page. The home page doesn‚Äôt tell you how many calories you have burned. I really hope that they can change it back or improve on this. I am very sad that Fitbit changed it, because there was nothing wrong with it and no need for the change (in my opinion). I also am having trouble with the reminders to move, it is on and when I clearly do not have enough steps for the hour it doesn‚Äôt make any buzzing.

I‚Äôm one star away from throwing my $300 ionic in the garbage and buying an Apple Watch. Can it be so hard to make a product that works reliably. It is nearly impossible to connect to Bluetooth. Your solution on the help forum is to restart my phone?! Why not make better software? Great, but some issues Don‚Äôt get me wrong, I love this app. But there‚Äôs a bug I‚Äôve noticed that hasn‚Äôt gone away with any updates. great! only a few bugs everything is great except for the fact that it takes FOREVER to refresh and load how much you slept. secondly, the app gets very buggy when your trying to set an alarm clock. if i put it to 4:00 am, it will just take a while for it to load in to say it is ready. once it even kicked me out of the app! hope the bugs get fixed.

Not working. Update Right after my 1 star rant, everything started to work properly. We will see if it syncs continuously after reading all the complaints about this charge 3 syncing issues after the update.

Despite being a nurse, I seriously did not know how crappy some foods are for our bodies. Another great part is breaking down my workouts as far as fat burning, cardio, etc., love it. Lastly, the way it tracks my sleep...so very cool and fascinating.  Keep up the great work!

Awesome app I‚Äôm a IOS user I‚Äôve never had any problems with this app while tracking my progress, you can meet lots people that are genuinely competitive by doing group challenge, the only downside of it, its that there are also some people that ‚Äúfriend request‚Äù that‚Äôs acting weird with no activity those smell like scam people I think they‚Äôre just trying to steal like your information so fit fam be aware! Overall this a great app üëç

Fitbit app I love this app and use it every day to track my diet and exercise. The only reason that I gave it 3 stars instead of four is that I think the list of food that is on my personal food list should be in alphabetical order. I have about 40 items that I chose from daily, such as a berry smoothie, and I always have to hunt for it which takes time. ABC order of favorite often used food would make this app 4 stars.

Fitbit Keeping up you‚Äôre step game It has been awesome having my FITBIT , I had both knees Totally replaced  it has helped me keep up with my activities each day , so I stay up with my healing . I also love the fact that it can also keep up with you‚Äôre heart status.

Activity measure I like this app for many reasons, but I find that the activity minutes are often WAY off! I have a very active job - lots of walking, which is counted, but also LOTS of handling merchandise - putting it on shelves, straightening it, helping customers, bringing products from the warehouse - which involves lifting boxes, and pushing my cart around. And I climb a step stool often. Yesterday in my 8 hr day, I got credit for 9 minutes of activity!!!! Janice

New update erases period info from the versa watch What the heck. The reason I went with Versa is that it showed when my period was. It‚Äôs one of the few watches that does that. And with this new update that info is gone! I used to be able to swipe up on the watch face and see Steps, Heart Rate, Period. Now I can select from a list of things to see here and Period isn‚Äôt one of them. It‚Äôs just gone. I wish I would have known. I would have never updated. Or I wish I would have updated sooner so I could have asked for an Apple Watch for the holidays, at least then I could see what I wanted to see.
Just OK I have had FitBit in various styles:  Alta, Charge and the Charge HR for about 5 years.  I got them mainly to track my steps each day.  I also got the same styles for husband.

High praise I love this app!  The best part is the sleep tracking.  I can see what affects the quality of my sleep and I have been making changes that have me resting longer and deeper!  I also love that it tracks my estimated calories burned....it helps me keep my food consumed in balance.  Lastly it‚Äôs really handy to be able to view texts on the wristband.  I can‚Äôt imagine not wearing this device!

A great service I‚Äôve been using fitbit on and off for about 3 years. Though I sometimes get worn out with the constant logging of water, food, exercise...I always come back to it because it‚Äôs supportive and well organized. Also, if you can get used to sleeping with the fitbit on, the vibrating alarm is a really peaceful way to wake up compared to getting squawked at by an alarm. Namaste
Very Helpful I have bad knees and I do the best I can with steps. Even still, being mindful helps me to push a little further as often as I am able.

Night shifter neglect First, I love and enjoy my Fitbit. It does what it says it does, counts my steps. The challenges are fun and keep me engaged. But, I‚Äôm a night shifter, a nurse who walks a lot and my day starts and ends on different days (7p to 7a or 3p to 3a)but I would like to be able to customize it to fit my schedule. When I end my shift I would like to look at my Fitbit and see all I‚Äôve done. When it rolls over at midnight it resets and I become discouraged at seeing zero when I still have so many hours left in my day.
App doesn‚Äôt work Update: the app finally allowed me to sign in. It was pretty frustrating that it wasn‚Äôt working. Hopefully it will work properly now and syncing works.

Lost 40 pounds using this app If I could give this app 10 stars I would. After failing at losing weight on my own and with weight watchers for years, I decided to start tracking my food in this app. Finally, the weight started to come off! Plus it tracks my heart rate and sleep and of course helps me be active by counting my steps. I could not live without this app and watch!

Fitbit has syncing issues! I have a charge 2 that has worked perfectly for the past 18months. Then on Dec 16 it decided to stop syncing. Online Support tells you to do all the steps over and over again to zero results.

My review Got on this app and automatically greeted me and it healthy work out are used to weigh not what I was supposed to weigh knocking to say but it help me lose weight automatically this app is guaranteed to help you and it hooks up to my Fitbit perfectly and not only that it helps my kids get more athletic and it helps him have fun they challenge each other to see how many steps they can get

Logo and Password Experiencing recently in last month several times where login and password are being dropped from my iPhone. I‚Äôve been using Fitbit for over four years and never had this problem. Followed customer support‚Äôs instructions to update through settings, then one week later (today) had to re-enter my login and password. Don‚Äôt know if coincidence, there was an app update on my iPhone today too, perhaps that removed my login and password.

Get a Garmin/Apple Watch/anything else I have trouble with this app almost every day. Some days it won‚Äôt let me log in; other days, the app won‚Äôt sync. There are days the Bluetooth just stops working, so any messaging features don‚Äôt show up on my watch interface. Sometimes it decides not to record my sleep - which I think coincides with days that won‚Äôt let me login. I have tried turning my phone off and on, restarting my Bluetooth, checking for app updates.... etc. It has become a guessing game of whether or not I can use the app that day. Long story short, I‚Äôll be asking Santa for a Garmin this year.

Good product My Fitbit is a hand down from my daughter. She bought it new and used it for a few years and then gave it to me to keep up with my daily steps. I didn‚Äôt realize it did all the other daily activities too. Unfortunately, the button isn‚Äôt working, so the only way I can tell how I‚Äôm doing is by looking it up on my iPad or phone which is inconvenient. I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôs just either dirty or worn out so I‚Äôm planning on buying myself a new one. I love all the features it offers.

Limited running stats I would like to see more stats on the basic app for running and cycling. I also use Strava just to see my stats for elevation, matches runs, satellite maps, and better challenges with friends/community.

Everything is great but... I love this is app and all the features it includes. The only thing I wish Fitbit did better on is the resting heart rate feature. It gives me a different score than the textbook gives me. Also, I had a high resting heart rate for one day last year and I think it accounts that into my score. I think that it should re-evaluate every few months, because it is motivating knowing that I am improving my heart health!

author_name: Dude, why is my name taken?
review_body: The food log has gone haywire! This app has helped me fundamentally change my body. I‚Äôm able to track so many different things including calories, steps, heart rate, food macros, etc. I would truly recommend the product and app to anyone who is interested in fitness, whether you are trying to get in shape or if you are trying to stay that way!

App Fitbit Challenge Malfunction I‚Äôm doing Fitbit challenges, more specifically workweek hustle this week. My steps per day (addition of the days combined) and the total steps displayed in the challenge do not match up. The total steps that show in the challenge are off by 5000 steps. I tried closing the app and restarting, turning off my watch and turning it back on, turning off my phone and turning it back on. It appears that the app is malfunctioning since since my daily steps are correct. I don‚Äôt know how to fix this but here seems to be some sort of bug.

Messages not syncing So i have had the Fitbit for some years now and just recently purchased the Fitbit versa. I have been in love with this watch since I first saw it and love all the features about it but I just recently switched phones and ever since my text messages and phone calls have not been coming to my device. I‚Äôve taken it off the Bluetooth, rebooted it multiply times and still nothing. This is very frustrating because I don‚Äôt always have my phone on me and being able to receive these notifications is very helpful. Please let me know what I can do. I need this to work

Works reasonably well The app works reasonably well - does everything it‚Äôs supposed to though it doesn‚Äôt sync anything but steps taken unless it‚Äôs open (even when set to sync continuously). It also doesn‚Äôt clear the notification badge in the app once you‚Äôve read the notification and you can‚Äôt delete them so you have to keep checking to see if there is truly any new notifications. Those are minor but continually frustrating issues.

Love my Fitbit One of the best customer service departments and quality products I have had the opportunity to engage with.  I highly recommend them to everyone who is interested in a fitness band because of my own experience in the past four years. I have purchased them for gifts for my family and will continue to be a Fitbit user for a very long time!

Won‚Äôt synch or see blue tooth signal Ever since apple switch to ios 11 fitbit won‚Äôt synch anymore bec it cannot see the blue tooth signal from iphone 6s plus. I did ever thing reistall apps even have my phone check at apple and they re load the ios 11 which cause me to lose 75 percent of my pics and then fit bit

Making a suggestion for the Fitbit charge 2 I love the app and my Fitbit charge. I am suggesting that you guys put sleeping on the Fitbit charge 2 like it on the app. I would like to track my sleep from my Fitbit.

Not to good There are too many things that don‚Äôt work as advertised. The heart rate monitor goes 60 to 90 points two high when working out. And the sleep monitor doesn‚Äôt usually give complete readings (continuous dark blue line rather than different shades of blue to show different sleep patterns. It doesn‚Äôt matter if I move it up or down the arm as suggested.
Software not updating UPDATE:   I should know better.  Cleared memory pages and turns off phone completely.  All fixed.   END UPDATE
Need improvements 1. Searching for foods should also give me a list from my past consumption also rather than just ‚Äúpopular‚Äù and ‚Äúrest of yr database‚Äù.

Horrible Quality Control It appeared that no one at Fitbit understands the basic concept of quality control.  Every time I track a ‚Äúwalk‚Äù it now creates two entries.  One on GMT time, so usually the next day with no data other than the route and minutes, and a separate one with all the all the actual exercise data.  Not sure if you delete one whether it will delete both or not, plus the point of carrying the phone is to get the GPS tracking.

Fitbit app no longer syncing I love my Fitbit charge 2. I use it all the time and log everything. HOWEVER halfway through the day today my Fitbit decided to delete all the workouts I‚Äôve done today, as well as my heart rate for giant chunks of the day, most of my active minutes, and half the calories I burned throughout the day. And now will no longer sync. I updated the app, did not fix it. Trouble shooted based on everything I found online (restarted device, logging out and logging back in, deleting and redownloading  the app) and still not fixed. The ‚Äúbug fixes‚Äù just created more bugs!
Love the integration! I have enjoyed the updates with the Fitbit Versa and the app, integrating physical fitness with mindfulness and tracking my sleep! Absolutely love it!

So many errors recently I‚Äôve been frequently having issues with my app and now watch getting out of sync. Today, I walked 11,000+ steps and hit all my other goals (calories, active minutes, miles, flights of stairs) and when I went to refresh my Fitbit app, it showed up properly and then all of a sudden it changed it to 5,664 steps and only 10 active minutes?? It is getting all out of whack many different instances now. And I‚Äôm really actually trying to track this progress so it‚Äôs super frustrating

Can‚Äôt see battery level, updates making app more complex The app is good, but each time it tries to keep reinventing itself, I think it loses a little bit. Functionality has gotten fancier, not easier.

So GOOD!!! But... I have only had my Fitbit for less than a year, and I can tell you that it is awesome! When I have it on my wrist it is so light that I almost can‚Äôt feel it! I really like it, but syncing the Fitbit takes a little bit of time. Other than that I have no other complaints! In this app the reminders are nice and gentle, in my opinion it is a fun, carefree, and simple way to track your steps, flights of stairs and much, much, more!!!

Charge 3 not getting text message notifications I have the Charge 3 and the IPhone 8 +. I noticed a few weeks ago I was not receiving text message notifications from my Fitbit charge 3. I reboot my Charge, reinstalled Fitbit, restarted my phone, restarted my Bluetooth, and deleted/repaired my charge 3 device. I followed all the steps on the Fitbit forums about making sure different settings in the Fitbit app are on and all permissions are allowed but the charge 3 is still not notifying me of text messages. I believe this is due to the most resent update. Please fix.

Fix it already!! Like many others here I‚Äôm unhappy about the update since I no longer receive notifications on my Versa despite trying all their recommended fixes - calls come through but no alerts or texts. Notifications are the reason I upgraded my Fitbit and now they don‚Äôt work - for two weeks easy. I have an annoying red dot in my inbox but no actual message. And like others - I hate the new random sleep score numbers. Allow us to revert to the old operating system or fix this already.

Worked great until latest update! Update! I followed the directions provided to restart my Fitbit and pair with my phone. I‚Äôm happy to report that it‚Äôs functioning great again! No more missed calls or texts from my daughter who‚Äôs in the military.

Wish I could ‚Äúun-update‚Äù Hit update all so Fitbit updated. It took me way to long to find the spot I need to change my silent alarms (which I do often). It‚Äôs sort of where it used to be but hidden. I had to pull down and hold but not let go or I lost the ability to tap on my tracker. I also can‚Äôt see the battery life displayed constantly as before. I liked the visuals before and dislike the list I‚Äôm stuck with now. Maybe this is designed to drive me to the pay version??

Loved my Fitbit for 5 years then... The latest update of the app is HORRIBLE! I consult my app 10-20 times a day. You‚Äôve changed it to take longer to scroll thru the items. Added irritating little tips. And generally made it a VERY irritating app to use.

Love My Fitbit but Hate new App I‚Äôve been using Fitbit for two years. New phone app is a significant downgrade. Previous version showed all info in tiles; now requires scrolling. Less information shows in several areas-you have to go to detail pages for useful bits. Weirdly less motivating. It‚Äôs less attractive-the new colors evoke the late 80‚Äôs and, the icons are flattened. Too bad this is the final version. Hate it! As my device ages, I‚Äôll consider leaving for a different platform if the app (which I refer to several times a day) continues to be so poorly designed.

Upgrade is the worst I‚Äôve had Fitbit for 3 years. This latest update was the worst mistake the company has ever undergone. It can‚Äôt even keep steps synchronized much less anything else like water. There are no bug fixes and anymore bugs like today and Fitbit will be out of business for good. I loved my Fitbit until somebody with no technical experience took over

Add pregnancy setting!! I love this app! It‚Äôs very insightful and helpful in tracking my fitness, but it would be SOOOO much more helpful if a pregnancy setting could be added to my goals/personal profile/settings. There is a great female tracker, but that part is definitely missing from it. Pregnancy changes much of what I do/don‚Äôt do, eat/don‚Äôt eat. My sleep changes, my heart rate during exercise changes, my weight, etc. Please add this to your next update!

REB Fit bit will not sync with WiFi half the time after charging. Very frustrating!! This is a update review . I am very happy with the features of the versa but at least once a month I am resetting everything because it doesn‚Äôt sync. I use the instructions from your technical support team that the wait time was over 35 minutes but they were very helpful. I believe I have a unit that is hopefully not the normal product you strive to sell because it is frustrating when it does not sync and there is no pattern why.I sent a response a day ago and not syncing again today.

Fitbit app is a great catch all tracker Have used it for over a year now and love that it links and uploads easily from our ‚Äúmy fitness pal‚Äù app, which we use for our daily food log, and the Advanta health app which our insurance company uses to track our steps for monthly cash rebates. Only reason it doesn‚Äôt get 5 stars is that the apps food library is rather limited on its own, but at least it easily uploads from others.

Unreliable Features I have Fitbit Charge 2 and steps are inaccurate, a person can stand still (washing hand) and just because the hand is moving, it records steps taken. Charging Fitbit turns off notifications that are received from smartphone. Charging sometimes changes the Sleep Stages, returning it back to the original sleep tracking view. As of lately sleep tracking is not accurate, sometimes it states that at least one hour less if sleep is recorded.

Diehard user I love my Fitbit. I first bought it to track my sleep and it has revolved into much more. 2 suggestions: 1-bring back the ability to tap and slide your finger on the sleep summary for the night to see the exact time a particular cycle began. 2-make a Charge HR waterproof. I am a very active person and have destroyed 2 previous Fitbits due to my affinity for water and their lack of it.

Motivating The Fitbit app has something for everyone! I love the personal and group challenges, especially hiking in National Parks. The app is very "user friendly" and provides training and education. The only drawback is some workout programs that aren't provided like Les Mills Body Pump. The sleep option has helped me stay on track to improve my sleep habits. The community groups are also motivating.

Great but needs some work Fitbit is a great app, it keeps people motivated and happy and healthy! The only downside is that not all of the tra Kong‚Äôs are accurate. For example, the miles. The miles walked is way off, I will have 5,000 steps but it will tell me I have over 10 miles. This is a problem with both my mom and my sister too! If the miles were at least a little more believable this would definitely be a five star app!

Useful and accurate Though I don‚Äôt exercise often now, I still wear my Fitbit all the time. I like to reach my goal steps if I‚Äôm close, and beat my husband in challenges! And since I recently got a Charge 2 when my Alta battery became ineffective, I‚Äôm obsessed with seeing my sleep each morning- light, deep and REM. It does seem accurate to me. When I do actually go for a walk, I‚Äôm ready!

Versa maybe to so good on service I got this new Versa for Christmas from my son, but was not sure how to set up so I saved it until my son came home in late April he set it up quickly and I love it but I put the protective cover on it and three weeks later it now has a crack on the face, well I live my Versa but when I contacted them about fixing it they said they did not have a service center and would have to buy a new one but would give me s 25% off coupon to buy a new one. I said no thank you I will use it until it quits. Very disappointed to be told they didn‚Äôt want me to take it to a jeweler.

Love my Fitbit! I have used the Flex 2 since June of 2013. It reminds me to keep moving instead of sitting at my computer 8 hrs straight. It also reaffirms how my sleep was so at least I know why I am tired or rested. I have thought about using other trackers but none work well in the water - I like jogging in the water plus swimming and the Flex 2 keeps track of movement on land or in the water!

Just what the doctor ordered! I‚Äôve been wearing mine ever since my cardiologist told me to get one a year ago. Had to have two stents for blockages places last June and just set up an appointment for tomorrow because of irregularities in my heart rate that I‚Äôve noticed because of my Fitbit. If I wasn‚Äôt using it, because I never have any pain, I might never have been aware of what is going on.

Changing my lifestyle I needed something to get me on track to exercising and eating better. Fitbit is perfect for that. Logging my food daily keeps me conscious of what I‚Äôm eating and the nutritional value also. The reminder to do my steps is a excellent way to change my metabolism. I needed something to help me and Fitbit was a excellent choice. I would recommend it highly for an assistant to getting healthier.

New Feature for Fitbit Charge 2 Should add a feature to at least this device to where you could turn off step tracking while your watching tv, driving, etc. could be similar to exercise tracking, where you just scroll to the screen and then hold the button to stop tracking steps for the moment. Would help out with over tracking steps

My opinion I love the Fitbit app. Great way to see your steps, floors, etc. I like how you can put in your water and food count. And love how it tracks my period. BUT... the I use the alarms a lot especially to wake me up because it‚Äôs not a loud noise to anger me. It‚Äôs annoying that it takes so long to sync up to my Fitbit. And that‚Äôs why I'm giving four stars instead of five. Please fix this or is there ways to make it go faster that I don‚Äôt know about?

Silent Arm Terrible The silent alarm on the ionic is a great feature in theory. But, the vibration goes off for only a paltry 5 seconds, before it snoozes, and then goes off once more 9 min later.  That‚Äôs not nearly enough to wake anyone up.

Apple Health It would be really great if you and apple could figure out how to sync with each other. Specifically referring to the apple health. It counts steps from my phone and my Fitbit counts but they never agree, even if my phone is in my pocket all day. Also heart rate and sleep data could be synced too. ‚ÄúFitbit Coach‚Äù can read and write data but it‚Äôs limited. I feel like you‚Äôre both big enough companies that this should be a no brainer.

Excellent Tracker and Motivator I like the way that the FitBit2 not only keeps track of steps, it reminds you to get up and move. It also lets you know when you have calls, and you can set alarms. The app is also great for tracking the calories you eat compared to how many you burn. The food database is extensive.  You can also have group challenges.

Fitbit review I wear a Fitbit alt Il and for me it is a life saver. I have certain medical conditions and being able to track every bite I eat including how much protein I eat. Also tracking my 10,000 steps per day and the sleep tracking. It is a pretty professional tool if used properly. It also helps me control my weight which at my age (74) and level of conditions is of life sustaining importance.
Fitbit review I enjoy my Fitbit and use it every single day. My Fitbit concerns are as follows:

Love, Love, Love my Fitbit I‚Äôbe been using my Fitbit Flex 2 for over two years and I love the device as well as the application on my phone. I like the way it syncs with my NuMi app also. Between the two applications they keep me honest with my healthy lifestyle. I love to watch my progress ! I don‚Äôt like obvious fitness devices and my Fitbit 2 looks like a piece of jewelry. The app is very easy to use and user friendly!

Sleep more I am 75 years old and , all my life, I have awakened by 6 am and out of bed. For some reason , since I have been wearing the Fitbit , I have increased my sleep time to the point of an average of 7 to 8 hours a night. That‚Äôs an increase of 1 to 2 hours a night. I know it is a mental thing but I will take it. I am also more aware of my daily activity. I never take it off

Fitbit Nutrition tiny bit off Fitbit has one flaw that‚Äôs annoying but we‚Äôve found a work around. When entering nutritional information, the Fitbit information can be slightly off by a few calories here and there. And if you‚Äôre really tracking your intake for the day, this matters greatly. So we use a different app that links in with the Fitbit app for nutritional calorie counting.

Please make new click faces for Charge 2 I've had my Fitbit charge2 for a year now and I enjoy changing it up. However, there's about 2 of the clock faces that I like. It would be great for an update there!!!! Just more options on customizing would be nice in that department.

Notes Option PLEASE!! I love everything about my Fitbit App BUT... I could sure use a NOTES option.  A notes option would allow me to keep track of WHY I had 47K steps in 1 day... WHAT DID I DO THAT DAY?? I can't remember but I'd certainly would like to keep track without going to my calendar. Was I sight seeing? Was it a normal day at home? Was I at the beach?  I understand I track my workouts but would like a place in the app to remind me of my "day". Routine or not.
This keeps me honest with myself. I have found every excuse to not monitor my diet, and exercise. But this Fitbit app along with my Fitbit has encouraged me by making it fun and easy.

Good for most part I‚Äôve enjoyed this app for the last 2 years and really like it. The reason for -1 Star is due to lack of fixing bugs on the app. I stopped using my Fitbit because the app would freeze my phone and not allow me to sync. I let my Fitbit battery die, deleted the app and downloaded it again. The app still does not allow me to sync therefore, there‚Äôs only 4 stars. Will add another once this is fixed

Stopped syncing I have used this app for a really long time and just recently it has started not syncing. It just keeps looking and then will not sync. I have reset my fitbit several times and I have repeatedly deleted the app and re installed it. I have turned my phone off and back on several times still does the same thing. I also have the app on my iPad and it works fine. Please fix the phone app.

Nice Except for DST The app works as advertised, except for messing up Daylight Saving Time. On Spring Forward Day the reminder hours moved forward by one hour. They should stay the same. The app would then not allow time adjustment and kept moving the corrected time forward by one hour. To work around, simply set the start and stop times one hour prior to what you want. Maybe an update will fix this. Other than that, nice app.

Great Fitness App and products. I have the Blaze for the past 2 years and the original Charge before that, I also use their scale. I have always used Fitbit products with my iPhone and could not be happier. The only thing that I would like to see is some watch face updates otherwise keep up the great job. PSI bought my wife a Blaze too and she uses it every day as well. AAA+++

Ongoing issues For the past two weeks every time I try and download my steps the app clears my tracker. Very frustrating when trying to monitor goals. This is what happened to my first Fitbit until it quit working after two years. Purchased the next one and it is not even a year old. Very disappointed with this product.

Good app...when it works Very frustrated with this app.  I keep it updated on my iPad and iPhone, but the iPad version is terrible.  Much of the time it won‚Äôt connect with my Alta, a mere 12 inches away.  When it IS connected, 75% of the time the sync is painfully slow, hangs, or doesn‚Äôt recognize my Alta altogether.  Strangely enough, the app works perfectly on my iPhone.

Good but one thing So I realized that there was a period tracker when I first got mine and I haven‚Äôt gotten it since. But the app tries to predict when it will happen. Whenever I delete the period, it comes back when I reload the app. I think when you delete it, it should stay deleted. It makes more since when you‚Äôre first logging your periods. That‚Äôs all thanks.

Not worth it anymore After being a Fitbit customer for some years now I‚Äôm moving away from them. Detailed features that once where free since the beginning are now moved to their paid subscription side of Fitbit. Now all you get is an estimate therefore being useless. I use to use my sleep and detailed sleeping heart rate to share with my doctors when would see if something wasn‚Äôt right. But now Fitbit got greedy. I can understand if they charge for coaching but not something that other watches will give me for no charge. It was nice while it lasted. Now I know why you are losing to others.
Useless I wrote a much longer review but have edited it down because it‚Äôs really simple: It doesn‚Äôt work.

New update issues Ever since the last update I have not been able to sync my data to the phone nor the watch. The watch froze, was no longer getting text notifications, I was getting issue after issue with the versa. I thought that if I indicated factory reset, it would work and nope. Now I can‚Äôt get the watch to go forward from the main image of ‚ÄúTo start, download the Fitbit app.‚Äù The application for the phone freezes every two minutes from the last update so I can‚Äôt hook up the watch to the application. On top of that I can‚Äôt get my status to pop up.
Please fix calorie tracker and aria sync. Can‚Äôt use at all My calorie tracker won‚Äôt allow me to add calories for previous days and every day shows only exactly what I logged for today.
Charge 3 hr Update on this.

Disappointed The new premium feature has screwed up the regular free version. I‚Äôve loved my Fitbit and the app up until a few weeks ago when Fitbit started charging for premium features, specifically the sleep tracking. My Fitbit has always tracked my sleep pretty well, very consistent. Now that they‚Äôve introduced the sleep rating feature along with new premium stuff, my sleep tracking feature has waned. Even though I wear my Fitbit to bed every night, 3-4x/wk it no longer is able to tell I have it on.

Love Love Love my FitBits I‚Äôve never wanted a smart watch or a FitBit but then my son got me one...and I started wearing it & as I learned all the features it has....I find myself challenging myself everyday. I have to reach 10,000 daily or I can‚Äôt stand it. I started using the timer, alarm, everything. The GPS is cool too...I just live my FitBit. I love to challenge my ‚ÄúFitBitches‚Äù to challenges and them floating when I win.

The iOS 13 fix? After two months of failed attempts and useless suggestions, I found a fix to my no text notifications problem.  I deleted the Versa from both Bluetooth and the Fitbit app then Factory Reset my Versa -.  Reinstalled it as a new Fitbit and it worked for me!  Finally fixed after 2 months of frustration!  Hope this helps and of course I had already updated my iOS and the Fitbit app.

Zero stars after update Apparently, text notifications only sync if the ‚Äòmessage preview‚Äô setting is turned to ‚Äòon‚Äô, on your phone. This is NOT a fix. I don‚Äôt want to use message preview for privacy reasons, I‚Äôve never had preview turned on before and don‚Äôt plan on using it now. Please change this back to how it used to be before the update. I love my Fitbit and have used for several years, but this is so frustrating! I don‚Äôt want to switch brands, but this watch is useless without notifications. Been using Fitbit for years and tried everything else!  Nothing works like a Fitbit! Love the community and being able to do challenges with friends! I love FitBit! This is my most used app by far. It helps track so many different things! Not syncing correctly? Since the last 2 updates, it‚Äôs got a lot of bugs. author_name: h a n n a h b a n a n a
review_body: Mostly good but still needs tweaking Everything is good besides the fact that I have a charge 3 and sometimes when I try to sync my Fitbit it doesn‚Äôt have the line across the top it just says syncing and refreshing. Effective. My Fitbit Zip has proved to be the most effective & accurate way I‚Äôve found to keep track of the calories I burn each day.

How many key strokes to set an alarm?? Why remove he plus sign on the home screen used to easily set an alarm?? Fit bit fantastic!! I use the app with ease. Everything is easy to find and understand. The best part of the app is the sleep tracker. I‚Äôm able to monitor how much sleep I get per night. Awful Cannot get help when you need it, Messaging is impossible, you don't know if you sent it or what it said, Limited words, you cannot invite friends to challenges if you have more than a few hundred, it will not bring them up, this app is incredibly flawed and none of their updates fix anything.
