Best version out there I have always been wanting to know how many steps I take in a day, how many calories I eat at a meal and how many calories I burn. But when I got the Fitbit, I was amazed on how it had everything else! Workouts,relaxing hours, heart beat,coaching,etc. and now I‚Äôm in love! Especially with my version ‚ù§Ô∏è

Login I‚Äôve had my Fitbit for almost two years and now all of a sudden it won‚Äôt load on my iPad. It gives an error of 1006 I also got my grandson the new one Fitbit 3 and he can‚Äôt even use it because of that error. Now Fitbit needs to do something about this. I was really enjoying it until that error happened. It says cloudflare  is what blocked me. So when is Fitbit going to fix this. Unhappy customer.

Love my Fitbit! Absolutely love my Fitbit and the corresponding app! I have been a long time Fitbit user and as a very active woman, I would be lost without it. It is absolutely perfect for tracking all things health and fitness, as well as keeping yourself accountable. It is much more accurate than the Apple Watch and I am honestly obsessed!

Keeps getting worse with every update I have the Charge 3 and it worked great AT FIRST. Now it won‚Äôt sync or will sync and the next time I check my phone the steps are back to zero. I just did the latest update, synced my Fitbit, and now my Fitbit says I have no steps BUT I have met the hourly 250 steps per hour 10 of the 12 times today. How is that possible?!! Fitbit STILL not syncing to my phone and now the notifications aren‚Äôt working. This is my fifth Fitbit (loved my other Fitbits) and probably my last!  Frustrated and disappointed!!

It‚Äôs been on my arm for couple of years! The only time I take it off is before showering. I love the fact that it tracks my sleep, heart rate, distance walked but so much more that I don‚Äôt use. The sleep tracker is amazing by knowing not only how long but the different sleep stages. I also love the tips! I would be lost without my Fitbit Alta HR!!

Keeping it real I have ‚Äúevolved‚Äù through FITBIT models from the small LED indicators, flex, alta and now Charge 3.  Adding new device to my account? Easy. Changing my WALGREENS and SPARKPEOPLE affiliations to my new device(s)? Easy.  Love the dashboards in my PC and mobile devices. Love setting goals and community challenges. Worth looking into if you want to set and improve health goals.

Fitbit rating I have enjoyed having my Fitbit very much! It helps me pay better attention to the level of exercise I have or haven‚Äôt done. Therefore, I am working harder to improve on things I didn‚Äôt realize I‚Äôve been lacking. Also like the sleep schedule it shows and all the tips!

Easy way to track I really like this app as it gives me a more realistic tracking of my activity each day as well as my calories. I don‚Äôt understand however why I start the day with several hundred calories, before even consuming anything. But overall it has helped me more conscious of the need to move each day.

Great motivator but issues with family account I already walked a lot but my Fitbit motivated me not to skip any days, so even on rainy days I‚Äôll go to the gym instead of my usual runs. I just bought an Ace for my child and created a family account, but every time I try to ‚Äúswitch to kid‚Äôs view‚Äù the app kicks me out, I have to log back in, and the same thing happens.

Greatest WATCH BLAZE I really like this Blaze Fitbit . I where It always and it‚Äôs my favorite pedometer and works flawlessly. I‚Äôve had it for over two years and the battery seems to last forever. I only have to charge it every two to three days. I never run out of music between my phone and my Fitbit Blaze Watch. Thank you FITBIT.

Fitbit I love knowing how many calories I eat and burn. I use the LoseIt app to track my calories and Fitbit pulls that data in so I know if I‚Äôm eating more or less than I‚Äôm burning. I also live the tracking feature in exercise so I can see where GPS says I have been and the distance of my hike. Just love everything about it.

Glitches Jan 1 my husband purchased the Charge 3, me, the Versa Special Edition. The first 3 days both ours were able to connect to the app well in all areas. A week into it, my husband‚Äôs would not sync to record his sleep. Now, a week later, mine won‚Äôt. This morning, it took approximately 30-40 min before my husband‚Äôs would sync with the app at all. Sleep not recorded for either of us at all.

Super easy to use It was easy to set up and it's really easy to use. The app is great for keeping track of calories, water intake, and minutes of activity. Spin cycle is my cardio preference and it converts my workout to steps taken. I recommend Fitbit to help you get your motivation back or help you get over a plateau.

Mostly great; having to re-sign in is a pain Love Fitbit and the app is mostly great. Every few months (3? 6? 10? Idk) I have to re-sign in after not having had to for ages, so I‚Äôm often re-setting my password when that happens, which is annoying. If it‚Äôs still on my phone why do I need to sign in again? Nothing else seems to work that way...

Motivator! I love my Fitbit. This is my 3rd in several years! I had the Charge, Alta and now the Versa smartwatch. I love that it reminds me to get my steps in and the newest Versa is amazing. I do a lot of my daily exercise in water aerobics and I love that I can now track my workout in the water!  My husband has the same Fitbits and loves his also. Never without it!!

author_name: no name all mine are taken
review_body: Keeps me on track I use Fitbit for a number of things.
Fitbit 1. Fitbit has to be manually synced at least 2 times a week.  I have called Fitbit MANY times.  They are aware of the problem, but their techies are incapable of fixing it.

Love it Works great with the Versa and Charge 2. Could improve a bit with the family set up?? The Ace is fine, but I wish I could have set up my old Charge for my daughter Instead of having to buy her an Ace?? But other than that, it connects easy and don‚Äôt have any issues tracking.

Luv My FitBit I have been working out for 2 years and have lost 40 lbs.  now that I have my Fitbit I can tackle the next 20 lbs. I luv that it tells me my sleep patterns / my step counter is a great motivator to move/ challenges push me forward.  I love it and now this tool will help me reach my goals providing me the data to analyze my workouts.

Off to a great start! I am really enjoying my Fitbit! I gave this a 4 star rating, I am sure it can do more than I am aware of. Earned a few badges. I work 3rd shift so I enjoy tracking my sleep pattern. Also the tracking of my steps helps this gal get up to improve or gain extra steps each day. Now I can see where I need to hold myself accountable. The tracking helps me most.

Cannot sync to either my fitness pal or chronometer I pretty much have loved this app and my Fitbit. Until it was updated. Now I hate it. It will not sync with any of my other apps. I have tried everything. I think you just fixed something that wasn‚Äôt broken. And I failed see any difference in the update. I can just throw away my Fitbit now.

Nice app I like this app and my Fitbit. My only hope is the new update fixes my sync issues. I cannot get it to vibrate for messages or calls and only half of the time it works for my alarms. It would also be nice to title the alarms. I‚Äôm a teacher and send kids to different classes at different times so it would be nice to put a label on  them. Other than that I love it.

What about breastfeeding moms? I absolutely love this app. However, I believe that the calories in and calories out feature need to be adjusted for breastfeeding moms! I know there are a small percentage of us out here, in Fitbit land, but this is something that needs to be taken very seriously by the developers. You have a HUGE, UNTAPPED market, run with it!!! I would definitely love to see some more breastfeeding features included with the fit it and the app!

New update The new update messed with my saved walks. It shows the wrong picture of where I walked. I have to select that exercise then is shows the correct one. Not sure what happened. I restarted the app already.
Don‚Äôt fix it if it‚Äôs not broken! Update: Now that the food log issue has been resolved, this is definitely a 5 Star app once again.

Period tracking could use some work I love my Fitbit and the app. I have only one complaint. The menstrual cycle tracking is too restrictive. It seems to me it is tailored to work for women who have normal cycles. For instance, it only allows you to record a period that lasts 10 days or less. It would be more helpful if it were able to accommodate irregularities. If you have normal cycles what‚Äôs the need for the tracking function?

Problems with sync and battery charging I keep running into huge problems getting the app to sync with the device even when I am at home with strong Wifi. I also have problems with the battery charger. I am very careful to insert it in the charger just right with battery charging signal showing on the device but half the time I go to put it back on and it hasn‚Äôt charged at all.

‚ÄúTurning into FB‚Äù There is so many people trying become ‚Äúfriends‚Äù with other users that don‚Äôt want to. The reasons are because some of them are trying to ‚Äúhook up‚Äù with people. They have no activity on their page. FITBIT, One thing please update the app so I don‚Äôt have to block many people each day. One user even took this case further because it was getting to the point that no one can handle it anymore. Go read the FITBIT DEVELOPER group and you will see what every user is going through at this moment.

Great app from an exercise physiologist The Fitbit measures all the important data to maintain and improve your fitness, lose weight and improve overall health. Tracking of resting heart rate and exercising heart rates is critical to health. Fitbit is the answer to losing weight and improving fitness with all the tools available on select models.  I highly recommend Fitbit!

Love Just bought the Fitbit Charge2, and completely love it! My only complaint so far: sometimes it won't track my steps unless I'm swinging that arm. Other than that, it was well explained and easy to set up, the app is wonderfully compatible and interactive, and it is overall a wonderful device!

Waiting for healthkit like..... ‚ò†Ô∏è Until Fitbit makes a move to integrate with apple healthkit, it will never be a fully featured app. It doesn't feel native. Things like Logging water should be a feature available in a widget too.

Some improvements would be nice Overall I like the app I just wish it had some more customization abilities. When it comes to adding in how many stairs I‚Äôve done or steps I‚Äôve taken I‚Äôd like to be able to put that stuff in myself if I forget to put my Fitbit on for half the day. I‚Äôm still trying to figure out how people sleep with this thing on too, is there a feature to just lay in under my pillow?

Unable to Sync Error For the last 24 hours or so I‚Äôm getting a persistent error that the device is unable to sync which is draining device battery because it keeps trying. It actually is syncing, but not smoothly. The data tracking is buggy and I have to close and reopen the app for it to update correctly. I‚Äôve tried troubleshooting on my end and this problem is not due to my own hardware. There‚Äôs a bug in the software or it‚Äôs poorly interfacing with the current iOS revision.

Good app but must restart phone regularly I really like the Fitbit app as it provides good records of my daily activities and useful graphics. Unfortunately syncing fails ‚Äî stops working ‚Äî every few days and I must power off my iPhone 11 and turn it back on again to get syncing to work! Recommending the app anyway but this issue is annoying, at best.

Trash Loved my Charge3 for the last year, worked great... then I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs the updates in the app or a lack of a firmware update for the tracker, issues with Apple, or more likely all of the above, but it no longer syncs, there is no Bluetooth connection, thus no notifications, and now I can‚Äôt even log into the app. Contact customer support? They say ‚Äúit‚Äôs a known issue, we‚Äôll add your issue to our list‚Äù. Which is what they‚Äôve been saying for the last several months... and no fix? Really?! Beyond disappointed.

App I have to delete my app and reinstall it each time I try to upload my family- sons account who has a Fitbit ace 2. I mean I this happened multiple times a day. Why? What changed all of a sudden? Makes it very frustrating when trying to load his steps for our family challenges. When it is working more than half the time it says it can‚Äôt find his device. Common Fitbit, let‚Äôs fix these bugs and make this more user friendly.

sync issues; also useless ‚Äúsleep score‚Äù Why do I have to pull the screen down many many multiple times to get the darn thing to sync? Very frustrating. I either get nothing or the red ‚Äúfailed‚Äù progress bar before finally it grabs on and does it.

Not a smart investment I've had several fitbits since they were first released. This last update is taking way too long to resolve our issues, especially being that there are those of us who need the text notification on our watches due to restricted phone usage, etc. Apparently the company didn't do their due diligence before selling themselves out to Google. If so, they would've realized how many products,etc Google has taken over and are now either non existent, or straight garbage. Great job!!

Make the sleep score optional! My Charge 2 wont tell me how many hours of sleep I get anymore. Rather it comes up with an odd rating of my sleep that is based on a mix of factors that they don‚Äôt share. So every morning when I sync I get treated to a judgment of my sleep, something like ‚ÄúFair‚Äù or ‚ÄúPoor‚Äù when I feel like I‚Äôve done ok. Despite over 1,000 comments on a fitbit users thread, the company won‚Äôt change the software to make this dubious and inaccurate sleep judgment optional!

I used to love Fitbit. I‚Äôm now on my fourth Fitbit model and have loved this brand/app for many years. Now my Fitbit Versa is just a fancy watch that sometimes notifies me of text messages and tracks my heart rate. It rarely tracks my steps properly, and I‚Äôm forced to be graded on my sleep which is absolutely pointless. It makes me feel even more horrible in the morning to see I FAILED at sleep. Who at Fitbit thought it was a good idea to have people wake up to such a thing?  If I wanted my sleep to be GRADED I‚Äôd ask for that. No one asked to have that added pressure.

Suggestion Can we have an option where we turn off notifications for posts we have previously commented?  I don‚Äôt want to see a notification for each time someone who commented on a person‚Äôs post. I don‚Äôt want to check my inbox in the fitbit app only to see so-and-so commented on blah‚Äôs post. It‚Äôs getting really annoying and unnecessary.

STILL not working after update Why did I ever update this app?!? Now it doesn‚Äôt work on my phone. It just keeps crashing. What kind of crap update is that?!? Please fix the app so it can be updated and useable again. And next time ask folks before you go ‚Äúimproving‚Äù things again. Just from reading the reviews I can already tell that if and when I can ever get the app to work on my phone again I‚Äôm gonna be super disappointed with the changes that have been made. It‚Äôs a shame I can‚Äôt rate with a ZERO stars.

Fitbit is great!! I got an alta for my b-day about 2 years ago and i love it! The only 2 times i take it off are for charging and swimming. I love the watch but it isn‚Äôt very accurate but that doesn‚Äôt really matter to me. Please add the feature to make custom clock faces for your fitbit, and make the feature compatible with alta!

New Dashboard is Trash I used to love interacting with the app but after the update to the new dashboard every time I check the app I become very annoyed. I will be returning the Fitbit even though it‚Äôs great device the new dashboard is the worst and I‚Äôve minimized my interactions with the app so it‚Äôs not worth it to keep the device since the app has become terrible. I was desperately looking online for signs that the dashboard would revert back but it seems like it will stay with the new terrible update so I‚Äôll have to return it at this point.

Please change it back! I use my fitbit to count my steps and as an alarm to wake me up so those were the only two things I look at on the app. This latest update is not one I like at all. I don't like the look of it and I don't like finding where I tap to see if I need to recharge it or want to change my alarm setting. What was wrong with the way it was? I was perfectly happy with it. Now not so much üòï

This app needs work! I can‚Äôt switch back and forth from parent view to kid view without having to delete and reinstall the app every single time. I am very disappointed with the Fitbit technology to begin with (since I was told by the support team that I just need to wait until the technology listed on the box actually works and they are aware of the Bluetooth problems), but I can‚Äôt even see my kid‚Äôs information from his Fitbit Ace without a hassle either. If the technology isn‚Äôt ready, then don‚Äôt release it.

Unhappy with Updates I liked the Fitbit app a lot, but then they updated it and now I just hate the new dashboard design. It‚Äôs so ugly and harder to navigate. New isn‚Äôt always better! Please, please give us an option in the app to switch back to using the old dashboard. That can‚Äôt be too much to ask, surely? We already have the option to change the clock display on devices like the Fitbit Blaze, so why not give us the option to change this too?

Lost Fitbit I ABSOLUTELY LOVE my Fitbit BUT... then I lost it... and then I bought a Fitbit finder app and found it... and then I lost it... and then again found it... BUT lost it again on an active day. The factory Fitbit bracelets are awesome until you Fitbit falls out of it not once but twice and then a third time. My heart is sinking. I want my Fitbit but don‚Äôt want to have that loss again. Sooo, I will continue my steps alone. üò• Love you Fitbit and hopefully, we reunite again but I don‚Äôt feel it is in our future. Sooo, this where I say goodbye, Farewell.... so long my friend ... I will never forget you.

Love my Fitbit Charge 3 This Fitbit watch does it all. I got it for Christmas and haven‚Äôt taken it off except to charge. The iPhone app keeps track of all my walking, food, water, calories, sleep weight loss and so much more. I don‚Äôt know what I did without it, it‚Äôs my BFF. If you don‚Äôt have a Charge 3, get one now. Best thing EVER.  Great price too!!!

Flawless performance I have had my Fitbit and it has been connected to the app for6 months and it has worked well. Through the use of my Fitbit tracking on the app, I have worked hard and have lost 20 pounds. I enjoy the community feature of the app also.

Fitbit App This is an excellent app for tracking food intake, calories burned, sleep amount and quality of sleep, steps taken etc. When extra help is needed many answers can be found online.  When I needed to talk to a human the advice was clear and and the person was perfectly patient.

Fitbit Love this app!!! I used to gain 10/15 lbs every winter but ever since getting my Fitbit and keeping track of my food and exercise daily on this app that no longer happens. I‚Äôve had my Fitbit for 4 years and I will never stop wearing it or keeping track of my calories/activity. Best purchase I‚Äôve made in years!

So happy to have a Fitbit I enjoy my Fitbit a lot. One thing that bothers me is trying to get it to charge. For some reason it‚Äôs hard for me to align the prongs with the back of the watch. Also, I wish bootcamp and elliptical were options already programmed on the watch but besides that I have no other complaints.

Great but I wish it could do more things This is a great app. And I love it. I wish it could do more things such as give you reminders when to drink more water, if you are trying to. There are some other things that I wish it could do, but other than that it is a wonderful app.

Still my best fitness app to date Since the glitch was fixed, I've enjoyed the fitbit versa and particularly like that it can pick up on the fact that you're walking as exercise (though it didn't work on my 15 min jog this morning). I like that I can track my monthly cycle amongst other things in it, looking forward to other innovations.

New Fitbit open message is real annoying The latest upgrade gives us a new ‚Äòfeature.‚Äô When you open the Fitbit app to sync and then shut down the app you get this new message upon closing: ‚ÄòOpen Fitbit  to keep your data synchronized.‚Äô Who thought this was a good idea? I am sure it has something to do with location tracking etc...I don‚Äôt care. I rarely write reviews but was compelled to write about this.  Give us the option to suppress please.

Love Fitbit I have 2 Fitbit models and my husband has one also. We follow a weight loss program and love that their app syncs with our Fitbit to help us track our activity. We have the Charge 3, Alta, One and the Aria scale. We‚Äôve never had any issues with any of them. They‚Äôre easy to use just a great tool to help us get healthier.

Syncing reminders on exit Love my Fitbit charge 2 but the latest app update is annoying. I close my apps regularly. I don‚Äôt need a reminder every time I try to close the app. It keeps saying keep open to sync. I can sync when I want but don‚Äôt need a reminder every time.  Also would like a feature to Only get reminders when using app not all the time!! Guess I‚Äôll turn notifications off.

Keeps Me Moving I love my Fit Bit Charge 2. I find myself now very aware of getting up and moving! I also love the fact that it syncs with my Weight Watchers app and tallies my activities and steps for the day. I also find that I am more aware of getting my daily water intake completed. It‚Äôs a huge thumbs up for me!!

Water consumption change When it works it‚Äôs great. When... The most unstable app of all smart watches. Just doesn‚Äôt work well, consistently stops recording steps. Constantly have to delete it & reload to get it to work. Two days of deleting Bluetooth ionic connection, deleting app & reloading... all the tricks to get app to sync to ionic. Been like this since I got ionic (replaced once too). Bigger question, ‚ÄúWhy doesn‚Äôt Fitbit fix this? Why are we expected to get inferior service as consumers?‚Äù

It‚Äôs great I‚Äôm really enjoying the Fitbit. It‚Äôs awesome it motivates me to get my steps in for the day. the only thing that I don‚Äôt really like is when you‚Äôre in a challenge and you have to wait on the other person to sync in order to see where they‚Äôre at with their steps. I think It should do an automatic sync every 30 minutes or something.

Love it! I‚Äôve been a dedicated fitbit user for the last 2 years. It‚Äôs one of the best tools I use for my health. I‚Äôm a runner, HIIT trainer and yoga novice. I use it to gauge my effort and calories burned. My only complaint is I wish we could go smaller rather than bigger on the watches. I‚Äôm a Charge 2 user but I wish the same features came in the alta.

Will never leave Fitbit! One of my most used apps! Been w Fitbit since their first fitness wristband and would never consider leaving! I have the Versa now and it‚Äôs such an amazing little fitness tool with a much longer battery life than the Apple Watch. I enjoy the community more than Apple fit as well!

Does What I need to do. I like to sleep tracker. I didn‚Äôt realize I was not getting as much sleep as I thought. The heart monitor is great. I like that I can track all the steps I take while I‚Äôm playing with my kids. I usually leave my phone on the fireplace mantle so it was never tracking any movement when playing.

Could be excellent if... It won‚Äôt let me back track to make food entries if I don‚Äôt do it before midnight.  If I do, it makes the entry the same for the next day.  If I try to back track and make entries, the same thing happens.  Also, too many foods made up by other people who are trying to make up it cheat on their daily intake mixed in with real calorie counts.

GREAT MOTIVATION This app is a great motivation to stay focused on your health goals particularly with staying on the move throughout the day. It provides hourly reminders throughout the work day to get and move if you‚Äôve been behind your desk a little too long. The Fitbit friends challenge is super fun and competitive way to motivate each other!

All good on watch,l app spins I‚Äôm a soccer referee. Yesterday with a charge 3 I press exercise and run. Watch says cannot find, open app. So I hurry get phone back out of bag and open app thinking ok, but app is spinning. I look at watch and it still says cannot find. I had already put watch up & have to go on with the match. I get back to my bag and I have 1% battery. I shut app down. Not good

Keeps me on track and avoid surprises I love using the app for my sleep, overall steps, and period tracking! Hours slept helps me gage what amount I truly need to feel energized. Steps - keeps me moving to meet my step and fitness goal. Period tracker helps me avoid surprises especially when planning future events.

App is working great again! So glad the food-logging bug was fixed! The app works great again. I‚Äôve been using it religiously to log food intake, exercise, etc... by doing so, I was able to lose 20 pounds in 5 months, and get in much better shape.

Love it!! It‚Äôs easy to use and keeps me motivated. It helps me push myself to go a little further and choose my snacks more carefully. One improvement I‚Äôd like to see is an addition of new challenges. Some new trails in other parts of the country would be really nice. Aside from that this is my favorite weight loss app!!!

Happy but unhappy I love my Fitbit, but lately I have been having issues with active minutes. For example, today I walked for 21 minutes which showed on my watch, but when I opened the app it showed 13 minutes which is what my watch now shows.  I also have a problem with it accurately keeping up with the number of stairs I climb each day. I hope this issue is resolved soon.

Still learning Have been using my Ionic for about 2 months and I‚Äôm still learning where things are. I can say the movements aren‚Äôt very fluid. More of a choppy feel. Often the touchscreen registers a touch but doesn‚Äôt do anything so I repeat step functions. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, it does everything I need very well, but for the minor operations I do the ionic should do them smoother.

Charger HR This is a wonderful fitness wearable. It allows you to stay totally connected throughout the day on what you are trying to achieve.  On top of everything else is that it was easy to set up and start using it.

Good app It has many nice features. My only complaint is it would be nice if the app actually tracked both sides of the messages. It only shows the messages you receive, it does not show my responses. Kind of weird, especially if you‚Äôre like me and sometimes forget if you responded to a message.  Overall, a good app that I would recommend.

Change Charge 3 I have relied on Fitbit for years. It helps me keep track of all my key health factors except calorie intake. Get your smart guys to figure out how to do that for me. But my real irritant is Charge 3. I used to be able to rearrange the readings on my Fitbit but Charge 3 won‚Äôt let me do that. And I want to get rid of a bunch of info it displays that I don‚Äôt care about. I have a cell phone for messages. I don‚Äôt need or want my watch doing that.

Part of my everyday life! I use this app every single day and it has helped me to develop positive habits. I bought it for the step count but quickly started Tracking the quality of my sleep. Now I am using the water tracker and I recently purchased the connected scale. Love love love and highly recommend.
Record My Steps I am between 3 & 4 stars.  It does record my Steps well.

Five years and counting I‚Äôve been a fan of counting steps, tracking weight, and what you eat for years. Great to have it in one easy to use app. Love that it sync‚Äôs with a number of my other tracking devices and app. Hate that they did away with the One tracker. Hope they bring it back.

Almost 5 stars, just one problem!!!!! The app is incredibly user friendly and very functional my only complaint is that sexual inter course doesn‚Äôt count as an exercise nor does kissing. However driving and shooting do. Seriously you mean to tell me that you have more people listing shooting as an exercise than would list sex. Somehow I doubt that.

Not accurate at all I wouldn‚Äôt recommend this app or the watch. I walked on the treadmill for 45 minutes and did 2.88 miles with my watch on, yet according to the app it says I only walked for 30 minutes and completed only 0.2 miles. When it comes to the steps, I‚Äôll take let‚Äôs say 10 steps and it will only record 5. While on the treadmill I watch the tracker like a hawk and there are a lot of times that the number of steps don‚Äôt change yet I‚Äôm still walking. Maybe I have a dud, I don‚Äôt know... but I don‚Äôt recommend it.

Loved my Fitbit but... Loved my Fitbit but was given an Apple Watch as a Christmas gift. Really wish there was an app where I could use my Apple Watch to still compete with my family and friends who have Fitbits. I would be willing to pay for the app and I know others that would as well. Please consider it!

Great Motivation I purchased the Fitbit so I could track my steps and with the app I can track a lot more than that. I track my workouts and see how many minutes my heart rate is in cardio level or fat burn. I track my sleep at night. So far this is great and a great motivator to continue to keep moving

Love it! So far so good.. I love that it‚Äôs slim and comfortable. I‚Äôve had this charge last for almost 5 days and I have been wearing it constantly. Sometimes it takes a moment for the app to sync but that‚Äôs to be expected. I also love the bands are interchangeable.. perfect for those who don‚Äôt want one of the bigger ones

Unacceptable Ever since weeks app takes about half an hour to sync with the fit bit and constantly freezes!!! First I thought it‚Äôll be late on an update and it‚Äôll be fixed...it has been about 2 months and it‚Äôs still not working correctly! The watch is awesome but the app is lacking functionality. And now after the recent update it says device not connected to device and to turn on the Bluetooth, while the Bluetooth is on and the app is not connecting to the device .

Used to be great...until update My Fitbit and app worked great until  a recent update. Now it won't give me any minutes of exercise for auto detected exercise on the individual listing. Won‚Äôt Connect Anymore!! I‚Äôve had this app and a Fitbit off and on for years. For weeks now, my Charge to will not connect to the app. It just continually says, ‚ÄúSearching‚Äù I‚Äôve tried literally everything. I even contacted Fitbit via Twitter and did get several responses and attempts to help me, nothing. I‚Äôm unable to track my sleep and use the benefits of owning a Fitbit. I‚Äôm still wearing my Charge 2 to track my steps, but that‚Äôs it. I‚Äôm VERY disappointed and at a loss now. I had high hopes with the most recent update... nothing helped.

Just a few suggestions The app is pretty useful, it would be really nice if you could customize the food log ( ex: if you were vegetarian or vegan) and if it occasionally gave you meal suggestions. Also, the female tracking should be updated( like giving us more symptoms to choose from and an easier way of logging the dates)

Not compatible with newest iPhones I recently upgraded to the XR, and have noticed neither mine or my husband‚Äôs watches/phones have been syncing notifications. Please update for more range of compatibility. Apple watches are becoming more and more attractive with how little FitBit seems to be evolving. No new major updates or changes to allow personalization from one person to the next, and clearly no updates on bugs newer iPhone models seem to be having.

Helps me stay on track The Fitbit app came along at a time I was trying to take better control of my health.  I love that I can compact calories burned with calories consumed.   Tracking food intake was a bit cumbersome at first but gets easier.  I also track my sleep to help me be better rested.

Fitbit app is awesome I like the display summary screen and the way you can drill into the information and see numbers and graphs over various periods of time. I always recommend friends who use Fitbit to use this app. I also love the friend app where you can compete for most steps and communicate
Very informative! App really provides insight to my daily activity level, heart rate and sleep. Love it!

Motivation to move I‚Äôve enjoyed my fit bit surge for several years.  The watch and scales tell me truth (even when wish not to know it).  However, they serve to motivate me to move and it has been a constant companion. The app has many great options to utilize.
FitBit A whole lot of fun to measure steps and connect with family and friends doing the same thing.

Altra HR I have had a Altra for the past year and have really enjoyed it.  When I saw the specials on Black Friday where the HR was offer at a special price I purchased one immediately.  I  have checked the pulse rate against a professionally machine and found it to be very accurate.  Like the newer style band.  The software is easy to use.

The Motivation I Needed I bought a Fitbit and have been using the app to see what the Fitbit can tell me about my healthy or not so healthy habits. The most important thing to me was to see the sleep tracking. With the info I get, I now know that I need to set a bedtime and stick to it. Otherwise I don‚Äôt get restorative sleep.

Annoyed This app could be much better. I got my Fitbit for Christmas and it worked great up until about a week ago. The app counts my steps and my active minutes but does not count my active minutes on the treadmill as exercise anymore. I never had this problem until the last seven days. When I manually log my walk as exercise the app then proceeds to delete my active minutes and steps from the walk!!! So annoying!!!

Need macronutrients to show in grams, too This app is great! I love the features and I haven‚Äôt had any issues with it, but I can‚Äôt track my macronutrients in grams on the app. It just shows percentages. This is helpful, but please add the ability to see macronutrient stats in grams. Other apps have this, but I don‚Äôt want to switch over just for that reason alone.

Works great when it syncs properly... I keep having periods of a week or more randomly that refuse to sync. So I just have massive gaps of 0s. NOT helpful for trying to track steps, which is my primary use of this app. I have tried uninstalling, resyncing repeatedly, even creating a new account. I‚Äôve been having this problem for a year now and no bug fixes have addressed it. My steps are all in my Health app but somehow can‚Äôt make it to the Fitbit app? I don‚Äôt understand.

Not impressed Ok just gotten my Fitbit blaze a week ago. And so far it won‚Äôt send messages to my Fitbit that I get on my phone and the step counter goes up when I‚Äôm not doing anything at all, Not even moving. Even goes up when I‚Äôm driving. So it‚Äôs really not doing me any good but to keep time and see emails.  I really wanted to love my Fitbit blaze but I‚Äôm not. I can‚Äôt even find my receipt to return it. Please tell me there is some improvements and that I didn‚Äôt just waste money.

author_name: i seem to be a verb
review_body: Fitbit doesn‚Äôt sync with health app ThIs is a huge oversight and until it is resolved there‚Äôs no reason I can see for an apple owner to buy a fitbit. Don‚Äôt waste your money

Used to be great, until recent update After recent update, it no longer auto tracks exercise. There‚Äôs no way to manually enter it while still keeping your step count accurate. For example, if I take an hour long walk, it counts my steps, but does not log it as exercise. If I try to manually enter the walk, it will increase my step count. Tried to contact customer service, but have not received a response. It‚Äôs so frustrating. Why fix what ain‚Äôt broke? The app was great until the update.
Great app but... I like the Fitbit app but it does not allow you to edit incorrect data, clear daily logs in the event you have errors. And I see users have been asking for that feature since 2014.

It‚Äôs OK when it actually works properly But the app regularly bombs on food logging - some things you will see entered for 2-3 seconds before they simply disappear, others change to something else (i.e. I have tried to enter my morning yogurt 4 times, able to select from the menu fine, however once it saves the log reports it as an ice cream sundae instead).

Not good since recent update! Since the recent update I have been on able to get notifications on my Charge 2. I have followed all of the instructions to reset them and done the steps multiple times and still to no avail. I know this issue is not just mine, because I have two relatives with this same problem, both with a Charge 2 and iPhone 7. Not a happy camper.

App logs you out, won't let you log back in Almost every day now since the update, the application has been giving me regular push notifications, however each time I open the app, it tells me that I need to log in. The irritating part is that half of the time (like for the past day, for instance), it tells me there is an error where I can't log in. Not the incorrect password error, but a completely different one that is telling me there is something wrong with the network.
App is good but Bluetooth will not work after system upgrade Very good app.

Unreliable I have had the app/a fitbit on and off for about 3 years. The app works pretty well until it just stops. Then you have to begin the process of uninstalling and reinstalling the app until it will sync with the Fitbit again. There are also multiple bugs, such as ‚Äúlosing days‚Äù if you get your 10,000 steps after midnight (working the 7pm-7am shift at the hospital this happens a lot), or losing all data when updates are installed.

Garbage This app is total garbage. drains your battery and it constantly glitching out. ‚ÄúContact customer support‚Äù feature doesn‚Äôt work, impossible to find help with issues. Their help forum is crap too. Takes forever to load, and good luck if you want to actually track your sleep. Heart rate doesn‚Äôt calculate correctly or even close when there is sweat on you. I‚Äôve had two fit bits that have conveniently broke a month or two after their one year grace period or warranty is up. Over this product.

Do you even lift? I don‚Äôt mind that my Alta HR doesn‚Äôt automatically pick up that I‚Äôm lifting weights. But Fitbit could take a cue from Jawbone that had a stopwatch feature that could be activated through the app to time an activity, any activity, that can be manually labeled later. The only reason I switched to Fitbit is because my Jawbone broke and the company went under. Otherwise, Fitbit would never have my business as Jawbone was much more user friendly for lifters.

Very Functional for Tracking activity Just getting started using the Fitbit app. I‚Äôm finding it very easy to navigate around. So far I haven‚Äôt even had to use the manual. It lets me keep up with everything pertaining to my weight loss journey. The only reason I didn‚Äôt give it a 5 Star is that I really would like it to work with my Apple Watch.

There‚Äôs no way for me to add friends The whole point of my boyfriend and I buying a Fitbit was so we could link up on the app and help keep track and encourage each other to exericise and be able to compete. But someone there‚Äôs no way for me to add him. It doesn‚Äôt pull him from my contacts - in fact it shows me only my contacts who are not on Fitbit which makes me think something is wrong with the app. I can‚Äôt add him through email either and it won‚Äôt connect to Facebook. Can someone please help me?

Great if You Don't Want to Sync *any* Music Seriously? Pandora starts syncing for about 3 seconds before ceasing the transfer and saying "no stations". Deezer does the same. Music from my computer (Mac) syncs playlists, but only after I spend 20 minutes screwing around toggling Bluetooth on and off again on my phone. If you do the hokey pokey and catch the right breeze, you may be able to sync a playlist. This is a core feature. Try to fix it.

Frustrated I love my Fitbit but hate that I do not get anymore text notifications. It bugs me that I can get reminders for other apps but not my texts. When is this issue going to be resolved. I have at five other friends that are having the same issue and two that are not. How can this be. So frustrating!

Needs macro goal setting I like that you can now track calorie and macro intake with the scanner. I actually use it more now. Just needs to be able to track protein, fat, and carbs in goal form like it does with the calories in order to receive the 5 stars from me. And a body fat percentage calculator/ tracker with caliper method would be a huge plus!

Active Call Notification I really like this app and the only issue that I‚Äôve had came after the last update. After the update, I get consistent ‚Äòactive call‚Äô notifications throughout the phone call. Prior to the update I would only get one notification  when the call was connected.

No notifications Used to love this app and the Fitbit Charge 3. Bought it about a year ago and it worked fine until about a couple of months ago when Apple updated their operating system. Then I stopped getting text message notifications. And just recently all notifications. I‚Äôve tried all their fixes to no avail. Very frustrating. Hope they fix this soon. Don‚Äôt waste your money on this watch until you can verify they have fixed the issue.

4 stars, but stop with the ads. It's a fine app in the sense that it works (once you're able to get your Fitbit connected), but I already receive updates via email. I don't need to then see an ad for the latest and greats tracker once I've got the app open. I get it, you want me to upgrade (again) but please keep in mind we're already forking over $150+ for each tracker. I don't want/need to be informed every time you put out a new one.

Versa Lite Had developed a heart problem and needed to start tracking my heart rate and cardio zone.   Love it.  Only take off th charge and clean the band.  Also have sleep apnea.   Really like the sleep tracking.  All info is very helpful and very motivating.   If I notice I am close to my goal I get up and go walk around the block.

Feeling fleeced Fitbit is a smart watch primarily made for the health conscious. So pay hundreds of dollars for the watch, download the app and you‚Äôre set, right? Absolutely not. Fitbit expects more money to unlock much of the data your newly purchased watch collects. The poor rating isn‚Äôt because the app is terrible it‚Äôs because it is used to fleece their customers (you and me) out of more money. Do yourself a favor, do plenty of research and pick any  smart watch/ health tracker not named Fitbit.

This newest update caused my sleep tracker not to work right. The newest update for my Fitbit Versa has caused some kind of problem for the Sleep Tracker. It‚Äôs not showing the graphic chart. And doesn‚Äôt show that I slept in the Day part of the tracker either. In the year or so that I have had my Fitbit Versa, I have NEVER had problems with the Sleep Tracker. Only since this newest update has thus happened. I shutdown the Versa and turned it back on, so I‚Äôll see if this helped tomorrow sleep tracker, but either way thus needs to be fixed

Glitchy Just got a Versa 2. I like the product, but the app is way too glitchy to justify Fitbit premium. There are sync issues that caused me to miss calls, I only get a sleep score 25% of the time (says it couldn't get a consistent heart rate while sleeping almost every night), and there were app issues that prevented me from being able to even log into Fitbit coach. Fitbit support is very underwhelming and unhelpful.

The app is on my last nerve I love my FitBit but the app...ugh. Logs me out ALL the time and then when I try to log back in, it just keeps thinking and thinking. Total pain especially when I want to do challenges with friends or link to another app. Things like this are so frustrating. Like right now for example, it‚Äôs been trying to log me in for at least 8-10 minutes.

Sleep Score needs to be optional The Fitbit app is great for counting steps. I used to use it to keep track of my sleep as well but with a new update they make "sleep score" the main part of it. It's annoying not being able to shut it off. I struggle getting enough sleep and miraculously last night I got 8 hours and 59 minutes. Yet, my sleep score is a 78. Same score I got the day before with only 6 hours and 2 minutes of sleep. Sleep Score is terrible... find another app to count your steps

App doesn‚Äôt work. I cannot log in. The app throws an error ‚Äúoops something went wrong‚Äù as others have pointed out. If I hit ‚Äòforgot password‚Äô it can‚Äôt complete that and says to check connection. All other apps and browser work fine so the app is suspect. At that point the app freezes and doesn‚Äôt recover.

Great app It is a good app I have been using it for a little while and I never had a problem I have been using my charge 2 and charge hr however on th e new update at first I couldn‚Äôt find my way around cause I was use to the old update but after I bit I started getting use to it

Ionic in the trash! Update forced and now my app won‚Äôt open just crashes. At least it didn‚Äôt turn the ionic into a brick like the countless 1000s of others in the Fitbit community. AND Fitbit won‚Äôt fix their bug! Ionic in the trash and picking up Apple Watch tomorrow. Fitbit doesn‚Äôt listen to or take care of their customers.

Can‚Äôt update personal information I just received the charge 3 and I‚Äôm trying to update my birthday, height, weight, time zone, etc and it won‚Äôt update. Very frustrating! Please fix or tell me how to troubleshoot. UPDATE: chatted online with Marbel and she got it fixed immediately. Great support and loving Fitbit so far :)

Hate the new look Why did you change it??? It is hard to see things and now it‚Äôs not even pleasing to look at! Wish I would have seen the change before I replaced my Fitbit I would have NEVER stayed with Fitbit.  Trying to figure out the hours with 250 steps is next to impossible. This change is the worse thing you could have done and I would really like to understand why you felt it necessary to change something that was perfectly fine.

App not syncing I‚Äôve wasted the last three hours of my life in every forum and trying everything to get the app to sync with my tracker and to no avail, it‚Äôs not working. All of my hard work is in vain at this point and I‚Äôm ready to throw this Charge 3 in the trash. I have tried everything from deleting and reinstalling the app, turning Bluetooth off and on and evening logging on frm my laptop, phone and iPad and it still hasn‚Äôt synced. I‚Äôm going hiking this weekend and now I feel like I need to get an Apple Watch instead.

Great but one thing I love this it really works for me it‚Äôs great. Maybe a few bugs or a glitch but not to bad. The only thing is that I‚Äôm the preview it doesn‚Äôt look like that on mine but I don‚Äôt know if that‚Äôs just my phone or anything but it still works the same. I still love it!!!

V 2.95 - Steaming pile of dung They have just released a new version that nobody wanted with zero new features!  The update cannot be uninstalled either.  This redesign is so, buggy I cannot use my paired Bluetooth scale.  Every time I click on anything on the dashboard it loads my BT scale app.  Essentially rendering this version USELESS!  Way to beta test...

Recent update is trash While I overall love Fitbit, the most recent update is trash. Not only does my Fitbit no longer remain connected to my Bluetooth, it also doesn‚Äôt properly sync. The issue with the apps internal notifications being stuck has returned as well. I‚Äôve gone through the troubleshooting processes 5 times and am still dealing with waking up to find my Fitbit 30 mins to and hour behind because it no longer is connected or syncs. This is unreliable to say the least.

Not the best I‚Äôve had this watch for almost a year and I can‚Äôt wait to switch to a Garmin. The app won‚Äôt sync with the watch half the time, and ever since February the screen won‚Äôt always turn on when I move my wrist and it doesn‚Äôt always pick up on messages(which  is nice not having my wrist buzz). It‚Äôs great for people getting into fitness, but it‚Äôs performance is superb to what I had hoped for
Love my Fitbit Love tracking my steps everyday. Fitbit definitely keeps me on track to get my 5 miles in.

Love this app Fits my needs for tracking. The only thing is the food dairy. I wish I could customize meals by putting in all the ingredients and making it one saved meal. I make all my meals and rarely eat out so I have to put in the individual ingredients for each meal each time. Other than that I fully use this app and all of its resources.

Helps keep me motivated This app is awesome as far as keeping me accountable day to day. I look at the stats from today and compare them to the previous days to try and do better the next day. After seeing the weight graph dropping and the cardio fit scale increasing, this app is all I need.

Still annoying Great app for the most part. Still won't stop telling me to leave the app open to stay synchronized. Stop telling me every time I close the app!! If I want to leave the app open I will, or if I want to open the app and update on my own schedule I will. At least allow me to turn that specific notification off. Not the only one asking for this change.

Love this app! Game changer for keeping track of my exercise routine and more!  Love being able to track my steps, sleep and calories. Especially like the community friends connection. Even if you can‚Äôt see your friends, they can encourage and support your work!!

Great Product Products like Fitbit gives you so much information about the body, not to mention your sleep cycles. Before only professionals would be able to provide such detailed information. This product is a must have for all.

Burning battery power Started the day with 100% phone battery and by 1:00 pm it‚Äôs down to 34%. Looked at the battery usage and it showed that the Fitbit app used 37% running in the background. My phone battery is in excellent condition so that‚Äôs not a factor.
Excellent device but wristband not so much I love my Fitbit - excellent device that keeps me motivated to keep going!

Love it Great for keeping track of my workouts, overall activity and nutritional needs. Syncs with other apps to help with that as well. Only suggestion would be more options to select from the workout types. Such as hikes or sports from the exercise menu on the Fitbit. Overall awesome.

Almost perfect I absolutely my Fitbit and has it all the time! The only downsides that I see are that the syncing doesn‚Äôt always work. I can open the app and it says it has synced with my Fitbit, but the blue loading bar never shows up and my data isn‚Äôt been updated.

Options I wish there were options to add steps when you forget to put it on after charging,, for example,, steps counted from the health app on an iPhone,, I have lost a whole day several times due to my morning forgetfulness, just wish I could count those steps but other than that, I love my Fitbit

Inaccurate & low battery Frequently will not track performance even after it has been fully charged. It is inaccurate also as it underestimated calories burned when running and over estimates calories when walking . Needs frequent charging and when it says it‚Äôs fully charged still may not track your steps/calories  . It was a gift so I‚Äôm glad i didn‚Äôt waste my money on this product

Love my fitbit Flex I really love the fitbit flex and have been using it for more than 5 years now.  When I have had issues with my account the online help has been very responsive.  It‚Äôs wonderful  to be able to monitor sleep, steps, exercise, hydration, active minutes, and diet.

Keeping fit I love my Fitbit that I got as a gift a few years ago, I have since upgraded to a newer version. My friends and I are very competitive and we love challenging each other in the weekly and weekend steps. It‚Äôs very user friendly and I never had any issues.

Definitely recommend I‚Äôve been using this app for a couple years now, I love being able to see my daily progress. They‚Äôve made a few improvements to the app along the way. Don‚Äôt go a day without using my fit bit

Needs improvements. My Fitbit charge HR still works great after about 3 years (give it take). But the app has so many issues. Nothing ever loads once I first open the app. I have to open and close the app 8 times (literally) before anything loads, on or off WiFi. And they took away the New York challenges??? They said they were going to be adding more, yet took away the best ones. Now there is only three which are fine, but get boring after the first time around. Please design more challenges.

I love Fitbit I‚Äôve had a Fitbit since the zip first came out. I use the Charge 2 now. I wear it every day & love to see my steps, sleep, exercise, & heart rate. I enjoy doing the challenges with friends & also being able to post exciting events to share. I‚Äôm a big fan of Fitbit!! Looking at getting the Versa next.

Very reliable I love this app! Have used it for almost 4 years, it is very reliable, with many options! It challenges you to be the best you that you can be! You can connect with friends thru the app and have an instant accountability partner, even join outside exercise communities!

Luis Perez The app is great.  However I‚Äôm sad to know that you guys don‚Äôt make the Fitbit one anymore.  So sad to say once and if this Fitbit one breaks I‚Äôll be leaving Fitbit.  I‚Äôve had the opportunity to try several Fitbits and the ‚ÄúOne‚Äù has worked the best for me. Thank you for all you guys have done form me.  It‚Äôs been a journey.
Fit bit crazy Love my fit bit & the app is easy to use! One of my favorite features is the sleep tracker! Love that it breaks down your sleep into light, REM & Deep sleep times.

Update tracker is not working When I click on the button for updating the tracker within the app, I always get an error message. I charged my Fitbit up completely last night, and it‚Äôs still on the charger. When I tried to update it this morning, I still received the same error message.

Alta Fitbit Rocks! I have worn a Fitbit for 4 years and since retiring in Summer 2018(and now working part-time)I have capitalized on the benefits my Fitbit affords me. I thrive on feedback, appreciate reminders, and relish the features that inform, provide rationales, and focus on growth.

Great App for fitness and nutrition tracking I love that my Fitbit devices have tracked my steps, helps me identify texts and calls to my phone with a built in silent alarm to wake up without waking up my girlfriend. The Fitbit app also keeps a collection of commonly eaten foods and has a smart search function for food.

Just Why? Have you ever wondered about Health in motion? This is the place to go and check it out ‚Äì steps, exercise that counts, Miles you walked, liquid drink, and the sleep you‚Äôve had with the type of sleep. Now you know what this is the place to be. Now use the app daily and improve your health. Good luck!

Daily User The app has an informative dashboard that has most of what I use on a regular basis but also supports drill down detail when you want it. The interface is intuitive and I use it multiple times a day. Would definitely recommend the app

My Fitbit experience I have used Fitbit devices (currently a Charge 2)and apps for the last 5 years.  They are easy to use and are very informative.   I have been trying to get back in shape after an injury, and the daily information is invaluable to in my rehabilitation.

FitBit PP I love this app!  I can keep track of my steps, my water intake, and track my food choices.  I enjoy the challenges, which keeps me motivated.  I can see improvement in my weight loss on the grid.  I highly recommend FitBit to anyone who wants to lose weight and track their exercise.
Fit bit I mainly use the fit bit to measure my sleep and steps. I would like to increase my steps.

Love it except the bug in the notifications The app is great! I love my Fitbit and the app. I just don‚Äôt like the bug in the notifications tab. The notifications icon keeps showing a red dot indicating there‚Äôs something new to read but when I get to the tab it shows no notifications. Once this is fixed I will give the app 5 stars!

Easy to use The Fitbit app is easy to use and is easy to sync. I like the easy to read dashboard and also it is easy to participate in challenges through the app. Another feature I enjoy are all the badges you can earn through walking or climbing stairs etc.
Fix the location service limited bug This keeps on popping on my phone, ever when the app is not running in the background. It‚Äôs strange it‚Äôs not fixed and updated yet.

Well, here‚Äôs my issue... üòï So, I wanted to set up my tablet and phone and connect them to the Fitbit. I was about to make an account, but you didn‚Äôt list the device I had, or you didn‚Äôt clearly list it. I ended up making 2 accounts on accident before even realizing it wasn‚Äôt working. I have a Fitness Tracker HR, and according to an online source, it‚Äôs the ChargeHR. Please fix this, as I know this app is a good app!

Great App!! I love this app! I really like that I can log my sleep. I also have found that if you wear your fit bit on your ankle you get a better reading of the days activity, but still wear it on your wrist for sleep. I do wish logging in food was a little easier though.
Love it! But... I really like this app, I love how you can track food and water and stuff like that. And the workouts are amazing!!!!

Fun and motivating I love this app. I‚Äôm not a hardcore fitness nut and the only part of the app I use is Challenge. I‚Äôm a bit competitive and love to see if I can outstep my friends. :) I did wear my Fitbit to bed for a month, out of curiosity, and it was very interesting to see my sleep patterns. But I don‚Äôt feel like it‚Äôs a necessary part of my life. It‚Äôs fun!
Problems syncing steps Today I updated my app and removed all devices and mobile. Now MobileTrack is not even setting up just going in circles.

Has Kept Me Moving For 5 Years I would be a total couch potato without this. When you see you have barely moved all day by looking at your low step count, you are motivated to meet your daily goal. Dance, walk, run!  All of it counts!  Just wear it and move. You will gain energy just by moving!

Please read this!!! I love the Fitbit Alta and the ‚Äúcommunity‚Äù page! I think that you should sell the older Fitbits too. I know that you can‚Äôt do anything about this but I‚Äôve noticed that more and more people have stopped using Fitbits for Apple Watches. I enjoy wearing my Fitbit and I could never take it off!

Excellent! I can see my heart rate, calories burned, steps, weight loss/goals, and more at a glance! The food log is so easy to use- just snap a pic of the barcode! If you‚Äôre out, there is an extensive listing of restaurants and dishes! I can also track my period so there are no surprises! Highly recommend!

Love Fitbit I must be pretty hard on my fitbits because I‚Äôve gone threw several over the course of 5 years! I like this app a lot better than garmin. Fitbit also has great customer service. The app does everything I need it to! And must more user friendly than others.
Amended‚ÄîWon‚Äôt sync So, after researching the other reviews, there was a solution within. So, thank you to everyone for providing feedback. See original below‚Äî

Please add note section I would like to be able to make notes in the exercise section. I would like to go back and look to see if that treadmill workout was a walk, a walk and run, a programmed workout, etc. It would also be nice to be able to add a special amount of ounces for a ‚Äòquick add‚Äô on the water panel. I generally drink 20 ounces at a time.

Fantastic device to help me with my goals My Fitbit Charge 2 is awesome! I love it so far and it works as advertised. The device and app are easy to use and understand. It will help me with my overall health goals. I highly recommend Fitbit and their devices for anyone interested in a sleep tracker or fitness tracker.

Please improve the food log For the most part, I find this app very motivating. My biggest complaint is the food log needs improvement. I would like to be able to mark favorites in the app and not have to go online to do that. Also, a recipe builder, where I can log in all the ingredients of my favorite recipes, list the number of servings and log nutritional value by serving would be great!

Very UNRELIABLE So I got a blaze in December. Since then I have had food disappear from  my food log, water as well. Then it wouldn‚Äôt sync with my phone. Several times it wouldn‚Äôt sync my walk to the GPS.... This morning it added about 2,500 steps - literally out of nowhere! I have put messages out the Fitbit community but have gotten little real help. I really would like to  rely on this technology to manage my weight and exercise but so far it‚Äôs very frustrating! And a lot of wasted time trying to make it work!

Overall love it. Hate the ready to move feature The ‚ÄúAre you Ready to Move?‚Äù does not allow customization for non daylight hours. I work overnights and would like to adjust it to 3pm to 4am however that‚Äôs not allowed. Overall I love my Fitbit and enjoy seeing the results on the app but it needs to be customizable for everyone

FitBit app Have a FitBit Blaze and it stays connected perfectly. I have an iPhone 7 and as long as my Bluetooth is connected...no worries. Adding food is easy; there are lots of things that pop up and if it doesn‚Äôt have it, the app asks you to make picture of food and nutrition chart. Good app. I enjoy it.

My steps don‚Äôt count I recently had a baby and do a lot of walking now while pushing a stroller. Unfortunately, my Fitbit does not count the steps as I walk. It means I am no longer reaching my goal on a daily basis and my calorie burning is also off. Even though I love the rest of the app, I think the step goal is the best thing and it is frustrating that my daily steps are no longer accurate.

Can‚Äôt update my fit bit, gets stuck ‚Äúsearching for WiFi‚Äù until I am tired of waiting and close it. Can‚Äôt download Pandora it gets stuck. Nothing seems to be working and this has been going on for serval months, just didn‚Äôt take the time to write a review until now.

I‚Äôm addicted üòâ I check my app several times a day.  I really like the ability to see how I slept through the week.  Having this app has helped me to improve my quality and quantity of sleep.  It also keeps me motivated to stay active.

Best thing I ever did! I love this app and I really love my FitBit Charge 3, I‚Äôve had almost every Fitbit made and this is by far my favorite. I love being reminded to move and I think it‚Äôs great being able to go into the app and see how good (or bad) you‚Äôre doing throughout the day!

Love it I had a flex for years and then upgraded to the charge 2, use it to stay motivated through my workout schedule, run/step goals. Also use silent alarm regularly in the am and also for reminders throughout the day.

Obsessed! I love this app! I am obsessed with watching my sleep, tracking my steps and monitoring my water intake! I love that it reminds me to move every hour, so I don‚Äôt get stuck being lazy! I find it very accurate and feel so lost when it‚Äôs charging!
Love my Charge 2 I use my Charge 2 to stay on track as far as water intake goes and to ensure I walk as many stela‚Äôs possible during the day. I love how it displays my progress towards my goals.
Could do with some tweaks Overall a good app but could do with some changes to make it even better.

Not compatible anymore. I have had a Fitbit for years. I recently got an Apple watch and I can no longer participate with my friends in challenges. Improvements App is great for providing up to date information but doesn‚Äôt allow making notes to self about workouts, fluids, times, etc.  Can‚Äôt correct information on the app as number of aerobic workouts >30 min if it hadn‚Äôt auto updated or delete auto notifications from the app for example.

Unsatisfied Apple User I have an Apple Watch and Apple iPhone, I got this app to have some fun competitions with my friend that lives across country and has a Fitbit. Luv my FITBIT!! I‚Äôve found out that you can challenge your friends thru the app, and by doing so, I find that the victory from beating them on step count makes me do crazy things, like getting dressed at 11:30pm, just to get 1000 more steps in! That pushes me to keep on stepping!!!

Excellent App Very good app for reminding you of how much exercise you‚Äôre getting, your quantity and quality of your sleep, and tracking the time.  There‚Äôs much more in the App ‚Äî track your water consumption, track calories and nutrition, and trends on your weight.  There is a very good food database for calories, fat, protein, cholesterol, etc.

Love it! Fitbit is great for tracking steps, but it does so much more. I can see how well I slept and that is helpful. Our family really enjoys the challenges. When my husband lost his Fitbit we used the tracking they offer to find it.

Bug issues with syncing now Love the CHARGE3 and never had any issues with it syncing until the update occurred. Now I have to keep resetting multiple times just to get it to sync. Fitbit App won‚Äôt connect Charge 2 replacement to iPhone I was sent a Charge 2 replacement due to a cracked screen on my original Charge 2.Fitbit. Fitbit has a great app I have owned a Fitbit for over 3 years and have used the app since that time. I also have Fitbit scale, so all of my information is kept by the app. It is a great way to see how you progress month to month and year to year!

Really well organized app Better than any other I‚Äôve seen, the Fitbit app makes it really easy to find whatever info you‚Äôre looking for - pulse, weight, etc. I wish the hardware quality was as good as the software!

Fitbit Fitbit really helps me to keep moving. I absolutely love this watch and don‚Äôt want to take it off! I feel more energetic since following Fitbit and my step count! I recommend this watch to anyone that wants to loose a couple of pounds and stay fit.

Love & Hate Relationship I love this app!!! It tracks everything pretty accurate. The hate part is in groups guys think it‚Äôs a dating app and try to send messages and pics. Everyday your blocking them. Also lately I‚Äôve been having a red dot on my message saying I have a new message and I don‚Äôt. So lately there are some issues that they need to fix.

App review Nice app. I would, however, like to be able to see calorie balances for, say, the last 7 days easily, such as ‚Äú-7,000 calories for last seven days.‚Äù This would be especially helpful when working on weight loss (or gain).

Calorie intake The Fitbit app started off super helpful, but crashed immediately. The most annoying part is the calorie intake part. You‚Äôre supposed to be able to scan or enter in your calorie intake, but the camera doesn‚Äôt scan barcodes anymore, and when I go to physically enter in an item in clears out everything I previously had submitted. It desperately needs to be updated, because I wasted so much money on the Fitbit itself for the app not to work properly.

Bug ‚Äúfix‚Äù?! No! Ugh! I don‚Äôt know what is going on. I‚Äôve never had much trouble with this app but for the past couple of days the nutrition part been crazy! Either not showing the foods I enter, or else showing *entirely different* foods from the ones I enter... Very irritating. I‚Äôve closed the app, restarted my phone, etc. Still the same issues.

Charge HR I do love my Fitbit-I would love if on the app for female tracking that they add tracking for older women with menopause symptoms like hot flashes, wait gain, mood changes, etc...with a way to identify a rating between 1-5 (1 being mild-5 being OMG! With a notes section to log food you ate, beverages you drank etc to try and find what may intensify them.

Amazing for managing your weight/fitness loss goal Love it! I am trying to loose weight for a wedding and it gives me all the tools to track my fitness, what I eat, drink, as well as motivates you to move and get those steps in every hour. Highly recommended!

Software issue 11 July 18 Issues with new update date 11 July 18, food log will not Frequent or recent food item, scan is also off, sans but rejects items.  Please fix. Updated Software issue fixed after my request, thank you.

Features I love my band and I really do enjoy all the features. I think it‚Äôs so great that there is a specific enhancement for female health tracking BUT My only wish/ask with that is that it would have a pregnancy mode. I take my health very seriously and even MORE seriously now that I am pregnant. I feel like this would be a great enhancement to add to the application. Overall the app is great.
Female health tracker So I love this app for checking my steps and keeping track of everything.

Hi Well I‚Äôm a little confused as in why you can‚Äôt change your email. About a year ago I set up my account and messed up my email address. I would really appreciate if there was a way so that I could change it to my email.

Until I loved it UNTIL it started to break!!! A bubble on the side of it! And nothing !!!! $150 and it works lest them a year ? I know  it was lest then a year because I emailed Fitbit and they sent me a new one! That‚Äôs the policy. But still that one lasted last then a year. So they want more $$$ nothing new!!  So I just kept using the app... but they have cut that off too!! So if I had to give it a rating it would be a 0 just a money sucker. So heads up to all of you pass on it!!! It‚Äôs only a money sucker!

Can‚Äôt live without you Fitbit has been my motivator for being healthy and fit! I love tracking my exercise, sleep, and eating habits. I‚Äôm able to make changes as needed to be my healthiest self! Thank you, Fitbit - you are an inspiration to be healthy and well!!!

My Fitbit wont sync since my iPhone updated. My Fitbit was working fine and syncing with my iPhone 6 Plus until my iPhone did an update. Now it won‚Äôt pair with my Bluetooth and update to the Fitbit app. Is there any way you guys can fix this. It‚Äôs been about 2 days since my phone updated and I would really like to update my results to my phone. Thanks

Suggestion I think the Fitbit should vibrate when you get a Snapchat just like it vibrates when you get a text message or call. My Fitbit always helps me when I‚Äôm driving since I can‚Äôt look at my phone, I can look at my wrist but I wish it vibrated when I got a Snapchat too though.

It‚Äôs works but could use some upgrades The dashboard could be better. Would be helpful if  easier to add logs from the dashboard. Or use it as a shortcut to other capabilities. I wish I could customize the color/background too.

author_name: Use to be ur biggest app fan
review_body: Love the FB App, but buggy since update User friendly app that makes it easy to connect with others seeking to walk, lose weight, improve nutrition, motivate one another and exchange tips. Fitbit blaze Love my new blaze and since I‚Äôve recently had surgery, it‚Äôs a great way for me to see how many steps I‚Äôm getting in. It takes a little time to understand the map, but I‚Äôm getting there. Directions could me more clear for us older folks who take longer to  catch on but will get it!

Doesn‚Äôt support IPad 5th Version I absolutely love my Fitbit charge 2 but was very disappointed when I bought a new IPad 5 and the app will not connect to my Fitbit. I wish there were more screen options Well I have the Fitbit blaze and I feel that I should be able to customize my own background on it but I can‚Äôt and I have to choose from the ones you guys have so if you could please fix that it would be great

This upgrade was a downgrade This particular update now causes my food calories to display as a previous value (from when entered another day). Has potential to be Fantastic I was really excited to find my charge 2 after my toddler hid it for close to a year. I see that there is now a Female section for tracking the menstrual cycle. Why is there not a pregnant setting? I‚Äôm half way through this pregnancy and I know my daily goals differ from someone who is not pregnant. I think that would be an amazing update!

Nice The most recent update is nice I‚Äôve had the blaze since Mother‚Äôs Day and was happy but the notifications only worked with text and phones and music. And now this last update has made my blaze more functional thank you.
Latest update is terrible Constantly logs me out. When I try to log in it says something about no directory being found.

Fitbit Charge 3 Fitbit has reached out to me with a way to fix the lines in the face problem. I‚Äôm just so aggravated because I love my Fitbit. I have trouble sleeping and it keeps track of my sleep patterns and my daughter in Ohio and I  can compete with our steps. It‚Äôs waterproof but I never even get it wet because I‚Äôm afraid something might go wrong. Hopefully we can resolve this issue.

The Versa works well, the app seems weird as now it gives an incorrect time for my activities. The app has worked fine in the past. I‚Äôve uninstalled it and reinstalled it, rebooted my phone, and howled at the moon. None of it seems to work. The gps distance is way off also. Exercise and Sleep Tracking Issues Something seems to have gone wrong since Feb24th. Manual exercise entry is not working correctly - says not enough data to pull in heart rate, yet I can see the heart rate data in the other tab. I also just noticed that my sleep time has been shortened by 1 hr. I‚Äôm wondering if this has something to do with getting ready for Daylight Savings Time change?  Again, this all started around Feb 24th when I updated the app.

It also tells me no distance, calories and such. Steps count and distance calculates and eventually my Charge 3 recognizes I ran, but the actual gps tracking is useless.

Text message update I love my Fitbit Charge 2 and had it for years. Thanks to my coworker I have been using it again religiously, however, so heartbroken that we no longer receive text message notifications. Hopefully in time this will be an option.

Disappointed Seems my Fitbit has to be recharged for at least 10 minutes every time I want it to sync with my app. That takes time and is very interruptive. Yes, all-day sync is on. Yes, the Fitbit is fully charged. Yes, my IOS is up to date. Yes, the app and Fitbit are in close proximity.
Premium pushing annoying. Tone it down on the promotion of your premium service. I get at least 1 ad for it in the app once a week.

DO NOT UPDATE if your sleep score shows Estimated Oxygen Variation My Fitbit Premium had been showing Estimated Oxygen Variation in my Sleep Score until the very latest update. So I restored my iPhone to an earlier backup and got it back. Just a heads-up to those who want to see this stat.

App doesn‚Äôt save daily steps Although I really like having my Fitbit on and wear it regularly, what is the purpose of the daily step goal and report at the end of the week if the ap doesn‚Äôt save the step information and doesn‚Äôt allow you to edit the steps. Love the my Fitbit versa and app but I love my Fitbit versa and the app, but at least once a week when I try to sync to the app and it is searching for device   I get message device not found. I have to delete the app and reinstall and log back on for it to sync. Very frustrating

author_name: Love it, but needs an update
review_body: App is not updating my stats Since the last update my states are not updating from my versa to the app. I consistently update the app with my stats for sleep exercise and steps and it hasn‚Äôt been doing this since the last update please correct as soon as you can. Thanks

Worst app and device on the market I‚Äôm now on my 4th fit bit. They all just stopped working. Hate new reporting Hate the new reporting that came with update. Telling me I slept poorly‚ÄîI don‚Äôt need you to tell me that!  I can make my own assessment, I don‚Äôt need you to think for me! Love this app I absolutely love Fitbit and the app. But currently I‚Äôm giving it one star because the most recent app update has changed it to where the app won‚Äôt launch. Fix your app I‚Äôve had my Fitbit Versa for well over a year and it‚Äôs great but the app is incredibly frustrating. I‚Äôve had to restart the pairing/adding it to my profile and I have been waiting for 34 minutes with the same results. Buggy doesn‚Äôt work with VPN‚Äôs I‚Äôve been using Fitbit for over 4 years now and it‚Äôs always been a little buggy but now it‚Äôs become unusable for me.

Logs me out and doesn‚Äôt remember me or my device Works great and has everything I need when it works but it logs me out constantly. I‚Äôd doesn‚Äôt remember my log-in and it‚Äôs such a pain. Also, when I log in it often losses my info and I have to reset everything. Other times I‚Äôm required to update which also logs me out. I‚Äôve lost my data multiple times. All this makes it pretty pointless and renders my overpriced watch useless. This is my last Fitbit.

Not receiving text messages I previously had a charge 2 but i assumed it was messing up because it stopped sending notifications for my text messages. I received the versa 2 for my birthday and I‚Äôm still not getting them. I love my Fitbit but not receiving my messages is frustrating.

Upset with ‚Äúpremium‚Äù Bought the inspire HR as my former Alta HR stopped working after a few years. These were features that used to be available without any charge and is one of the main reasons I bought a new one. Very unhappy, may just have to return and switch to an Apple Watch.
