Text messages Hi! Just got my Fitbit versa and it‚Äôs lovely. However, I am not receiving my text messages even though everything is connected properly. I have an iPhone XS with the new update and my Bluetooth connection and phone connection are set up properly. I am able to receive my phone calls but texts are not coming in. Please help!

Stop with the updates... It seems when you update the app, half the time it creates compatibility issues.  I love my Fitbit one, but the app is super frustrating.  I don‚Äôt want to have to reset my Fitbit and resync and ‚Äúnot lose data‚Äù only to end up losing a few days worth because you decided to change the location of where to find something like the alarm setting.

New update is terrible Now I‚Äôm having issues with not being able to log in my calories. I will try to log something in and it will disappear. I‚Äôm also having that issue with logging in water. The sleep app is only getting certain times and not the whole sleep. Also, I don‚Äôt like the new layout. It just seems to have so many bugs and I miss the old app.

Tile migration error Since updating the app, I receive an error ‚Äútile migration failed‚Äù with my charge 2. I restarted my phone, deleted and reinstalled the app, logged in and out of the app, disconnected and reconnected Bluetooth for the charge 2 and nothing has fixed the error. Searched the forums but could not find another recommendations for the error. I stopped using my Fitbit (hence the app) because of the frustrations with that app update.

No notifications since iOS 13 update I am no longer receiving iMessage or text message notifications on my Inspire HR since updating to iOS 13. The only notifications I receive on my Fitbit are from app push notifications and for some weird reason when I make a call it notifies me that I‚Äôm making a call. All of my settings are the same as they were before the update.

Text/Messanger notifications not working Not sure what happened but now I don‚Äôt receive text or messenger notifications on my Versa. I did a factory reset and it still doesn‚Äôt work. I love everything else just wish the texts would come through like before.
App crashes immediately on opening Since the newest operating system loaded the app won‚Äôt even open. It crashes immediately on trying to open it.

Get rid of the sleep score I was happy without Fitbit until you forced the sleep score on us. It‚Äôs useless, judgmental and unnecessary. Sleep tracking is already experimental and to add a nonsense score to it is even less evidence based. We should be able to turn this on or off if you don‚Äôt want to get rid of it completely. Your forums are full of people who agree with me so please consider it as I know many people including myself are now looking to alternatives üò£.

Make sleep score optional I was okay with the new dashboard bupdate and was interested in the sleep score but it fails to explain the factors affecting the score rendering it useless. I understand the idea to make people pay for more details but then make it optional or move it to another section for those of us that don't want to pay. And bring back the average sleep hours which is more helpful for us instead of some number we don't even get analysis on.

Not cool I‚Äôm not liking this new update. For some reason I no longer can see how my Fitbit tracked my sleep which was one of the features I used the most. I tried to find how to add the sleep title back onto the app, but couldn‚Äôt find how to do it anywhere. I just don‚Äôt see why it was necessary to get rid of all the tiles I had access to before. That seems more like a downgrade than an upgrade to me.

68 years young I‚Äôm trying to stay fit for my grands. However, a reminder to sync my Fitbit to the app on Sunday evening or Monday morning would be very helpful. Sometimes I don‚Äôt get credit for my efforts in my report, so it becomes less of an incentive to challenge myself and compare outcome week to week.

App/watch I enjoy using the app; however, I‚Äôm disappointed in the watch. For some reason, I no longer receive notifications (calls/texts) on my watch. It started with not being able to delete all of my messages, to this.

Great App This Fitbit app is perfect for me to keep on top of the walking I do as well as the total steps I take each day.  I also like all of the other health info provided with regard to calories burned, oxygen measured, heart rate, and sleep patterns and total hours slept each night.  It‚Äôs a great app!
Best watch and app The app provides everything I need to track my daily activities. My sleep cycle, heart beats, food log, weight track and steps

Wow. I love the app, it works great. Definitely the best way to access all the data that my tracker picks up. I think the overall design and feel of the app could be improved, but the functionality is perfect. Definitely worth it.

Hate the changes to alarms I have loved the alarm feature for years. The ability to sync my phone and have it register different time zones and automatically adjust is wonderful. I‚Äôm the recent update, however, alarms are a pain to set. Please restore the previous alarm functions so it is easier to vary day by day - and set at all!

Used to be great but problems now Been using this app for years but lately has problems. To start with the sneek peek no longer works but instead takes me back to the start page. Also I can no longer start challenges but I can join other challenges. This app is now frustrating especially since it used to work until they updated it.
Privacy issues Recently my Fitbit iOS app is asking for allowing access to my location all the time so they can use my mobile phone and few other apps to show it on watch.

Great activity tracker I‚Äôm not a full time fitness junky. The fitbiit app provides a great way to see how active you have been over time. I often go back a year or two to compare weight and heart rate to current stats to see how I am doing.

Nice features but needy Has a lot of very good features like sleep monitoring and auto-exercise recognition, but if you don‚Äôt open the app every few days, it just stops logging all information. Everything it tracked gets deleted at midnight when it resets and it won‚Äôt sync or send notifications like ‚Äòlow battery‚Äô alerts.

FitBit, a Life Companion I bought my FitBit Surge four years ago. Since then it has been my constant companion. It has accompanied me, and counted my steps, and calories, through Europe, South America, Central America, Alaska, and the 48 states. I credit it as a major factor in my current good health. I am 92 years old.

Fun to track exercise My goal now is not to exercise but to get ‚Äúgreen swirlies‚Äù every day. Sometimes though an active hour counted on my Versa will be shown as a miss on my app. Also screen flickers on power saving mode so leave it on normal so doesn‚Äôt flicker.

Updates removed features! Loved my Fitbit, particularly the way it synced with my iPhone 5 SE, then after almost two years of receiving notifications letting me know who was calling or who was texting & providing the first line, it stopped cold. After a few months of trying to get it to work again, I checked compatibility with my phone and now my Fitbit will only work with iPhone 10 or higher. I‚Äôm beyond disgusted with this type of corporate manipulation!!

Convenient My Fitbit app is my #1 go to app on my phone. The at a glance features that I customized include what I use most often. I look forward to receiving my weekly reports and appreciate the gentle reminder and prompt I get when I need to move.

Staying Healthy I enjoy my Fitbit. It enables me to enjoy my Physical activity without worrying about recording how well I am doing. This is my way of staying healthy. I do not need to share my accomplishment with other people to stay motivated. Thank you keep up the good work.

Changed my life ‚ù§Ô∏è Fitbit is like FB for fitness like-minded people. I have a ton of great friends, all the while I‚Äôm being competitive and keeping healthy. I keep watch over my heart ‚ù§Ô∏è rate and try to improve my stats constantly.

Charge 2 My favorite one is the chart series but stairs work better in charge one. You shouldn‚Äôt have to clip it to your pants to get more accurate stair count, that‚Äôs ridiculous. Love the sleep reports or in my case the lack there of. Highly recommended

Has helped me lose 50 lbs I really like the app. I like the help that it gives me to track the number of calories that I‚Äôve taken in in the number of calories but I‚Äôve used up during the day. It has help me lose 50 pounds.

Fit bit I love it ! It‚Äôs helping me record my steps in food intake and it‚Äôs fun to see the challenges.! I just love being able to see progress and enjoy looking up things on Fitbit apps to add to the experience! Fun way to lose weight or maintain shape!

Fitbit versa not syncing Received my Fitbit Versa Christmas 2018. On January 2019 my Fitbit syncs up intermittently on my iPhone.  I would reboot my iPhone and sometimes it works at time it would just not sync up.  I did a recent update on my iPhone and it synced up for a day.  I would would log off in hopes it would sync up....worked for a day. This is super frustrating.

Great! I love using my Fitbit! The app is great! There are a few things I would add and change if I were in charge. For example, I would let it sync with a few more apps, like the Charity Miles app. But, overall, it‚Äôs really great! It helps me to have a visual representation of how much activity I‚Äôm getting in each day.

Weekend nurse I like how it breaks down my sleep so I know how much shut eye I‚Äôm actually getting. Since I work nights, it can be hard to sleep enough during the day. Keeps track of all of my steps at work too and they can really add up!
Love the app, love Fitbit! It worked very well before an update. Now Charge 3 doesn‚Äôt pair to show notifications.

Logs me out after every use Even though I have my iPhone save my passwords, every time I open the Fitbit app I have to wait several minutes for it ‚Äúto clean things up‚Äù and then it logs me out. Every. Single. Time. This is the only app on my phone that does this and I have checked the settings numerous times. It is extremely annoying.

Customer Service Think twice before buying a Fitbit. My account was compromised and my email address and password were changed locking me out of my account and they were completely uncooperative with solving the issue. After several emails and live chats I was told to just wait to be contacted and there was nothing else they could do for me except send me a link to an article on compromised accounts. Should have just bought the Apple Watch.

Love the app Love the app. I really enjoy how I can view all my data in one place.  I appreciate that I can link it with other apps.  The only thing I‚Äôm not in love with is the food tracker.  Either too many items I can‚Äôt find and then I just get frustrated and go back to my tried and true.

Fitbit obsessive Love how my Fitbit has turned me into an obsessive walker. At age 70 I‚Äôm disappointed if I don‚Äôt get 80-90,000 steps a week. My phone alarm goes off at 11:45 pm every night. I check my steps. If I‚Äôm close to the next 1,000 I run around my house until I get it.

I love my Fitbit! Keeps me motivated and on track.  I use the food tracker, steps and sleep monitoring features as part of my whole body fitness program.  My weight management scale is also linked to my Fitbit for single source data collection.

I like my Fitbit I like how it reminds me to move every hour. My husband was in A-fib and had surgery to correct it. After the surgery the Fitbit was able to read detailed sleep where before it hadn‚Äôt been. It is how we know (track) that his heart is in a normal rhythm.

Fitbit doesn‚Äôt stand behind their product I‚Äôm pushing a lawnmower and nothing hits me anywhere near my hand, and the screen on my Blaze cracked, like a spiderweb. Back and forth with Fitbit and the best they could do was 25% off the purchase of a new Fitbit???  Why would I purchase another subpar product that the company won‚Äôt support?  This was my first Fitbit purchase and also my last.  Thought I would give them a shot but Garmin now thanks Fitbit for making me a repeat Garmin customer.

Frequent crashing and slow syncing The old version of the app worked a lot better a few years ago. It synced way faster to my Flex (like less than 5 seconds) but now with the newest version of the app, my Flex 2 takes seems to take way longer to sync. Also, for the past couple of days the app keeps crashing a minute after I open it.

New to Fit Bit Got it for Christmas, so haven‚Äôt used it a week yet, but I like everything I‚Äôve read on it and have set it up already as you can tell...misplaced my instruction book but have read about it on the app.  So far, so good!

Great just one minus I really like this app. Its great and help ful is so many health areas from weight to sleep to food and nutrients. My only complaint is i wish there was a way to see a more detailed view of macronutrients such as fats protiens and carbs. For example how much grams for each an individual should be taking in

LOVE it. Mother Inlaw got me the Fitbit blaze for Xmas and I absolutely love it. Stylish, comfortable and really gets you active and paying attention to your sleep, activity and your body. My wife has one and we set up goals for each other and compete throughout the week.

author_name: Not a scholar but a user
review_body: I‚Äôm very pleased This was an unexpected Christmas gift and I‚Äôm so  pleased! I was disappointed that it didn‚Äôt register my work on the stationary bike so I put it on my ankle & that works!

Great app! I‚Äôve had 2 Fitbits since 2011 and the app automatically links to my company‚Äôs fitness program so I get awarded points without having to do anything more than what I am doing anyway. ‚Äîwalking!  No forms to fill out and more health for meüòÄ. Great work Fitbit!

Great device I enjoy my Fitbit.  I wear almost all the time which is great for me because I stopped wearing a watch years ago.  When I wear it, it‚Äôs so light weight, I don‚Äôt even notice it.  My only issue is that it still calculates calories when I‚Äôm not wearing it which is strange... Overall, I am very pleased with it.

Low battery Suggestion Sometimes my Fitbit will die because I don‚Äôt realize the battery is low. I do get an email when it‚Äôs low. I can also see it in the app. It would be nice if we could get a little buzz to remind us that the battery is low and needs a charge! üôÇ

Needs a ‚ÄúFind My FitBit‚Äù feature I just bought a cheap fitness tracker for my son for $7.50 with all the same features of a FitBit (minus the heart rate tracker). It has a ‚ÄúFind Band‚Äù feature that makes the tracker vibrate if you‚Äôre nearby. These FitBits cost in the hundreds and don‚Äôt have this simple feature.

Give us Apple Health Integration!! Fitbit really needs to get with the program and make his app compatible with the Apple Watch!  It DOES NOT work with any Apple Watch, and it appears fitbit has no plans to make it work in the future.  They are trying to introduce their own smart watch, so they refuse to integrate Apple Watch.  By doing so, they continue to alienate a LARGE group of app users.  I am uninstalling this app from my iPhone, as it is completely useless now that I upgraded to an Apple Watch.

Great app! I got the Fitbit Blaze from work, and I love it! The app walked me through how to set up my Fitbit, and it was very simple to follow. I also love having all of my health items in one go-to place, instead of on multiple apps like I had before. Great app and great product!
Inconsistent at best After some updates to the app, it's better, but far from being reliable. Poor battery level display, lengthy sync, especially in poor wifi areas for some reason...why ?

Can‚Äôt re-sync Blaze to iPhone 7 I‚Äôve had the Fitbit Blaze for about one year. I‚Äôve had no issues syncing it in the past but since the iOS 11 update, I can‚Äôt re-sync the Blaze anymore. I‚Äôve deleted the app, logged out/in, turned off/on the Blaze and iPhone. It won‚Äôt let me get pass the User Agreement. I click on the link but it‚Äôs not working. Any help?

Life changing My sisters and niece have it. I just started today and I now understand why they‚Äôre so excited. I have Fitbit Charge 2 and I love it. I feel like it‚Äôs changed my entire outlook. My first day I walked 11,569 steps.

Fitbit Alta Just purchased this used after losing my Garmin Vivofit, and I love it. It definitely has great features within the app and is something I will use for a very long time. I love the sleep tracker, water consumption tracker, and goal setting options.

App not working properly This app was good when it was working.  After the last upgrade I keep getting device not found.  I‚Äôve rebooted, deleted the app and reinstalled, removed and added back the device.  Everything that they suggested to fix it.  Still have trouble every day.   Between this and the daylight readability with the Alta HR I‚Äôm about to find a better device and app

I can‚Äôt disable the annoying ‚Äútry premium‚Äù pop ups. I‚Äôve been using this app for years, but now it‚Äôs evolved into a pay to play service. Those pop up adverts are annoying. Ask me once, not every day.

Awesome! Ok let‚Äôs be honest here you got this because you bought a Fitbit. Awesome for the Fitbit and you need this app to set ur Fitbit up. One thing I would like to know is I have the versa and I don‚Äôt know how to asign the 2 side buttens if you could tell me that would be amazing.

Not what it used to be... My Fitbit no longer connects and updates the app. It used to connect perfectly but with all of the updates and changes that the app has made no longer works with my device. All of these adds for Premium are annoying. They were never there before. I prefer the original design. It‚Äôs too much going on in the app now.

It‚Äôs a good app that needs tweaks. It is a good app, but if you connect more then one Fitbit at a time the first one will be jacked up and not be able to work it. Then the other won‚Äôt be able to do anything but change the back screen for an ace. But it‚Äôs a good app, just needs some tweaks.

The app is glitchy I wear my Fitbit religiously but the app is very glitchy. In the past 6 months, every time I either charge my Fitbit or update the app, the Fitbit fails to sync. What‚Äôs even more frustrating is the fix is different each time. It would be awesome if I didn‚Äôt have to spend 20 min each week figuring out to get it to sync.

Please Fix Missing Decimal for Body Fat Normally a great app, but since early Dec the app doesn‚Äôt let customers enter fractional numbers for body fat percentage; only whole integers. This is super inconvenient at a time of year when lots of new customers have just purchased new devices during the holidays and a heavy amount of consumers are focused on healthy new year resolutions. Not the best timing to have a crucial element not work properly.

User unfriendly Got a Fitbit Charge 3 for Christmas. None of the watch faces available are compatible with it and none of the apps that are advertised on it are compatible with it. I can‚Äôt set any alarms like it says you can or get any notifications like it says you can. When you try to get help it refers you to the app which is what I used to get to the help feature! So far it‚Äôs disappointing.

iPhone problem Wish they would fix the problem with the iPhone update. I haven‚Äôt been able to receive any notifications on my Fitbit for over a month now. I have done everything they have suggested to do and nothing works. If it gets fixed I will changed my rating.

Can‚Äôt sync since most recent update I have a charge HR watch, and I haven‚Äôt been able to sync my device since the most recent update. The app says my battery level is at 10% and it says ‚ÄúFailed to sync device.‚Äù  I‚Äôve charged my device, I‚Äôve updated my phone, and I don‚Äôt know where to go from here. Please help.
Love Fitbit, Not So Much the App Fitbit is great. Glad to have had one. This isn‚Äôt about the physical Fitbit.

Annoying Every single time I open this application there‚Äôs a location permission request and I‚Äôd rather not grant Fitbit access to my gps data. Why does Fitbit need to know where I am to monitor my activity? I don‚Äôt see a way of turning it off and it doesn‚Äôt seem to lessen over time. Had to turn off notifications because it would request access a few times a day without opening the app. Hello? Bullying shouldn‚Äôt be a strategy.

Disappointed in changes Current version (Nov 2019) is difficult to read. I‚Äôm young and updates to apps and webpages never bother me, but a few months ago Fitbit changed their app interface and it is way less engaging. I‚Äôm not happy with the layout/formatting of the app and wish it were more intuitive, as the last layout was. Users should be allowed choice in how we see our daily stats ‚Äúdashboard‚Äù in the app.

Fix the messages After more than a month of waiting Fitbit still has not corrected the text message portion of notifications on my Alta. This is truly a pain for me as i work in a noisy environment and i cant always hear the phone. I received a response from Fitbit concerning the lack of messages and after following their instructions, i still dont have the ability to receive text message notifications

Shouldn‚Äôt have upgraded I do not like the home page of the new upgrade. I wish the sleep and exercise and daily movements were the same style and at the top like they used to be. You cannot tell how well rested you were at a glance. I liked being able to see the pink vs blue. The new app takes forever to sync. And you must make sure to reconnect the Bluetooth after charging or it does not sync automatically like the old one.

Loved it before the update Use my Fitbit all the time.  It was great until it updated.  Now it won‚Äôt keep track of steps.  Had to keep going into the program and try to get it to track on the app. Now it won‚Äôt track at all on the app but the actual Fitbit works but can‚Äôt see it on line and so it won‚Äôt sync to other apps which it did before.  Any help out there?

Cool app I have went through a couple of different fitbits over the last 4 years and up until recently I loved them. Ever since the iOS 13 update I no longer get messages and calls on my Fitbit charge 2. I‚Äôve done everything to try and fix it but nothing has worked. This app is pretty cool though.

Crooked & Crappy So FitBit has claimed they can‚Äôt change the app design after releasing the new format and a majority of users complaining about it... but today they managed to add a new tab for ‚Äúpremium‚Äù without an update even being released üßê Something doesn‚Äôt compute here ü§® Between this and the fact Google may be buying FitBit... I may be done with mine and looking for something else soon

Terrible since it updated This ya got to be the worst app.  I used to be able to open the app and it would automatically update everything.  Now, both my husband and myself open the app and it does not automatically update and takes a very long time.  You used to be able to leave the app open and see the steps you were taking and that has changed too.  Please go back to the old way!!

I used to love my Fitbit Fitbit- when are you going to fix the notification issue?  I absolutely loved my Fitbit and have been a loyal fan for years.  I‚Äôve bought them for family members and gotten friends to buy them. I‚Äôve been patient and repeatedly tried all of the setting changes. Nothing has worked.  This week there was a new update which doesn‚Äôt even address the issue.  Looks like it‚Äôs time for a Garmin or Apple Watch.

Micronutrient breakdown? I like that the app shows your macro totals and percentages, but I really wish they would show the micronutrients as well (vitamins, fiber, saturated fat, etc).  Also, I can‚Äôt figure out how to delete direct messages to clear out the ‚Äúnew message‚Äù notification.  Overall, it‚Äôs a good app, could just use some basic improvements.

The new update is horrible! The new app update is agonizing! It takes forever to log my food, my tracker takes twice as long to sync, and I cannot get text message notifications anymore. I‚Äôm so frustrated! I‚Äôm so close to but an Apple Watch because I‚Äôve tried EVERY troubleshooting suggestion to fix my app and tracker.

Cycling activity doesn‚Äôt register I am disappointed with my Fitbit device because it only registers my stepping activities like walking, dancing, etc. if I go to Zumba class for 55 min I max on aerobic activity and steps. But if I work hard on a bike for an hour it does not register any activity even though I work much harder than at Zumba. Perhaps I should change battery? Oh, swimming is also ignored. Please advise.

Sometimes 5 Stars, Sometimes 3 I absolutely love my FitBit for keeping me accountable with working out. When the app works smoothly, I rate it 5 stars. When it‚Äôs glitchy, force closes, and you can‚Äôt access certain things, it‚Äôs a 3.

Design Love that fitbit has this app but the new design tried to be too modern but actually makes me wanna use it less. I wish you could use it more on a personal level, like annotate a workout as a stationary bike or treadmill. Also the other options are just to encourage you to get premium, so you‚Äôre literally only using 1/3 of the app menus.

Great..however In the new update I can no longer manually log workouts which essentially dismantles the entire system of positive reinforcement for working out. Please change it back. Not all workouts are caught by the bracelet no matter how rigorous, especially weights. Please fix this, or I will stop using this product.
Messed up after recent update. Late September 2019 The watch is messed up after the latest update!! Please fix!

iOS 13 and versa light I‚Äôm getting no notifications after the update to my phone. I called tech support and was told they‚Äôre aware of the issue. That some users are experiencing problems others not. The suggestion was to wait for an update to the Fitbit app.... Im not to happy about it... this is my 3rd Fitbit ...I kept upgrading but now I‚Äôm thinking it‚Äôs time to end my long relationship with Fitbit products.

Sleep score is useless Why did the developers do away with hours and minutes weekly averages? The sleep insights used to be useful before somebody decided to develop some subjective scoring system for your night's sleep. Sleep score doesn‚Äôt even accurately represent how well you slept in my opinion. Sleep score is useless. Bring back the universal measurement of hours and minutes for weekly averages. Someone fixed something that wasn‚Äôt broken
iOS update and app won‚Äôt start Bad timing.. I‚Äôve had my Charge 2 off for a few months and recently updated iOS and then plugged in my charge 2 to charge..and now the app won‚Äôt start. Help!?

Bad Redesign I HATE the way the app looks now. As someone who likes things organized, having my challenges on the same page as everything else does NOT work for me. Also, where is the battery life indicator?

Awful Update! Sneak peak doesn't work even though the button is there, unable to invite all friends for challenges, some friends have disappeared from my friends list!  And then new challenges are mixed in with old challenges which requires you to edit to get the new challenges on top! Fitbit... Did no one test the update before rolling it out to everyone???

Disappointing changes Offering no new functionality, to justify their salaries, I assume, the dev team redesigned the entire look on the latest version, taking away cool graphics like the happy moon and replacing them with clip art pictures. If there was a need to change something, sure, but the new look, which offers nothing new, is subjectively terrible. I wish there were a way I could roll it back to the previous look.

Not a big fan of the new design. The new layout  looks like you‚Äôre going backwards. Like it looks like you guys just starting  Fitbit company and are trying to figure out what you want your app to look like.

Love Fitbit but not the new version I have been using Fitbit for the last 4 years, I have enjoyed the device and the app. The recent update however changing the main home screen is a step back in my opinion. I really can‚Äôt stand it. I‚Äôm thinking of trying out Garmin‚Äôs because now it‚Äôs harder to use, less intuitive now, and I‚Äôm not sure who thought the app and home page change was an upgrade but it‚Äôs a downgrade in my opinion!

Love the app, not the new look. I love the app and all the functions... I‚Äôm not a fan of the new layout.  It would be nice if they had the option to switch between classic view and the new view.  I much prefer the tiles over the list view.  Also, bring back the quick add function in the bottom middle.  It‚Äôs cumbersome to have to scroll to each list item to add something.

Love it The new update makes it impossible to locate the options for starting challenges with friends. Love the rest of the customizable changes with the update. Love the app, just would like an easier location for starting a challenge

Dont like the new sleep analysis Havent explored other features yet. But I dont like the new sleep analysis. It stopped telling you how much time you were awake thus the sleep duration is longer. It only tells you how many times you woke up. My hours of really sleep is one hour longer than my previous sleep but I dont feel that way.
Have to change clock face I had a clock face that I liked. Fitbit forces you to change to a new face even though you don‚Äôt like them.
Not a fan of the new update I like my Fitbit charge 2 and all its features. However my 5 star went down to 3 after the last SW update.

Hate the new setup and Charge 3 does not sync with app Your challenges and stats are on the same page now.  Even when you put your challenges at the bottom of the pages, new ones appear at the top so you have to keep moving things around on your page constantly.  Wish challenges were on a different page again.  Also the Charge 3 I just got does not sync with the app so your stats don‚Äôt match.

What Happened?? I hate the new update! The screen is horrible, you don‚Äôt get the rewarding green screen, it doesn‚Äôt sync all the time anymore. It‚Äôs so ugly! It was fine before I don‚Äôt know why they changed it, why fix what isn‚Äôt broken?? The challenges don‚Äôt come up right anymore, it‚Äôs very frustrating. I really enjoyed it before, the setup was perfect. I wish I had never updated it!

New updated GUI is extremely disappointing While previous app GUI was among the best ones, the updated look and feel is terrible. Also, gone is command menu button... I spent 10 minutes trying to figure out how to set up a silent alarm. I am seriously thinking about replacing Fitbit with a competing product. I cannot understand how somebody in clear mind would release this .... which is so much worse than the previous app. This is insane...

Text Notifications I am not receiving text notifications.  I have made sure everything under notifications is checked to be On. I have done the Forget this device on Bluetooth and re-paired it. I have deleted the Charge 3 for the Fitbit App and added it back. Still no text message notification.

Female Health I always liked the Fitbit app. It‚Äôs clean and easy to use. But I love it now that you all have added to the app by helping track periods. Now I‚Äôm only using one app for all heath. The only suggestion I would add, is to allow input for birth control. Especially people like myself that use nuva rings. Keeping up with insertion and replacement is pretty important! :)

Great App but Keeps Unsyncing from My Device I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs to do with the app or my device (a Charge 3) but it sync stops working from time to time and I have to do a total reset just to get it working again. It is really frustrating because this app tracks more than just my steps now and I really appreciate the data.

Fitbit blaze battery Loved the Fitbit blaze for the first year then immediately after the warranty ran out the battery started draining on a daily basis instead of lasting 3 to 5 days as it did for the whole first year of ownership. Fitbit owns up to the fact that the battery is defective but not willing to do anything about it other than given a small discount for buying yet another of their products. Switching to Garman

Accurate data, good tracking Checking this app periodically gives you insight to your activities.  Calories and fluid intake require more diligence than , I think, most people have but activity tracking is excellent

NOT DRESSED W/O My FITBIT My ionic is always with me till shower time.  The app is adequate and well thought out.  The latest update works well.  I have not been able to get weather to update but that‚Äôs rarely used since my device has apps just for weather.
If you do either or encouraging but don‚Äôt want to be pushed If it bit of a gentle reminder that you should be up and moving instead of sitting and watching TV

App works great! The app works great for my Fitbit Charge 2. It usually updates by itself. There are a few rare times when it didn‚Äôt but going to the app or shutting off my phone made it update. Love to compete against my cousins!

Works 100% I have been using since 2017. Great tracker and app! It may not be perfect but it is really close! I use the vibration alarm twice a day and check my sleep everyday. It's great to see how the body works through data analysis.

Love love love Love my Fitbit!!! By far the best fitness tracker.  I continue to wear it even though I have an Apple Watch.  My Fitbit is WAY better for tracking exercise automatically without me having to manually start tracking like I do with my Apple Watch.

Used to work When I first downloaded the app it worked wonderfully and updated quickly. Now it takes forever to update each time I open the app. To make it even more annoying there are constant times that it saids it syncs when nothing gets synced and it continues to happen more and more often. Needs an update to fix these issues.

Welcome tool. Do to having a two birth defects in my heart, I am able to keep a close eye on my heart rate 24 hours a day. I only take it off to take my shower and put it back as soon as I am done. Will never go without one again.

Awesome! My Fitbit keeps me in check! I love the app and the different groups we can join and be part of!! I recommend it so you can stay fit and accountable, our well being is very important to our lives.

Fitbit-Ionic Very pleased, excellent tracking, useful apps, band is extremely comfortable. Have had for nearly two years, still have original band. Device still looks brand new. Charges quickly, charge lasts for days.

Simple & easy to use I find this Fitbit so easy to use. I track my steps for a million-step challenge at work and it‚Äôs great. I needed assistance and Fitbit support was very accessible & helpful . I am considering an upgrade soon. No Apple Watch for me- I‚Äôm sticking with Fitbit !

Doesn‚Äôt work well with iOS I love my Fitbit but I am constantly frustrated with the way the app interfaces with my watch. I frequently have to unpair and re-pair the watch to the app, it doesn‚Äôt always track things properly and it won‚Äôt sync automatically even though it is set to do so. I love Fitbit and have been a loyal user for 8 years but I am now looking at Apple watches b/c the iOS interface is so spotty.

Best app I really like this app! I like to see how much sleep I get each night as this has been an issue for me. Getting the steps each day is a goal I have and I get to share and compete with my friends and family.

Love my Fitbit I  now have the Fitbit Charge 3 and love it. Every thing about the app and the Fitbit I Great they keep getting better with more info on the trackers and I keep up to date only sleep patterns and steps per day!!  Awesome product and app to go along with it.

Keeps me going Been sing Fitbit for several years. He app is very convenient however it does stop working fairly frequently. I have had to remove & reinstall several times. I wish the hourly goal markers would sync along with the step count.

Friend of Words I enjoy the app except for the promotions for new games and ads at the end of the games. Some say ‚Äúskip AD‚Äù but after many presses it will often keep going. They are also too frequent. Another disappointment is that you can no longer tap a word at the end of a game to get the dictionary explanation. I really miss that.

Versa bug The app worked great before my Charge 2 died and I went and got a new Versa.  My weight workouts are displaying pace and distance... not stats that have any relevance to the workout.  Tried searching for a solution and the bug has been known for over a year and still nothing even close to a solution except to re-add the exercise shortcut every time, which is insane.  So disappointed that this is what I get for upgrading my device!

LOVE I had an Apple Watch for years and it was never very accurate with tracking my fitness. Took the plunge and switched over and got the Fitbit Versa and I love it. The app is so easy to use and I love all of the information it tracks for you!

Fit bit great for workouts. This app is great keeps me active. I‚Äôm ready to upgrade however fine with my present Fitbit. Tried a Gorman and it went bad within months. My Fitbit is two year old and still going.

Long time user I have used Fitbit for many years and have used it as opposed to other fitness apps.  It has been a good tool to keep track of my weight, food intake / calories in / calories out, heart rate / health, and step count.

Fit Bit review Fit Bit works okay to measure steps plus sleep. Need to take off the band before showering because it seems that water affects the sensors. Occasionally I get a misread on number of steps and on the amount of sleep. Battery could last a bit longer.

Years of awesome! I‚Äôve had my surge since 2014. It has been through the pool, the ocean, the sand, and a lot of running and still works great. Wrist band needs to be replaced soon, but this thing has even done entire marathons. Love my Fitbit surge and the app with it.

Love It! I have used my Alta to assist my weight loss  of 60+ pounds. I am faithful to each category on the mobile app (movement, water, weekly activity goal, etc.). My only criticism for the mobile app is the inability to log swimming/biking, but opening the Fitbit site on my phone allows this; it‚Äôs just a hassle to do so.

Fitbit app Love this app!  I am always on my phone usually scrolling and posting as I walk, so I love the ease of the app with syncing my three devices, seeing current battery charge, and for challenging friends, and tracking achievements.
Fitbit review I use your Fitbit every day. I try to walk 10,000 steps a day, although I am not always successful. I like to track my sleep schedule because it is poor.

Love it I have the Fitbit blaze and I love all the features. It‚Äôs not the newest model so I‚Äôm sure it could be better, but the app lets me track my activity, sleep and my menstrual cycle, which is SO convenient and SUPER accurate. I‚Äôm addicted. I check it everyday. Love this app.

Never leave home with out it!! I truly like my fit bit. Going on 10 years. Never leave without it!!! It makes me want to get up walk/run.  I‚Äôve even lost weight and keeping it off. It is truly a motivator for me!!!

Glitches thanks to new update The app was working just fine before the update on Sunday. Ever since then it hasn‚Äôt been properly tracking my sleep sleep and it‚Äôs taking forever to sync up with my Fitbit. I feel like nothing has been fixed if anything it‚Äôs been worse. Please go back to the original

Love it! I brought a Fitbit about four years ago. Even wore it swimming and it still works. This app has helped me keep track of my steps , physical activity, sleep and now it helps track my menstrual cycle. Love it, highly recommended

‚ù§Ô∏è I actually received my Fitbit as a Christmas gift initially I thought do I need this? And the answer was yes!!!!! I love it to pieces I I like knowing and tracking my sleep I enjoy being in the Fitbit community and I could not imagine not having it anymore so I am 100% a Fitbit girl now!!!

Love my Fitbit Charge 2 I received it as a gift 2 years ago and enjoy looking at what I have accomplished each day. Love the slim fit too. The only thing is that I had to replace the band in the first year it has broke. But other then that I a great item.

Fit bit app It is fun to track your daily activity and compete with your friends. I enjoy seeing the month over month trends in my activity levels. I also find it useful to track my weight using the aria scale. Overall a great experience.

Awesome For years I saw d why would I need this but once o got it everything changed for me.  I now can‚Äôt live without it.  Lots over 20lbs just with increasing my steps,  I have partners in the community app and we keep each other motivated.

Fitbit I love my Fitbit. This helps My sister and I compete with each other and motivate one another.  While keeping track of our progress.  I love that I can track my steps, meals, water intake, tracks my sleep. It has helped me track my heart rate.
Really is wonderful I have been using different Fitbit‚Äôs for several years and having an application that I can track my progress is very helpful. As I change Fitbits the application changes too.

Chief Engineer I love this app, I‚Äôm a fat guy that weighs 246.6 pounds never cared about counting calories or did much physical activities. Since I got my FitBit 3 weeks ago I have lost 10lbs and watching my calories and walking 5 miles a day. Feeling better and looking better.
Still the best health monitor app out there I picked this up five years ago and every year, there‚Äôs a pretender app that attempts to jostle with Fitbit - but nothing comes close.

Knowledge is Power One of the keys to my success has been that trackable data my Fitbit provides. Excellent medium for gathering with friends and competing with one another while also utilizing individual challenges to enhance ones performance outcome!

Love it ‚ÄúWhat gets measured gets better‚Äù is one of those quotes that gets used a lot in the business world.  my Fitbit charge and this app give me just enough accountability keep me improving and I know I‚Äôm improving because I'm able to measure.

I love the app! I love my Fitbit and the app that goes with it. One thing that would make it better would be to have quick adds for custom amounts of water intake. For example, I frequently add 32 ounces of water at a time, and wish there was a way for me to add that to the 8, 16, and 24 ounce button options.

author_name: This is a terrible app man
review_body: App for iPad The app and watches are great...but. The app needs to be better for the iPad and needs a landscape mode (maybe more like the website) right now you need to hold it in portrait mode and everything is out of scale. If it is fixed, I will definitely put down 5 stars.

Easy to use I like the app a lot.  The dashboard is simple and it‚Äôs easy to see how active you are.  The maintenance of the history is also helpful when tracking your progress or looking for context.

App Does Not Work/Inaccurate Since the latest update, the app no longer works and inaccurately records my exercise times and days.  On a day when I worked out for 60 minutes, it only logged it at 11 minutes, and even though I did six days of cardio last week, the app only recorded 2 days.
